Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Debbie C
Reviews.Content: Spent another great weekend at the Plaza and the staff is very helpful and friendly. Pool and beach were great and location is within walking distance of anything you want to do or go. Food was good at restaurant and room service was quick and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and ocean front!”
Reviews.Author: Christine F
Reviews.Content: Just spent a three day weekend at the Plaza Resort & Spa. A real great place. Rooms were very clean. There is some renovation going on, but didn't bother us at all. The staff was very nice and accommodating. Huge pool area and spectacular view from ocean front room! The resort is within walking distance to the band shell and boardwalk where there are numerous restaurants and shops!

Reviews.Title: “When they're Done...at Least Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: mblam7
Reviews.Content: The place is under major remodeling. That being said, they have a very good location (though Daytona Beach is not near the top of my list in this area). The facilities are good. The pool is large and well kept. The pool bar is only O.K. The beach access is very good. The rooms are large enough and the furnishings are also good. Most rooms have some sort of Ocean view. The balconies and oceansde of the buildings have taken a beating over the years and the new owners are trying to bring them back up to snuff. If you book an oceanview room, make sure you ask if your balcony is safely usable.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Ddollero
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit cramped, beds are uncomfortable, no 'resort' features included in the extra $15 a day resort fee....can't even use the hot tub!! Not impressed at all. Check-in is super late and check-out is super early. The place is half empty and we requested an early check-in and we could not be accommodated. Not somewhere we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: m e
Reviews.Content: Registered through hotel.com. Check-in took a longer than normal time. The clerk asked for an addtinal 15.00 per night. We were not advised by hotel.com rep. Once checked in the room had mildew on walls spider webs all around the balcony door. The door woul'nt open, moved to room one floor up. The mildew smell wrinched in the room, purchased air freshners for under bed and on top of ac vent. The front desk clerk service was horrible. We were racially profiled. The staff for maintenance,housekeeping and cafe were good. If you have allergys DO NOT STAY here. The hotel wrinches with an old smell. The mattress was horrible, could'nt wait to get back home to my bed. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: Venetria D
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my choice of hotels. With an ocean view I was able to wake up to a Daytona sunrise. Staff members were very pleasant and helpful. The location was also conveniently located by lots of beach stores as well as the pier. The hotel room was clean and the noise level was minimal partly because of the time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lovejoy M
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at the Plaza Resort and our stays have always been excellent! We keep coming back because the rooms are spacious and beautiful and you couldn't have a better view of the ocean. The staff are very professional and friendly from the front desk to the housekeepers and make you feel comfortable and your stay as pleasant as possible. They go above and beyond to make sure you have a wonderful stay and are happy. I always refer my friends and family to the Plaza Resort. I can honestly say that the Plaza Resort and Spa is the best hotel we've ever stayed at and will continue to!

Reviews.Title: “If you get the room for $10, stay, otherwise run”
Reviews.Author: Michael77775
Reviews.Content: Unclean rooms, even found hairs in the bed! The house is in bad condition. Bathroom dirty and leaking somewhere. Doors to the balcony and main room door open and close only by applying force. We had an oceanview room for $99 per night, which is much more than it is worth. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda V
Reviews.Content: Many people come on this site to write their horrible experiences, but not many think to write a review when they have enjoyed their stay! I came here with a group of family and friends and had a great time. There were many times when we needed to ask the front desk for new cards, because the kids kept misplacing them. They gave new ones to us right away, no hassle! Also me and my friend were locked out of our room (with the key inside of course) and maintenance was on it right away. When my family and I went down to breakfast at the hotel cafe (which I'll admit service wasn't very speedy, but the food was delicious) we were only gone for about an hour. When we got back the room was already picked up, beds made, and a new stock of towels were in the bathroom! Of course the location is nice. On the beach (right by the lifeguard stand, so i knew the little ones were safe for sure!) and not even a mile away from the board walk. Also in front of the hotel was a Walgreens which I stocked up on water and snacks from there, and put in the convenient mini fridge in our room. The elevator music was quite enjoyable as well :) My final thought was how amazing housekeeping was! I left a sweater there and they were very helpful and friendly on returning it to me. It was a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “More To Offer Than You Think”
Reviews.Author: Isaac E
Reviews.Content: As a combat veteran, I have toured the world 3 times over and seen many places. In an economy such as ours with hard times for all; The Plaza offered more than most and at a competitive price. All one has to do is look. For those looking for grand rooms or 5 star service, plan to pay 4 times as much as The Plaza. The rooms are more than enough, clean, and housekeeping is more than willing to accommodate you, just be polite. This is a beach resort and even though the room is big, the bathrooms are not; but you don't spend most of your time in the bathroom I hope. The room was large enough to host guests and the location and resort grounds were great for exploring, so if you plan to stay in the room, go elsewhere. During my stay I noticed a diligent effort in maintenance and remodeling. The management and Lobby staff was extremely helpful, pleasant, and made you feel like a welcomed guest. For those on a budget and not willing to pay resort prices, of course you will be shocked, but The Plaza offers activities, leisure's, and extras the same as other resorts and better prices. My stay was a quiet one and allowed me to relax. The building itself is well manicures and actually looks better than the surrounding hotels, you almost forget you are in a city. Inside, The Plaza is beautiful with all the trimmings of an elegant European look with a tropical flare. I was impressed and very thankful for this "Diamond in the Rough", and in-spite of the prices, I look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest bathroom ever”
Reviews.Author: Leslie B
Reviews.Content: This place would have been great in my 20's for Spring Break. As an adult looking for a relaxing beach front stay, not so much. The first room we reveived was already occupied. The second room had a molding ceiling. The third and final room was ok. It wasn't as clean as I expected or would have liked. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel. There was no counter space and that's terrible for 3 women sharing a space for the weekend. The pool was dirty and the pool furniture was old and rundown. I'll not be returning. There were a few good things. The valet service was great and staff were fantastic. The location was great, because it was right on the beach and walking distance from the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Erika P
Reviews.Content: Not a 3-4 star hotel, dirty is the word that comes to mind. It took 20 minutes to check in, the valet was backed up And the check in staff was slow and on top of that understaffed. Also when getting our car out of valet, you will need to call like 15-20 ahead (they suck) but u will be charged $25 and don't forget to tip..... Elevators are extremely slow, always a line. It took us like 10-15 minutes every time you use them! The rooms are disgusting ! They reak of mold, lhalf the light s didn't work, the remote kept having to be repaired oh I forgot to mention the makeup stains on one of my pillows. The shower they have right off the beach to rinse your feet off is gross, athletes feet waiting to happen! The pool is gross and there is dirt and mold on the tiles, Also in the lobby we found an interesting sight. The leather couches were so dirty someone took their nails and wrote in the dirt things like, "heather was here" and "Rachel loves Jason" . Seriously everyplace you look something needs to be replaced, painted or repaired. We did tell the hotel about our experience and they said nothing but "sorry" This is our second stay, we tried to give them another shot, but we will NOT ever stay again. This place is gross and staff just doesn't give a crap. We will defiantly be staying at the Hilton. At this point who cares if it is double the price

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: drbelcher1
Reviews.Content: Very good location within walking distance to the pier area and other attractions. Rooms were nice and clean. Pool area was nice even showed a movie one night by the pool.Beach access was great. overall experience was good this was our first stay but not our last here when we are in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on beach!”
Reviews.Author: JosieN64
Reviews.Content: There's pro and cons with this place. I'll start with the postive things 1) Great location right on the beach 2) We had an "ocean front" which gave us wide views of the beach and swimming pool area 3) The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. 4) Impressive lobby 5) The pool was nice, warm, and big 6) had a shower/faucet to wash off the sand from the beach area upon returning to your rooms. Okay, now negatives are 1) walls are paper thin!! 2) staff is not very friendly 3) parking garage is fifthy, dark, and feels unsafe!! For a 4-star, I would expect a gate with the slide key to be able to park or go into the resort. Not so... and there is a door coming in from the garage, into the hallway that has no guard or person watching. The garage needed painting really bad and a good cleaning. 4) The bathroom has no cabinets or counter to use for personal items. One pedestal sink only. 5) Resort fees for each day you stay that you aren't told about when you book your stay. 6) Certain areas look very pretty and nice while others are in desperate need of updating. 7) there is a "Hot Tub" but you must pay $10.00 per person/per day to use it.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 night....................”
Reviews.Author: MaryWM
Reviews.Content: I got a low rate for this hotel and since it was for 1 night I was good with it. The downstairs area is very nice and looks quite impressive. The room however was just average and the bathroom was very small and had no counter at all. The room was not very clean either. The room appears clean when you first walk in, but the microwave had crumbs and splatters in it, the refridgerator was dirty ande the top of the bottom cabinets were it met the counter in the "kitchenette" had crumbs and dust in them. The worst was in the bathroom. The sink was a pedestal and the back pipes and hose were clearly visable when you sat on the commode. The pipe and hose has several years worth of dust and grime on it the shower curtain had mold on it. This is not on my list to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Please take heed to what the reviews are saying!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Veyonce
Reviews.Content: A dump with a great lobby and in an excellent location but a dump nevertheless. My kids are grossed out by the pool, there is chipped paint in the room and the place needs a serious make over. Do your research and pay a few dollars extra for comfort. We checked in yesterday and are leaving today moving to another property. It's really that bad. Great staff though!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: berlinfan82
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice but not as nice as the price. Staff was friendly and helpful. Stayed last Friday night and the pool bar wasn't even open, found that hard to believe. It did have a nice pool and lots of lounge chairs around it.

Reviews.Title: “In this case... You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mendi K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean view room that we booked through Priceline.com. We paid a rate of 79.00 per night. If we'd paid more than that for this place I would have been really upset. When we arrived I was immediately impressed by the bellman who was very friendly and helpful. He continued to be very pleasant throughout our trip. The front desk attendant was polite though I wouldn't say he was friendly. The lobby is very attractive. However, the rooms weren't nearly as classy as you'd expect based on that lobby. Upon first look, our room was okay though as our 3 day visit wore on we realized how much in need of repair and a thorough scrubbing it really was. There was a small stain of who knows what on the bottom sheet of one of our beds. The top sheet to that same set was ripped. I specifically asked that the sheets on both beds be replaced by house keeping. And, while the beds were made, the sheets were NOT replaced. Also, we had to make repeated calls to the front desk to ask for items such as extra towels and toilet paper. Generally these things were accomplished by the 3 request. Also, the pool was so dirty. Seriously, Plaza.... People come here for the pool and the ocean. Get it together!!! It's the little things that make a huge impression. Sadly, this is the condition of so many beachfront hotels in Daytona. The hotel's location is good. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to go. Would we stay here again? No, I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a mixed bag....”
Reviews.Author: eraerice
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here from July 24-26th. Staff was polite and I thought our first room was great except that there was no shower liner! (no balcony) but our second room was not so great. The towel bar was falling out of the wall, the bed linens left a lot to be desired and the carpet was gross. Pros. *Location! Location! Location! The beach and sand is gorgeous here and there's an IHOP & a Walgreens within walking distance. We had great service at the IHOP all 3 times we ate there. *Staff was pleasant and even upgraded us to a balcony room the next day free of charge because I asked nicely. *I thought the beds were comfy. Of course, it could be that I was too exhausted from the beach to notice that they weren't... but I stand by that they were comfy. Plenty of pillows. *Plenty of towels! *Checked in early, went really well, no one gave us any grief. Cons: *Pool was gross. Foggy gross. No way I was getting in that! *$15 resort fee PER DAY. This is NOT a resort. Claim the fee is to cover valet and use of the facilities. (What facilites?!?) *Damage on the outside back of building looks dangerous. Definitely need to repair! *Valet was ill prepared for anyones departure. After waiting 15 minutes behind 3 families I grabbed my keys and got the car myself. *Not family friendly. I would NOT take my kids here. Just don't do it. There's a couple other places down the way towards boardwalk that would be better suited for kids. *Power outages. *Elevators are SCARY in their (dis)functionality. *"Free" Internet very seldom worked. I got a pretty decent deal on Priceline, however, I would NEVER pay full price to stay here and if I had known about these "$15 resort fees" per day prior to booking, I wouldn't have booked to stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for condition of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Justsayin81
Reviews.Content: This hotel charges way to much for the quality of the place. First, I'll state the positives I noticed...There was a DJ Saturday outside by the pool and at night they were playing a movie on a huge screen by the pool. The outside bar area looked nice with lots of shade if you wanted to stay out of the sun and there was a cool mister which was nice because it was extremely hot. BUT........We had a room on the 2nd fl near the parking garage. As soon as you walked in from the parking garage, it smells like poop and did the entire stay. I assume it is because the building is so old, and there are restrooms immediately inside the parking garage entrance. The hallways ALL had a bad odor though, and our room did too. Parking is not plentiful and when we went to leave on Sunday morning, some idiot had parked behind our car because there was nowhere else to park. Luckily the 2 spots next to us had emptied and my husband was able to maneuver the car out or we would've had a long wait to leave while they towed the car. As other reviews have said, the bathroom is small and has a pedastal sink, so nowhere to put your stuff. No central air condition (too old I guess) so you have a very noisy air conditioning unit to cool your room. Also, it's true as others have said, the room is noisy, you can hear everything in the hallways and other rooms. The beds were clean and no bugs in the room, but the pillows were the worst I have ever had at a hotel (miniature size & lumpy). Our room had a little fridge, microwave & coffee maker but they were not on any granite counter top as others have said. Ours were stacked on top of each other next to the air conditioning unit. We ate breakfast at the restaurant one morning - all you can eat buffett for $11. The food was OK, but the tables in the restaurant are old and the tops are made out of something that leaves them sticky all the time which was gross. I could of dealt with all of these things if it wasn't for the smell of the place so if you are sensitive to smells, I'd skip this place. Our friends were at the Regency down the road and for the same price per night. Their rooms were immaculate, large, had kitchens with full size fridge, oven, microwave, and dishwasher. And the whole place smelled clean and nice. If they charged half of what they charged us, it would've been worth it, but for this price, I would expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “Not a RESORT!”
Reviews.Author: 31512_traveler
Reviews.Content: Could be a nice place if run correctly. Hotel exterior from the road looks nice however the back has some damage. Lobby is also nice but that is where it ends. Electrical outage left some people stranded on the elevators. Power was out for several hours and it appeared that management was unprepared and did not care about the inconvience it caused its guest especially those with children. Rooms were filthy. Towels were covered in hair!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay. Nice room, but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeOwl
Reviews.Content: We were guests over a weekend in July (Friday-Sunday nights). Check-in was smooth, even though we were early. Room was very nice and clean, although the bathroom was quite small -- not even a vanity surface to store cosmetics, just a small single sink. Nice granite-topped countertop in bedroom, though, complete with microwave and small refrigerator. Our primary problem was being on the 3rd floor. The lobby is actually the 2nd floor and is open to the 3rd. Sound was magnified from the lobby, the lounge, the restaurant, etc. and seemed to funnel into our room at all hours. Also, the air conditioning unit was VERY noisy and on and off frequently. If we opened our sliding glass door onto a small balcony on the back side of the room (overlooking the pool, on the 1st floor level) we had even more sound problems, It was nice having a balcony overlooking the pool, but since it stayed open all the time, and loud music was played at all hours, we did not have much quiet. OK during the day, but not at 1 a.m.! Still, overall, the stay was enjoyable and the pool/beach were great.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: SaltLifeGirl1
Reviews.Content: We are here now and the power is out. Hotel is not prepared for an emergency. Service is very poor. Front desk hangs up on you. Emergency lights did not work at first. No air and we have kids with us. No way to communicate with guests. I also believe the cleaning staff went through our things when we left. We are Floridians and travel to the Florida Tennis Center frequently and will tell all of our USTA friends to stay away from here. I travel often and have never been treated so poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Once Grand now going to Sand”
Reviews.Author: Rolo479
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to downtown and the beach. Parking is decent, but the parking deck is littered with garbage and pigeon poo. The parking area is in need of repair. The lobby is nice, looks as if it has just been remodeled. There was only one clerk at the desk at the time of arrival (and throughout my stay). As I was standing in line on a Monday to be checked in I was able to hear about five complaints about location of rooms, rooms not being clean, or the wrong type of rooms being booked. When I was finally given room keys my family and I went through the lobby up to the room which was on the ninth floor. The hallway needed vacuuming, but not a huge mess. Got into the room, which was clean and smelt nice. Got the type of room I requested. When they updated the rooms they left stuff out like no towel racks in bathroom and cut corners on quality of work; beds were hard too, but sleep-able. Pool was nice, needed a little cleaning and great access to beach. This hotel would be extremely nice if it was renovated correctly and if they would hire more cleaning staff. Looks like the "good ole boy" repair system if you know what I mean. Maid need to clean EVERY day not every other day. Had to call for towels and toilet paper twice!

Reviews.Title: “It's better from the outside.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganPicturechick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK. Just Ok. Kind of rough and dirty by the pool and in the Hallways. under renovation which it needs. Not the cleanest but close to everything. All is within walking distance. Ideal for younger people on a budget, and the only reason I say younger people is due to the crowd it seemed to attract. I would pick something else next time I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Needs fleshing up”
Reviews.Author: B B
Reviews.Content: Very nice location. Older hotel in poor condition for the money. Misrepresented on their web page. Quality is more Days Inn no more than two stars if that. Very disappointing. Priceline $55 web $174 ?????????? Stayed Jul 13,2012. Dirty carpet, musty smell, well worn, needing up dating very badly.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!!!”
Reviews.Author: djwil56
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time while staying at your resort! The lobby was welcoming, the staff very helpful and polite, our room was clean! We will be staying at this resort again!!! Thank you for a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “It should and could be sooo much better”
Reviews.Author: bamafutbal
Reviews.Content: I would have to point fingers at both the hotel manager and the hotel owner(s) for allowing what could be the a fantastic place be so lacking. First of all the hotel manager needs to get more staff on the property and train them better. For instance, at the pool, the garbage cans were overflowing until around 1130am, pool guy finally showed up around 11am, pool area was not cleaned up from previous night (i.e.. towels, lounge chairs not straightened up, they have a towel check out place and it was not ready until around 11 (i was told to go to basement and get a towel if i want one though). In advance, i asked for an early check in (before 4pm) and was told if one is available we could get it. Beginning around 11am i checked at the desk to see if one is available and by 330 i asked and was told again it was not available, luckily another front desk person had arrived, saw my frustration and called housekeeping to see if room is available and of course it was. From walking around the property for 3 days, the employees were just not trained well as they were talking about going out partying, working too much, playing their mp3 player for everyone to hear it etc, just an overall lack of professionalism (manager not doing his job). The grounds for most part looked pretty good, the beach side of hotel had a large piece blown off i assume by a storm that needed repair (no storms lately though), the lobby had a big water leak and left large water bubbles on the ceiling tiles and one had fallen through, the restaurant had several chairs with holes in the seats, our hotel room had a shelf missing in the shower that showed the old glue and mold. The small gym was very nicely painted but the equipment looked bought from a garage sale as a few pieces were rusted and broken. Outside there were more rusted railing than there were clean fresh painted railings. A few other little things that i will remember later. On the positive side, entrance way had new flower beds, bellman (one of them, as the other one was flirting with a housekeeping girl) was very polite, one of the front desk guys was professional, the room was clean, not perfect but better than the budget hotels, some parts of the hotel, looked very well kept with fresh paint. The parking garage appeared safe and well lit and they had valet parking. Food at the restaurant was pretty good and breakfast buffet for $11.00 was not too bad. Overall i will stay again if the price is in low $100's but paying $309.00 night, it was very very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility but not well maintained!”
Reviews.Author: 1murphyisbest
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel for a couple of days. We chose the location for beach access and activities for teenagers. The location itself was great and the hotel itself was beutiful. The pool area was really nice and offered a snack/drink bar. Easy access to the beach and was within walking distance to the pier, Ocean Walk (movie theatre, shops, restaurants, etc). My 1st impression at the front desk was not good. There was one clerk checking in/out guest and also answering phones, taking reservations and communicating with housekeeping staff. She was very rushed and flustered. We had requested rooms close to another family that we were traveling with. She could not accommodate even though the request was made when the reservation was made weeks earlier. My second observation was that there was a musky smell within the hallways of the hotel. Not so much within the room itself but when you open the door to step out into the hallway on the 12th floor it would take your breath. I also noticed this smell when coming in from pool area on the 1st floor. Very offensive!!! Lastly, we stayed for 2 nights and our room was not cleaned during that time. No fresh towels/washclothes. We had to chase down housekeeping on the morning that we were leaving to get clean towels.

Reviews.Title: “Nastiest Hotel I Ever Been !!!”
Reviews.Author: AaronA80
Reviews.Content: Just Yesterday 6/24/12 I tried to Stay in this Hotel that look too nice to be true. My Stay lasted 3 hours if it did Let me Enumerate de Problems 1. Got into the Bedroom and the Toilet had excrement on it 2. Refrigerator was smelling like fish 3. I asked for water in the Bar at the Pool and the Water looked Yellow. 4. Elevator were old and slow 5. Carpets Smell like cigars 6. After Coming from the Pool and Walking on the Beach my girlfriend wanted to take a nap and we notice a smell - We realized that sheets were smelling (not clean yak) and the Pillow has the smell of Humidity 7. They came to change the Sheets and apologized but did not have New Pillows. 8. Finally this top it all. We had bought wine bottle and wanted drink out of the glasses and to our surprise they had the same smell of fish. I will tell you the cleaning crew did there best to fix it but they lack a lot of quality Finally full of low class people specially since is low season. My recondition stay at the Courtyard in the speedway. You cannot go wrong with any courtyard. Good thing they refunded immediately

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach, very deep pool, friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ohdanigirl75
Reviews.Content: When we were there for the Air Show was in town (to our surprise) so we got to sit on the beach and watch. Beach access is quick and easy, our room service breakfast was delivered quickly and tasted great with beautiful presentation. The grand colonade and lobby is gorgeous, there are several beautiful banquet halls overlooking the ocean. We considered having our wedding here, but we wanted a sunset ceremony so we had to chose a west coast beach - otherwise this would have been a perfect location. We had to couple's massage at the spa and it was fabulous. It's walking distance to the band shell for concerts (Elton John played there during one of our stays) and the boardwalk if you want to get off property and eat at a nearby restaurant. We have had several stays in this hotel ranging from 3 to 9 nights and have never had any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Party Event”
Reviews.Author: Larry L
Reviews.Content: Recently I attended a five day event at the Plaza Resort in Daytona Beach and had a wonderful time. The hotel staff really went out of their way to make my stay perfect. The accommodations were perfect. We had a buffet dinner, which I normally do not like, but it was fabulous. The hotel restaurant was reasonable priced with good food and portions. Everything was so clean from the pool area, the beach, the rooms, and the main gathering rooms. I highly recommend this hotel for groups and I intend to make this a location for my personal vacationing in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel for a decent price!!”
Reviews.Author: masce08
Reviews.Content: We booked this through a Groupon for 4 nights and I have to say I was very suprised based upon reviews. We checked in and were sent to our room, which had a ocean view looking north. The room was quaint and nice with everything you need at a hotel. Yes, the bathroom has very little space for "Product" but you can do with the space provided or as one guest suggested bring the patio table into the bathroom or ask for a small table. The AC was a little loud but that is typical of a Wall AC units. We stayed there Wednesday through Sunday and I will say the elevator was slow on the weekend, but it was not unbearable. I ran 3 miles north and 3 miles south on the beach and I will say 90 percent of the places north and south looked like dumps. I was very happy with our choice. The bartender Debi in the Veranda Lounge was great. In addition, the housekeeping staff may be minimal but they did a great job servicing our room and Friday night there was an MMA fight at the hotel and they were totally overworked! Overall great stay despite the weather!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle J
Reviews.Content: This hotel I booked on Groupon was the biggest mistake I've ever made in my traveling experience. When I got to the hotel it had a stale smell in the lobby of the hotel and throughout. Stood in line to check in it took about 10 minutes with nonchalant workers at the front desk. I shouldn't have guess this hotel was no going to work for me when I heard the elevator mechanic over the loud speaker talking about he didn't fix the elevator and my other clues was the engineer walking around the lobby. Also, we was charged a $15.00 resort fee for this run down hole in the wall. The staff here is not inviting or friendly. Our balcony door didn't lock and the worst we are over the hotel air conditioner can't heAR anything. Ask the bellhop about the jacuzzi he said in a NONCHALANT way OH our JACUZZI is broke so I call the front desk to inquire about the jacuzzi the front desk say oh we have an jacuzzi but it's on open from 9-5pm and it's a 10.00 REALLY GET THE HECK OUT OF HERE EXACTLY WHAT I WANT TO DO. STAY AT THE WYNDHAM HOTEL IT LOOK WAY BETTER THEN THIS MESS. RUN THE OPPOSITE WAY FROM THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Linda O
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Plaza. The staff was wonderful and the hotel was clean and beautiful. Great location in Daytona, convenient walking distance to shopping and restaurants. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisette G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Very clean. Great service. Quiet. Gave us plenty of privacy. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel thats understaffed and need repairs”
Reviews.Author: harleyglidegwr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful but is in need of repairs and a few more workers as they are working with a skeleton crew.To say HOUSEKEEPING is lax that would be a understatement.The magnolia restaurant in the hotel has some good food however is dirty and wheres the hostess they seem to be never around how in the world .you going to get customers is beyond me.The pool bar was opened the last day i was there as there was no one to man it. My room never vacuumed the hallway also ,elevator stuck on the sixth floor just a lot of bad things i didn't appreciate for the price i payed.They seem to clean only the lobby.This is one beautiful hotel however it has to be the most mismanaged hotel ive ever been to .They never once cleaned the pool.My room had a great view but the balcony had loose concrete in the corner with pieces that fell off piled to the side of my deck chairs. Come on someone has to see this.The hotel is simply a show palace that need a makeover as i couldnt beleive the understaffing it seem like no one cared ill leave it at that.It seem like no ones in charge!

Reviews.Title: “Poor management & unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: SaundraPlover
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my adult children for 3 nights and was disgusted at the lack of professionalism and respect. Upon arrival the front desk employee {who claimed to be a night manager-we later found out he was not a manager} did not know how to check us in & had to ask for assistance.from another person who told him rudely to "chill" and then assisted him. We had to ask everyday to have someone clean our room.-no one came until after 4:00 p.m. each day! Our toilet overflowed (improper seal on the base of the toilet) the water overflowed into the hallway & covered about 1/4 of our room. We were moved to another room which the lights did not work & there was a huge bug in plain sight upon entering. We told the front desk this and he said " WHAT DO YOU WANT ME TO DO" The bartendar Duane was very rude, slow & unprofessional. Needless to say this place needs a complete STAFF & hotel makeover. We did find another hotel the remainder of our stay in Florida and it was exceptional!!!! All the people traveling with us are professionals and very well traveled. A word of advice-find a nice place to stay where the staff shows pride in thier work & care about thier customers!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Penny317
Reviews.Content: I recently stay for four nights at the Plaza Resort and Spa located in Daytona Beach. The experience was a great one. Everyone, including the front desk staff, restaurant staff, spa staff and housekeeping staff, were very nice. The room was very clean and very spacious. It was everything I hoped and more. I have read the negative reviews concerning this hotel. However, during my stay, I never experienced nor witnessed ANY of the problems I have read. The location cannot be beat. Everything is within walking distance. Cars are not permitted on the beach in front of this hotel which is a huge plus. The restaurant prices were very reasonable, and the food was delicious. I highly recommend this hotel. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional staff, faulty rooms”
Reviews.Author: racheallikesdirt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with a groupon deal with three other people. Upon check in, the front desk had no idea what a groupon was, and assumed he was to charge me for a full 3 day price in addition to what I had already payed. The first afternoon myself and my group wanted to hang out by the pool area and have some drinks. While walking out to find a spot the hotel bartender (Duane) ran out from behind the bar yelling at us rudely about having glass in the pool. He ripped the drink out of our friends hand assuming she was underage. She and another member of our group left, to take the beer back to the room. After finding a spot the bartender continued to further harass us, asking for the names and room number for the people in our group. We told him to leave us alone and he called hotel security on us. This is NO way for any service employee to treat paying guests. Another issue, our toilet was running the whole time we were there and ended up clogging on us late the 3rd night of our stay. The toilet ended up having to be pulled for maintenance and we were moved into a different room with flickering lights and a dead bug in the closet. Upon notifying the hotel staff, we were directed to a man who claimed to be a manager (who we later found out was not) He just laughed about the situation and told us he "did not know what he could do to remedy the situation". However, upon checkout we were able to speak with another manager who was very courteous and helpful, and said she would notify her boss of the issue. In addition to the rate given by the hotel there is also a $15 daily hotel services fee along with state tax and federal tax so i ended up paying an additional $72 dollars. Overall, a poorly run hotel in need of updates and better hotel staff management. This was the worst hotel experience I've had and definitely would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved The Plaza Resort and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: I use Priceline all the time and needed a room in Daytona Beach for 2 seperate trips in a 2 week period. The 1st stop I would be by myself on business and the 2nd I would have my wife and 3 year old daughter along for a vacation. I use Priceline all the time for business and was pleased to win a 3.5 star bid on the beach for $60 a night. After I learned it was the Plaza, I researched the reviews of the property and became concerned that they had received many negative reviews about the quality and service provided on the posters visits. I have a very high opinion for Priceline's star ratings. And I found it very suprising that a property that they have rated 3.5 stars would not be of high quality and service. So I arrived there for my business trip with an open mind, but also with open eyes for any of the concerns of the reviewers. From the moment I arrived the staff treated me with the upmost courtesy. Julie at the front desk and Pat in the adminstrative office were tremendously helpful. They were always helpful in locating stores or restaurants. I was directed to The Oyster Pub across the street which is a great place to watch a game and eat dinner. My needs were always met with a smile and the assurance that if I needed anything else they would be there for me. The rooms are a little older and the bathroom slightly small, but they have obviously been upgraded recently with small kitchenette with refrigertor, microwave, sink and cabinets. The King bed was very comfortable and both rooms had a new 42-inch flat screen TV. I was upgraded to Oceanview for both trips and the porch with chairs and table made for a very enjoyable experience. The elevators were older, but we had no issues with them on either occassion. The resort has tremendous location. It is located right in the middle of the action of Daytona Beach There are great bars, restaurants and shops within walking distance. The pool area with bar and grill is right on the beach and provides a nice, clean environment to get away from it all. After my initial visit, I could not wait to bring my wife and duaghter back for a visit. We had planned to stay 2 nights, but we were enjoying ourselves so much we ended up staying an additional night. My daughter loved the pool and the beach so much! We ate breakfast at the resort each morning and received great food at a reasonable price. We are looking forward to our next trip to Daytona Beach and will definitely be staying at The Plaza Resort and Spa! Don't always believe the negativity that you read. I saw none of what I read about the Plaza. I received great value for our stays and the Priceline 3.5 star rating was earned.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful beach, nice pool, great lobby bar, rooms suck”
Reviews.Author: Elitaste
Reviews.Content: I was in Daytona for 3 nights. The staff is very friendly. We rented a conference room for a photoshoot and it was great. The rooms are dingy and slightly depressing. The bed is kinda wack. Looby bar was great. Debi the bartender was awesome. The pool area has a nice vibe and the beach is stunning. I think this is more indicative of Daytona overall than the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “service SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: christy v
Reviews.Content: We checked in this morning and are staying through Mother's Day weekend. The location is great, beach is beautiful, pool is nothing fancy, (king ocean view) room is just average, and the service absolutely sucks!! Since it's a mother's day getaway, we wanted to order breakfast in bed... A special treat we normally don't do. We can't get a straight answer from anyone about anything! What time does the restaurant open? Either 530am or 7am, not sure. Ordering room service? Call back later, no wait, call in the morning, no wait- hang a door tag menu before 2am. Oh, you want a door tag menu?? I'm not sure where to get one. We will bring it to you. (They didn't) After calling the restaurant twice AND guest services twice, we finally went down and got one. This normally wouldnt be a huge deal except we have been trying to figure this out since 4pm and now after 830pm, my 2 year old is past her bedtime and needs to go to sleep. They guest services person told.me "well, you have until 2am to place the door tag menu on your door". Not the point buddy... My kid needs to sleep. Have they never done room service before? I hope this is some amazing breakfast after all that!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North Las Vegas, Nevada, United States
Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Bobby H
Reviews.Content: I just spent 10 wonderful relaxing days at this charming resort. My room was a corner room which gave me two balconies breath taking views of the ocean, Well worth the price I paid. Although the room is starting to look dated it was clean & well maintained.The staff was friendly & polite.The visit to the spa was wonderful, I will always remember this vacation as a special one. I do know I will be back again next year,

Reviews.Title: “Dinner in Magnolia's was a disaster”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average.......the service was good- .........was put on the first floor 111....left a bit to be desired......next time around will ask to be put on the upper floors......the convention was run impeccably......

Reviews.Title: “be VERY suspicious”
Reviews.Author: parafrog
Reviews.Content: There is a disturbing trend with the reviews of this property. Most who rate it highly are submitting their first review and by some coincidence are Florida residents. Hopefully Trip Advisor will take some action to triage fact from fiction. Having personally stayed at this property it is to your advantage to not consider lodging at this location. It is, without question, a dump.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iris C
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Plaza at least two times a year with two different groups. I find the staff to be exceptionally helpful and friendly. Once, about four years ago and on this trip I asked to be moved to an ocean front room because that's the charm of Daytona Beach. No problem! I love the balconies looking straight out onto the ocean or, two balconies with a straight ocean view and a north or south view as well. The meeting rooms are beautiful, most with ocean views. There is free parking available in a covered basement which I find very handy. The beds are comfortable, the TV is nice, there is a kitchenette in the room. Yes, the bathroom is small, but did I mention that I can lie in bed and hear the ocean and watch the sunrise?

Reviews.Title: “Bait & switch”
Reviews.Author: flgirl34709
Reviews.Content: We were part of a wedding group that booked a block of rooms at this hotel. Without prior notice, the entire group was moved to a much lesser quality hotel next door. No advanced notice, no reduction in rate. I travel a lot & have NEVER had this happen before. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and a very rude manager”
Reviews.Author: Aaron W
Reviews.Content: I stayed the week of Spring Break for the weekend and 2 additional days. The hallways smelled of mold, the room was dirty, and for a hotel that calls itself a resort the services and food at dinner were dismal. To make matters worse when I complained and it was ignored by the people at the desk I demanded to speak to the General Manager, I think his name was Rob or Bob. He called me the nest morning. Instead of finding solutions to my problems he proceeded to make excuses and would not let me get in a word edgewise. He just would not be quiet long enough to listen. I have never written a review before but I am a Platinum member of a major hotel chain but they did not have one of theirs in daytona so I chose this dump and wished I never had. I travel alot, I am not some kid on spring break just trying to get over, I think the hotel needs to be cleaned up and needs to offer the level of service they advertise and give a class on customer service to its management and front desk. It is not the customers fault when they complain of filth, mold and mildew. They did give me brakfast vouchers that I did not use. The one good thing was the location and the ocean view rooms but beware that alone does not make up for poor dinners, dirty rooms, and rude people.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities do not make up for filth.”
Reviews.Author: Elaine J
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here on april 9-10th. I would not recommend this hotel. Upon first entrance into room 820 I knew it had not been thoroughly cleaned. The room did not smell fresh - it had a mildewed smell. The window was filthy. The faucet fixtures where poorly wiped down or not cleaned at all. You could see that the bathroom faucet was wiped down with what looked like a dirty cloth because there were cloudy streaks on it. YUCK. You could also tell the towels where folded in a rush because two of them where on the ground when we walked in - they fell out of their "design". They have these "clean remotes" but the remote obviously was not cleaned because there was sticky goo on the front. I ended up taking a wash cloth and anti bacterial and cleaning it MYSELF before letting my husband pick it up. The tile floor by the kitchenet and the bathroom, also not thoroughly cleaned. And the kicker - the tub was completely clogged. Overall, gross, and glad we only paid for one night here. Save your money. It's not even worth it on a discounted rate. I've stayed in 2 star hotels cleaner than this. Amenities do not make up for filth.

Reviews.Title: “Reluctant to Leave...”
Reviews.Author: D F
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night stay for a large group and was thoroughly impressed by the accommodations. Not only did we receive the rooms for a generous rate but they were far more spacious than I had expected. The oceanfront views were first-class and the suites had two separate balcony views of Daytona Beach which were great at sunset. The size of the pool deck was impressive and even though it was warm when we visited, having a heated pool available to us was great when it got cooler at night. In short, we were all reluctant to leave by the end of the weekend. Next time we visit Daytona, we already know where we'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Clean the rooms”
Reviews.Author: MATEENCLEAVESFAN
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the hotel room - there were long hairs all over the bathroom and entry way floor. It was quite disgusting - we called right away and were told it would be taken care of right away. Two calls later and it was still never taken care of until the maid came the next day at 4pm. The housekeeping was disgusting - they didn't even empty garbage cans or clean the sinks. Basically the only thing that was done was the blanket was folded. Probably would have been cleaner staying at the Budget Lodge for $19.99 down the street. Also - the community bathrooms in the pool area smelled like a wet cat soaked in urine. However, the location was in a good spot but I'd go with the Hilton next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Floridian004
Reviews.Content: Checked in on March 30th and planned to stay until April 7th, but because of an emergency had to check out on the 4th. Our first night we ended up moving to another room at 1:00 a.m. because my husband woke up to bites all on his back. Before that their were 4 large roaches in the room so I should have known what was coming next. The next morning the Manager came and took me back into my room and explained what they were going to do about our room. We were compensated with a complimentary breakfast, in my opinion we should have been upgraded because of all the inconvenienced that was placed on us. In my opinion I will not stay here again because once you add the Resort fee, and other charges you might as well pay for the Hilton. After the first night I think my entire Spring Break was spoiled because of all the inconvenienced.

Reviews.Title: “Bike Week, Fantastic Hotel ! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Spa Beach Resort for the 1st time on Sunday March 11th thru Friday March 16th. From start to finish the hotel and staff were fantastic! Before I made the reservation, I read all the reviews on here and was a little worried about staying there. We stayed in 809 (studio) and it was exactly like the pictures on the hotel website. The bathrooms have pedestal sinks, yes, but there are glass shelves ubove the toliet to put your things on. There are frames (2 inches,maybe) around the sliding glass doors, yes, that make you take a step over it to get to the other side... but no big deal. The balcony had 2 chairs and a table, it was the perfect size and perfect view. The pool area was very nice, clean, they have a pool bar, but it wasnt open. I didnt get in the pool to check the temperature but it was super clean. There is a very nice restraunt and lounge in the hotel, there is a very nice convenience store in the hotel lobby, if they didnt have what I needed, Walgreens was directly across the street. You are able to easily walk to Main Street and the Boardwalk. I see alot of recent posts about the elevator, we had NO problems, but when Thursday rolled around , alot of people were checking in for the last weekend of Bike Week and it was really busy, the elevator stopped at every floor for people getting on and off.... I think the elevator issue was due to the number of people using it.... There was 24 hour security out front for the motorcycles parked there, those guys were wonderful too. When I got home I emailed the hotel because I had a question about a charge on my credit card (something I forgot about) and BOB the vice president called me back 15 minutes after I sent the email. The Plaza Resort and Spa exceeded my expectations, the place is absolutely wonderful, I would buy one if I was able to spend more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here”
Reviews.Author: ann d
Reviews.Content: I read the earlier reviews and the many complaints regarding the elevators, but figured that they would be fixed. Well don't count on it. Three elevators, one working, sometime. An extremely frustrating time. Didn't dare leave beach/pool area, once I got there, to go back up to room (8th floor) because not sure if I would get back to beach/pool area before sunset!! A friend of mine was on 14th floor and waited 45minutes for elevator, (would of taken stairs, but was checking out with luggage). You would think, the management knows how many rooms, how many people per room, and the need for elevators to be working should be a priority. Housekeeping changed out towels and washcloths and only replaced towels, NO washcloths. The young lady at check in said I had a city view room. obviously she had never been in that room. The only view was a cement wall and angle view of ocean, no balcony. Restroom near pool is moldy and dirty. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Slept in the elevator”
Reviews.Author: Arielle D
Reviews.Content: We were in Deland Florida and found out we needed to stay in town for two nights at the last minute. So I booked a one night room on Orbitz to stay at the Plaza resort and spa . When we got to the hotel lobby at 8 pm it seemed nice and quite. The young lady at the desk could not check us in because Orbitz had not sent our confirmation yet to the hotel. I had my print out confirmation but it was not good enough for the hotel to give us our room. So we had to get on the phone and cancel with orbitz ( as you can imagine that was a 1 hour nightmare) Long story short we got our room. On the way up I noticed the hotel was dirty, carpets looked like they had not been vacuumed in a year. Our room was small but ok. Windows were dirty, again about 1 years worth of fingerprints. Actually all the glass doors were like that in the hotel. The bed was comfortable but the sheets were too short, you could not pull them up. ROOM 1401 is up next to the back wall of the elevator. All night long you hear and feel like you are in the elevator. The bathroom was small but clean. Will not stay there again, because for what you pay to Hotel should be clean!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, but worst fear came true too”
Reviews.Author: BeachBums34484
Reviews.Content: When booking a room I did not realize it was bike week...we booked online about 3 weeks prior to our stay. I was ok with the bike week! We book an oceanfront with balcony, king size room. Navigating to the hotel was kind of a pain- it is right on the main strip in Daytona, but the main "loop" entry was filled with bikes, and was clearly partitioned for only bike parking. This meant we needed to go directly to the parking garage. For us, we already passed that entrance trying to get to the main blocked off entrance. Wish there was more signage so we weren't circling A1A for 15 minutes in bike week traffic. Parked the car and went to check in. Check in is clearly stated as being 4pm and it was only 2. We figured worst case we could leave the car and chill on the beach until 4. However, they were more than happy to take us and we were checked in right away. We were offered either the 3rd or 6th floor...we chose 6. And soon enough, I would wish we had chose 3. I know I had read 2 complaints here- 1: the moths and 2: the amenity fee. Right on the check in desk they had a sign with a picture of the moth and a statement saying this time of year they can be bad, keep your balcony door closed at night to reduce the number of them. No biggy, I live in FL I can deal. The amenity fee was expected, and she still clearly read over what it covered and when it would be charged. So off to our room. Upon walking in, it appears really nice. The size is great, the layout is great, I love the balcony wish has a real oceanfront view, and my husband loves the 42 in TV. The "kitchenette" is a tiny microwave, small fridge and a counter with a coffee maker. Not that I expected to be cooking, but thought it would be bigger. Once in the room I start to look around and notice these black splotches all over. It looks like someone killed huge bugs, and it smeared. Now these spots were all over the ceiling, the walls, and the moulding. They were about 2-3 inches long and an inch wide. These spots along with the moth sign, made me think thats what they were. Not a huge deal, but when you are just sitting in the room you realize how gross it really is. The only other thing that bothered me in the room was that when I sat or slept in the bed, I could smell a musty/moldy smell. Made it hard to get comfortable. When I walked into the bathroom, I would get a quick whiff of a pee smell, but it would go away quick. Like maybe one corner hasn't been clean in a really, really long time. So those couple things really ate at me and it was really hard to just relax and be comfortable. Now- we unload and we decide to go out for a bit to shop. Here is where I lose it. Hop in the elevator...bike week...elevator is FULL. Going down 6 floors aaaaaand it stops. We are officially STUCK IN THE ELEVATOR. This is my worst fear come true. I hate elevators. I immediately start rifling through my purse to find my phone to call the hotel or something...I didn't really know what to do. Luckily it only lasted a couple of minutes and we shake, and drop a couple inches at a time until it comes to a rest and one of the other guests pulls the doors open. So from this point on, we take the stairs. Up 6 flights, down 6 flights.... It rained all weekend so we were not able to use the pool or any other amenities the hotel offered. We spent most of our time out on the town so I cannot comment on anything else really. We did order food in one night from a local place and it was delivered without silverware. I wanted to call the front desk to see if we could get some here, and realized there was no info in our room- no numbers to the desk, room service, anything like that. So we did hike the 6 stories and the restaurant employee was nice enough to hook me up with some silverware. Just wish they had better communication in the room. Also- on our second day the housekeeping never showed up until about 4:30 pm. At that point I just asked for some towels and extra coffee and skipped having them clean the room. Strange it was so late? Would I stay here again...probably only because of the location but I would definitely try other places before this one.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more pleased”
Reviews.Author: magFl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during bike week, oh my ! It took us 1 hour and 15 minutes to go 5 miles from the speedway to the hotel. I expected to find harried people behind the desk and to encounter some problem for sure. The lobby was packed. Well , we were greeted with smiles and treated as if we were their only guests. Lobby is beautiful, with views of the ocean and the sun coming up was awesome. We were given a room upgrade, be still my heart, with a small patio overlooking the ocean. Would we come back ? Absolutely !!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price they charge”
Reviews.Author: MiNena77
Reviews.Content: Very pricey for what you get. We had dirty sheets & the kitchenette is practically useless b/c it doesn't have the stuff you need. We booked by phone - asked for a 2 room suite, got a studio upon check-in. Staff wasn't very helpful but the manager went above and beyond to accommodate us during a very busy time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Play to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shock93
Reviews.Content: I was worried about some of the reviews about this place. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean, close to Main Street for Bike Week. I have never written a review about the several hundred hotels I have stayed at and decided I should write one for the Plaza. Although not as elegant as the Plaza in New York and not owned by the same company, nor does it try to be. If you are looking for that you may want to try somewhere else, and not Daytona Beach. Housekeeping did a great job, fast and clean. The bathrooms are small, a buddy of mine was not happy with the size. But I could care less about bathroom size, as long as I can get in there and take a shower and shave. All in all I can not find one thing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: EricTaub
Reviews.Content: Have been coming here for many years, love the service and the staff is always very accommodating. The rooms are very clean and are always well-kept. The refrigerator is convenient and the televisions are new flat panel units. The view of the ocean is great from every room we have stayed in. My family will continue to return in the coming years as we have always been treated well and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff that were Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: flycastermaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed there again this year (5th year in a row) and were awed again by some of the staff and their professional and positive smiling demeanor. We would like to say that upon check-in we were greeted by Debi (sic) and she is a positive force behind the front desk. Cheerful, dressed professionally, full of information and on and on. Can't say enough about her. She was there are check-out as well so we got a double dose of this professional woman's touch. In the Magnolia Restaurant on site, Sarah greeted us at 2:30 p.m. in afternoon with a great smile, and a serving attitude. She was such a nice person while we were dining. Very nice to have someone like her there after a long day. Made us relax and really enjoy our delicious chicken sandwich. Thanks for these two exceptional employees that made our stay better. We were there March 2 - 4 and loved it. P. Roberts

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: laurie g
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay the employees, debi kaupert and moh coulibaly were exceptionally accomodating and helpful the entire staff was polite and friendly our room was beautiful and the maid service employees were sweet and efficient i couldn't have been happier on this visit!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it !”
Reviews.Author: Amytony
Reviews.Content: I was ok with the fact that my ac was not working they fixed it quickly. They charge u 15 per day (without telling u until u leave). They said it was for all kinds of services like valet which we3 never even used. So don't think u have paid the full amt. The room was nothing like the advertised picture. They give u 1 tiny blanket that won't kep u warm at all. The hotel smelled like mold all over the place there were A LOT of flies & moths in the hotel room. The so called renovations were mostly spent on the outside of the hotel I wouldn't recommend u stay here go to best western or ocean walk!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Debi I had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: patracefan
Reviews.Content: Commendations go to Debi at the front desk who patiently enabled me to view several different room types before finding just the right match for my needs. The rooms are large, clean, comfortable and completely equipped with fridge, microwave and 2 burners. There is a computer in the lobby. Most of the time I hate resort fees, but $15 per day covered self or valet parking and wireless internet so I received value in return. Hotel is right on the beach in a great central location with a large pool/recreation area. The outside needs a little maintenance, but that did not diminish the overall A+ stay I enjoyed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel near the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Jwcancel
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel for the price, rooms are not new, but the look pretty decent and upgraded with LCD TV. Very close to the beach and within walking distance to Ihop, surf shops and other restaurants and amenities. Nice view from the rooms (the one that I stayed)Stayed there for training but I would not mind to bring the family to this hotel. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steven S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has some age, but it is kept up well and the Staff was very helpful. We only stayed 1 night but we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: beachsunfun37
Reviews.Content: Our room was one of the cleanest hotel rooms I have stayed in. The room was a good size and I didn't hear noises from our neighbors. Had a balcony with an a/c that didn't leak. The hallways were enclosed and I felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms where outdated and with old warned furniture.”
Reviews.Author: Lovie L
Reviews.Content: No bed linen for the sofa bed. Capet dirty just nasty for the money. Could have stayed at the Motel 6 for that matter. Would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great but that's it”
Reviews.Author: RozzyW
Reviews.Content: Family weekend get a way at the Plaza. Checked in Fri night into room directly on beach with balcony . View is wonderful. Paper thin walls. Had to call desk 3 times regarding loud t. And music from another room. On third call we got moved to new room, without help with our bags and without apology. Room was lower level which was quiet. Room was good size but bathroom is smallest ever. Even smaller than a cruise ship cBin bathroom! Entire bath, carpet and walls look worn and need updating as does the tv. We ate breakfast in hotel restaurant in the morning. Food was average but service slow! Waitress was very pleasant but we had to ask for everything----cream for coffee, syrup for pancakes. There is a resort fee daily. I am not sure for what. There are no chairs for the beach. Pool is average. We attempted to use the hot tub @ 4:40 pm but learned it closed at five. ?? Really?? So, I would not stay here again. There are plenty of other hotels directly on the beach to choose from. All in all, location on the beach is wonderful. But there are other options and I would not choose this one again.

Reviews.Title: “I do recommend this place!”
Reviews.Author: L M
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here dec. 28th thru jan1st. Had reservations at Hilton but after reading all their negative reviews I cancelled those and waited until I arrived at Daytona Beach to find a room. Been staying in Daytona for numerous years but have never stayed in the main st. area. Gave Hilton a chance upon arrival, looked at their room...just as reviews said...horrible! Went to the Plaza asked to see one of their rooms and I was very satisfied. Lucy at the front desk was so helpful! The room is very spacious, the only draw back was the pedestal sink...that needs to be changed. The room did have worn carpet,but it was clean! Our socks were not black from walking on the carpet! For this being a tourist city bringing in a wide range of visitors, I think you will find this place very accommodating. Get location, great view, very good room. I have already made reservations to return there!

Reviews.Title: “Great News Years Eve 2010”
Reviews.Author: DavidSF6
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel I had some trepidations. However, this is a wonderful place. The staff's customer service was equal to a 5 star hotel and friendly. The accomodations were clean and spacious. The New Years Eve package was a tremendous value. The band at the NYE dinner and dance party (SHO-NUF) were talented. We plan to follow their schedule and go dance where they are playing. The food was tastely prepared and presented both in the restaurant and at the NYE party. The only reason I didn't rate this with 5 stars is that the pool area needs some work but if the management team make the same effort to fixing up the pol area as they do at making your hotel stay pleasant, then I am sure they will get 5 stars next time we stay here. See you at the 2012 NYE party. P.S. Bring back SHO-NUF. Thank you for a pleasant way to bring in the new year.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: UkCags
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay, last time was in 2009. It does need some TLC (tender loving care). Lobby is fab, pool are great. Bedrooms ok but bed had a spring poking out the side which caught my leg and the towel rail fell off. We would stay again as the hotel is clean etc

Reviews.Title: “needs total renovation”
Reviews.Author: HellyMbro
Reviews.Content: I took against this hotel as soon as we checked in. Was initially very excited as was told we'd been upgraded to a suite. . Our room was on the 7th floor. It was dingy. There were many many marks on the walls and stains on the grubby carpet. The wardrobe doors were virtually hanging off. there were holes inside the wardrobe. The bedspreads had stains on and i found a stain on my sheet that obviously hadn't come out in the wash. We had a twin room, even though i'd requested a king, and each bed was small. Our window overlooked another rooms balcony which had chipped and peeling paint and plasterwork. The bathroom was small and dark and had nowhere to put your stuff. The shower was quite strong which was the only plus point. There was a sofa bed in the lounge area which looked grubby and worn and had the stuffing peeking out underneath the cushions. Our TV didn't work so I did contact maintenance and to give them credit the guy who came to sort it out was very good. We should really have contacted reception and asked to be moved to a different room but thought that if this was an upgrade what on earth were the other rooms like. I'd also decided that our three night stay would become a begrudging one night stay. Position wise its right on the beach and quite near the boardwalk - which was quite busy but concretey and a bit tatty. all in all i'd not risk it!! Then found out we had to pay $8 a day parking and $2 to use the safe in the room

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: xjsracer44
Reviews.Content: Better than expected - clean and comfortable spacious room with friendly and helpful staff. We booked an Ocean View room for my wife and I plus our two sons (20 & 21) whilst we were racing at Daytona Speedway. The hotel obviously lives on its past reputation and could probably do with a refurb, but we found it clean and spacious and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “the Plaza is a dump”
Reviews.Author: Philpoo
Reviews.Content: The Plaza must have been elegant in the 1970's. the problem is the only change to the hotel since then is the flat screen TV in the rooms. The rooms are furnished with decor that came either from your grandmother's house or Goodwill. The bathroom was 5X5 with a pedestal sink and NO place for your tolietries. There is a shelf that towels are put on so if you have more than a comb and brush you are out of luck. the room was musty, the door jambs were loaded with what looked like rust. there was NO phone in my room. the b ig plus is that it is right on the beach with a spectacular view. If this does not m atter to you, it is basically a Days Inn equivalent, with all due respect to the Day's Inn

Reviews.Title: “suited the purpose”
Reviews.Author: mjla434
Reviews.Content: Also was there for Biketoberfest. the A/C in our room was so extremely noisy that we had to scream at each other to speak. The front desk had no other rooms, so finally a maintenance guy came up and had to switch units. Looked like the original A/C had never been replaced before. After two hours, he replaced the A/C unit with another one that barely worked. Had to return a 3rd time to our room and jammed the handle on the a/c so it would work and we couldnt use the controls on the wall. The resort fee is a total rip-off, $15 a day, for nothing. Pass on the buffet breakfast, and go eat somewhere else, its not worth it. The only thing good about this place is the location. I also used priceline and paid 110 plus the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: This place should never be considered 4 or 5 star. It looks really nice from the outside. The lobby is beautiful. Our room was filthy, the balcony looks likes its never been cleaned off. The indoor a/c unit had paint peeling off of it and was very dirty. The indoor and outdoor pool bar was closed, didn't open until 5. The person who worked the rest. refused to bring our food to us, said she would call us when the food was ready! Some room service. Pool wasn't heated either. They need to have someone really clean these rooms! We bought through Groupon and so glad we didn't pay full price!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Citygirl1218
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Plaza in September. The outside was gorgeous but the interior was a disappointment. It needs to be updated. The parking garage needs to be repaired (falling plaster) and painted. The top level of the garage has poor lighting at night and the entrance from there has the guests trying to maneuver their luggage down 3 steps to get to the lobby to take the elevator. The rooms were nice with a balcony overlooking the beach. It was great to sit out there at night and listen to the waves. The rooms are spacious for 2 people. The bathroom was small with one pedestal sink and no shelving for my toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for Biketoberfest 2011”
Reviews.Author: lisa m
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, the front desk personal was absolutely wonderful...Thank you Andres for all your assistance during our stay. The room was good size with all the amenities and a wonderful view of both Ocean and City from the balcony. Didn't have time to visit much within the hotel or pool since we were out most of the time. We look forward to seeing you all again for March - Bike week 2012! Thank you :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Walt L
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for Biketoberfest 2011 (Oct 2011). Unpacked during daylight, went to town, and upon return early am discovered the room had no power, except in the bathroom. No other lights or TV...NADA! Nothing could be done at 01:30 am. At 07:45 I was awakened by the lights coming on. Had power the rest of the stay and the Manager comped the resort fee, but nothing else. If I had been in the room Friday evening trying to watch TV I would have raised more hell, but just returned to slleep. It was a hectic time for the staff, as many thousands of us "Bikers" in town, but heard of other instances where people were moved from one room to another, then back again. I think the front desk staff tries har (like Debi), but the $ just aren't being spent on maintenance. This is a VERY old facility (formerly the Clarendon) that has been upgraded, but not to the standard of a new facility. The elevators are old, creaky, slow, and the operating permits expired in August 2011. I had Pricelined the room at 1/2 off normal, but if it wasn't Biketoberfest (high demand) it wouldn't have been worth even $60 a night. The coffee shop/snack bar is expensive ($2 cup of coffee), and did not use the Magnolia Room to eat, nor the pool or other facilities. The hype at the website...doesn't live up to it. The room was very narrow, the AC uncontrollable (like the knob was disconnected, had to eventually unplug it from the wall...heard another guest complain his was set at 85) the bathroom cramped, tub didn't drain...basically a Motel 6 (or worse), but the pillows and bed were very comfortable. Would I stay there again...probably not unless it was $60 night instead of the $125 Pricelined rate ($249 is their normal rate, plus resort fee). Even then, would think twice...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: pmessore
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on the north side of Daytona Beach. Has old world charm with some modern amenities. We enjoyed the pool and the beach. The room was a good size with flat screen TV, two double beds, table and counter with coffee maker, Microwave and fridge. Bathroom was a little small, but serviceable. The staff were friendly and helpful, although we had very little interaction with them. We were on the 10 floor, corner room and heard absolutely nothing in the halls! This part of Daytona Beach has a lovely shoe and ocean, but we were disappointed that there was very little upscale shopping nearby - only T-shirt shops and cheapo-gift shops. Extra costs: We paid for parking valet service every day and don't know if the hotel has other parking options...it was more than we wanted to spend...but we got the hotel on Priceline and got a great rate, so I guess it all comes out in the wash!

Reviews.Title: “dump dump dump”
Reviews.Author: peyton H
Reviews.Content: What a dump! This place is old so I guess the term fleabag was invented describing this place. Terrible service, tiny bathrooms, bar prices are crazy high, valet act like keystone cops!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: mbowers03
Reviews.Content: My husband And I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and have never had any complaints, after reading the reviews, we were a little hesitant about staying this time. The Plaza did not let us down, they are having a 100th anniversary sale, the rooms are $100, we got an upgrade to oceanfront because of the celebration. Our bed was great!, pillow top very comfortable, the room was clean and spacious, loved it! The balcony view was awesome, this is my favorite Daytona Beach hotel, the grounds are well manicured, it has elegant ballrooms for weddings, they have a tiki bar and inside bar. I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel on the Atlantic Ocean”
Reviews.Author: slk1692
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plaza on Atlantic Avenue in Daytona Beach, FL. We had a balcony room that overlooked the pool and ocean. The price was extremely reasonable ($116 per night) as we were able to take advantage of a 20% fall special discount. Not only was the ambience breathtaking with the hotels deep rich colors, but every accessory was just as wonderful. The pool was above average (4 feet to 10 feet), the outside bar was expeditious, access to the ocean was simple (no need for a key card to get back in) and the restaurant delivered breakfast that was made perfectly (not overdone) and relatively cheap! My only complaint was the hairdryer in the bathroom that smelled as if it was about to burn out at any second. I would definately stay here again - even at a full price rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but very poor elevators”
Reviews.Author: pcampisi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Plaza Resort & Spa in July. It was a last minute trip and I found this place searching on the internet. I had not been to Daytona Beach in over 20 years so I really was not familiar at all with the location or hotel options. There was a small resort fee each night but we booked a special that came with a $25 Food and Beverage credit. Still a bit overpriced considering there were a lot of choices on the beach. Of course we did not know this before arriving. Reserved a partial ocean view room and was able to check in early. The room they gave us was on the 3rd floor and had an obstructed view and was noisy. Front desk changed our room to the 9th floor and it was much better. Room was nice and view of the ocean was awesome. The problem with this resort was the elevators. It was impossible to get back and forth from the beach or pool to your room in less than 20 minutes. One elevator was not operating and the other 3 were very small and SLOW! They were always crammed full because if you did not squeeze in you would have to stand there for another ten minutes waiting on the next one.
