Unfortunately this really took away from the whole experience because of the frustration. We spent one night and half of the next day before we just ask to check out. The Manager on Duty was gracious enough to refund us for the second night even though it was well past check-out time. We cut our trip short and drove back home to Panama City Beach. Location of the Resort is great and it has a really nice pool area with bar and grill. I have returned to Daytona Beach 2 times since this visit but have stayed elsewhere. I travel very often to different beach locations and will not hesitate to stay at the same place if it is a good experience. Not sure i would give this place another try, I know my husband would refuse.

Reviews.Title: “very clean.. :))”
Reviews.Author: frankhess13
Reviews.Content: Frank Hess what i nice resort.. i wish the manager at the new travel club (Casy aiken) they had would not have run me around for 9 days to try to get a lousey $50.00. i still havent recieved it.. he tells me monday now, like im supposed to believe him again and let 9 days become 11, 12 13 14.. you get it...

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Kathy2207
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last febuary also. I have never had a room that was dirty in any way. The staff was friendly. One thing I did learn in the restaurant if you show them your room key if you are with someone the second meal is half price they do not advertise that and should. They were putting out new pool chairs. My wish would be that they were dog friendly like most hotels are starting to be. Me and a friend got a message that was wonderful. Wish they had a outside hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: abeachbum76
Reviews.Content: Beautiful older hotel that has been well kept and made modern. We had a double queen ocean view room and it was very clean and spacious. I loved sitting on the balcony in the morning drinking coffee. Definatly one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at. A great family vacation, if you love the beach beacause you are on the beach! We stayed here 4 nights, and hated leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Azalea17
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We had a large family group staying in several hotels on the beach last week. The staff here was extremely friendly and most helpful. Arden was busy with a hotel full of "mini pageant contestants," but remembered details like greeting us by name or asking us how a restaurant was that he suggested, etc. Our group felt like special guests. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experiance”
Reviews.Author: Florida808
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? We were looking forward to a fun weekend at a nice resort at the beach but, we had a horrible time at the Plaza Resort & Spa. First there were hidden fees. We paid on-line and received a total...when we arrived at check-in, there was a $30 additional charge. Apparently they don't understand the word "total" The room was a disappointment, The deck floor looked like a wrecking ball had hit it. The elevators took forever to arrive. The whole weekend, we saw frustrated people standing around waiting for the elevator. The outside building was a mess. Then we received another mysterious $50 charge even though our paperwork didn't state this charge. This place is a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: JAshbrook
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience ever. This hotel needs some serious maintenance. Our room was not very clean. Had to tell the staff 3 times that the a/c was not working properly. Carpet had stains and a lamp shade was ripped to shreds and the faucet was broken in the bathroom. There was no linen available for the fold out couch and the quality of the pull out couch was horrible. The staff was relatively friendly and although they tried to fix the issues, it felt as if they had little options available to them. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but nice”
Reviews.Author: ufgatorgrl2003
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been here for years but the room was very nice and beachside. There is live music on the weekends by the pool. The pool is nice to relax by when you don't want to cart everything down to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Humiliating!”
Reviews.Author: MsConsultant1
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time or money to stay at this "SO CALLED" resort. I recently stayed with other family members at the beinning of the month for our famiy reunion! This is the WORST HOTEL, AND RESORT? How is it even considered as such? All of our family members had issues with their rooms. No need to speak with Resort Manager, Mr. Ed Myers, He doesnt return your phone calls, nor does he give a damn about customer service! Imagine driving 10 - 13 hours to celebrate with famiy members from New Jersey, Deleware, Noth Carolina, and other states and cities only to come to a supposed beautiful resort that offers nothing but mold, exposed electrical wiring, and doors that won't close. Bathrooms with stucco falling off the walls, commodes that rock back and forth. The only good experiece was the banquet, and the customer servce given by tthe African American young lady whos in Management. I sure hope that shes blessed to work in another venue other this. I work with the hotel industry doing Bridal and Event Planning, and would NEVER RECOMMEND the good citizens of Daytona Beach to plan thier event, whether Private or Corporate at this terrible facility!!

Reviews.Title: “Coming back next year - Great hotel in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: jefinNova
Reviews.Content: I got a room on Hotwire for $98/night to go to an Embry-Riddle graduation. Stayed there 2 nights. It's right on the beach. Watched the shuttle launch the next day and went for a walk on the beach. The location is perfect for Daytona beach: close to restaurants/shops. Clean and service is good. Loved the bar and the bartender. I think her name was Kathy. I'm coming back next year for my son's graduation from Embry-Riddle and his commissioning as a Navy ensign and am planning on definitely staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: momonreale
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night here. It is located right on the beach. I had an ocean front room. I opened my sliding glass door to listen to the waves. It is located in walking distance to everything, the pier, the restaurants and shops. It was quieter then the Wyndham and Hilton which sit directly to the south.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel - never again”
Reviews.Author: glObetrOtterwannabe3
Reviews.Content: stayed here to watch the shuttle launch. Hotel full . We were given room on 6th floor - had to join a queue of at least 40 people waiting on the lifts - eventually used the stairs - not pleasant with 3 small children & luggage & several dead cockroaches. Room was trashed - had to go down to reception & then put in room on 7th floor - stairs again !!! Room was dirty - tiny bathroom - carpet stained - only good thing was ocean view. Charged a $15 resort fee for facilities we never used . Complained the next day - no joy . Hotel's housekeeping standards leave alot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip and NEVER personal”
Reviews.Author: DUCABR
Reviews.Content: Have to stay here for a work conference for 3 nights and 4 days, elevators are horrible, no handicapped parking and never had housekeeping in room. I could go on forever but I would run out of space. My balcony sliding doors did not open and made aware at front desk. AC is very loud and hard to sleep unless TV on. We tried to look for handicapped parking and were yelled at by valet. No worth any money to come here for any reason.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucygoosy77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 22/06/11 - 01/07/11 First Class kitchen area, fridge, large microwave.We would not hesitate to come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Shad0wy
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Daytona Beach and even after reading some mixed reviews we decided to try Plaza. I think the hotel was priced reasonably, and the service, although, somewhat slow, was good. The room was very clean. Although were only 2 towels, but after a call to the front desk, we were brought additional towels (including hand towels and such, which were not already in the room). The kleenex threw us off though.... instead of a box of tissues there was just six tissues wadded up and stuffed into the box. It was a really cheap resolution if the hotel was out of new boxes, and I would suggest throwing it away and not providing any type of tissues. The TV did not work properly... it was locked, but for that call, we did not get an answer to resolve the problem. Overall, the bed and sheets were clean and comfortable. The shower also had a good water pressure. The beach was beautiful and very easy to access from the hotel. Driving around I really didn't see a whole lot of better hotels, so I'm happy with the choice we made (but, like I said, this was my first time to Daytona). If I would have to go back, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: andreamesutton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 14, 2011 for a summer vacation with my parents and hated it. First, we were put in the basement on there first floor, which was below the lobby. We had requested an oceanfront rooms and they gave us rooms 106 and 116 . Once in the rooms we found out that they are pool level and you can not see the ocean real well. In one of our rooms there was dust and spider webs all around the ceiling above the bed and the balcony had never been cleaned. In the second room, which was not better the air conditioner vent was full of cookies, gold fish crackers and cigarette butts. The shower curtain was full of mold and mildew. They also have an odor that is undescribable. The service is okay. If you want a hotel that is really four star, DON'T STAY HERE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok to stay but not what I would expect for a resort at this price”
Reviews.Author: nrfamilyof7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, service was poor, had to ask for towels all the time, some times didn't have any for the pool. Sometimes vale parking didn't have enough people and we perked ourselves. Rooms were ok but could be cleaner. They charge $11.00 dollars per person for breakfast?

Reviews.Title: “No 4 star, but worth the stay - Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Lysaer
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: I'd recommend this hotel, although it does have a few issues. It's by no means a "four star" hotel, but a 3 or 3 1/2 star easily. Bring your own towels, though. Pros: The hotel itself is very well appointed in the lobby and other public areas. The valets are super nice and helpful, although they did tend to get backed up at times. Bellhops and counter staff were professional and helpful. The restaurant looked very nice, although I did not get to try it. There's a snack/oddments store on the lobby level. Our room was a "River View" room - i.e., a basic double - but it actually was on the ground floor and thus opened up directly onto the pool area. The pool was heated and very large, and the hotel provided quite a number of chairs around the area. Lots of sunbathing/game playing areas around the pool deck, as it were. A pool side bar offered snacks and drinks and grill food. The beds were comfortable, if a bit firm, with down pillows and clean bedding. NO BUGS anywhere, and I looked. Cons: "River View" rooms are odd sized, long and narrow. Jacuzzi/hot tub is only available for a $10/day fee or with spa services. Pool bar closes early. Beach chairs are not provided. Towels are something this hotel needs work on! We checked in and found 2 bath towels, one hand towel, and one rag - for a double. Should have at LEAST had full towels for 2 people, if not 4. Towel quality was horrible. These had to be the cheapest, thinnest, worst towels I've ever used. The bathroom was claustrophic, although the granite tiled shower was nice - just small.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: war_of_jenkins_ear
Reviews.Content: On a whim, we purchased the "blind rate" on hotwire, and this was the hotel we got. For our $137, we were banished to rooms in the basement. Our room, 112, did not have an opening into the hallway, instead the door opened into the pool/patio area. The door to the room was all glass, did not have a separate deadbolt or slider lock on the inside, and closed poorly. The curtain did not have a sheer layer so your only option for getting outside light was none or let everyone at the pool look into your room. In all, the room did not feel safe. There was no wireless internet signal in this room, we had to go upstairs to use the computer. Our cell phone also did not have a signal in the basement. Of more universal concern to people not banished to room 112, the hotel was very hit or miss. The rooms appeared to be somewhat renovated, but some of the furniture was beat up. You wait a long time for elevators. I know we received the discount rate from hotwire, but there were other rooms unoccupied. Why would you put someone in the crappiest rooms you have when others are available? Don't pay extra for parking. Tell them you want parking included in your resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Super great for Daytona.”
Reviews.Author: Kerri315
Reviews.Content: Wow, the old Ho-Jo has come pretty darn far. We upgraded to this resort after a disgusting night over at the La Playa, and it was night and day. Great location. Only down side is that elevators are amazingly slow. We had a low floor so took the stairs many times. If you are coming to a hotel in Daytona, stay here or in a national chain hotel else you will be sorely disappointed. Thanks Plaza for making the remainder of our stay really great.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!!!!”
Reviews.Author: misstressss
Reviews.Content: So after reading reviews we still went for it....let's see...hotel needs a renovation badly...its very old and elevators suck..very slow...the only neat thing is that ur infront of the beach...other then that hotel is very old...

Reviews.Title: “Elevators are insufficient.”
Reviews.Author: amcelectric
Reviews.Content: The elevators are old, very slow, small in size. The elevators can not handle the capacity of the building. The hotel is near full and there is insufficient parking capacity and one elevator is down. If you stay here you will not enjoy the elevator experience. i am trapped on the 9th floor beause the elevators are so full I do not want to get on one in fear it will stop between floors overloaded. One guest said it reminded him of how many people you can fit into a VW. Clearly it is unsafe condition. THE HOTEL HAS TO INVEST IN A NEW ELEVATOR SYSTEM WITH FAST CARS. IT IS ANTIQUATED AND UNSAFE IN THE CONDITION IT IS IN RIGHT NOW. Which makes for an overall bad experience. Friday July 8th, 2011. I would not book this hotel is it is more than half full!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at this fabulous resort and spa on Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: HaroldSays
Reviews.Content: We totally loved our stay at the luxurious Plaza Resort and Spa located right on Daytona Beach. This resort is AWESOME! The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are beautiful with a breathtaking view of the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CMZ_MASS
Reviews.Content: Four stars..no, but is a solid three star hotel. They charge a $15 per night resort fee,which I guess covers parking, in-room safe, local phone calls and internet access. We arrived late and received the worst view in the place. Basically, a wall and a roof top, you would have to press your face up to the window to get a glimpse of a street. We decided not to ask for another room, because the one we had was for the most part clean and quiet. With that said, if we paid a rack room rate on this room, I would not be happy. Bathrooms are small and we did have some mold were the tub meets the tile, not a lot but it was there. The sitting bench in the room was filthy, we threw a towel over it and used it as a suitcase table. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous. We had problems with the safe and the deadbolt on the door, both time staff came up immediately and fixed each issue. I would say the elevators are average. The lobby is nice. One thing we found a little concerning was security. All doors leading to/from the pool and garage have signs stating a room key is needed to enter the hotel between 5pm and 7am, but everytime we went trough them the doors were not locked no matter what time it was. We found the pool deck nice and we noticed staff cleaning the pool most mornings, but it seems they neglected the pool bottom. It was in need of a good vacuuming, lots of sand. The pool depth range from three feet to ten feet. The beach in front of the hotel was great. Lots of space so people are not on top of each other. This part of the beach is not accessible to cars, which is nice if you have children. All in all, we would stay here again, but only at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: taydiggy
Reviews.Content: This place was outrageously over priced. The suite room we had was small and dingy. The street view had club lights and street lights shining into the window all night. The curtains would not close, the fridge broke the blow dryer blew out and don't even get me started on the cock roaches Yuck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: Schmooles
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel previously. This time I booked through priceline.com. I didn't have any issues with the reservationsand we did not have to wait for a room. The room was clean and comfortable. We did get a balcony with a view of the ocean. I was surprised because I expected a street view room. My only issue was with the resort fee which I was not expecting. It may have stated it somewhere with my reservation and I may have overlooked it but I didn't press the issue. The pool was dirty and cloudy with grease probably from suntan lotion. The pool was very crowded so it didn't bother some people. The women working at the poolside cafe/bar was vey nice!! The location is fabulous along with the beach. It's a good hotel but I wouldn't call it a "resort".I've stayed here twice and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jnminfla
Reviews.Content: This is an older property but well maintained. The rooms are large, clean and very comfortable. Right on the beach is a plus, the restaurant is fine and the spa has everything you could want. For this type of property i think it is a great value, especially if you use one of their "specials".

Reviews.Title: “poor experience”
Reviews.Author: fredeaux
Reviews.Content: Booked on priceline.com while we were driving towards Daytona Beach. Got to the hotel and first impression from the street looked fine. Went to check in and the front desk clerk told me I had to wait 45 minutes so the priceline.com reservation would show up in their reservation system. I told the clerk that I just drove 4 hours and asked if she could check a different system to confirm my reservation- I use priceline.com almost 90% of the time and this is common for hotels to do. She told me that she did not have a way to do that and said that I would have to wait until the reservation would show up. I told her that I never had this issue before with waiting 45 minutes for a reservation and she really did not seem to care. I finally told her to check me into a room and when the reservation arrived she could link the priceline.com reservation to my room. I gave her my c/c and id. She put both on the counter with a room key envelope and did not say anything. I finally asked if that was a room key and she said yes and pointed to the elevators. I asked about where should I park and she pointed outside-this is now what I am beginning to read as the front desk is clueless when it comes to customer service. I received a call at 3:30AM in my room from the night auditor asking me about my reservation and why I had two reservations and which was correct. Sorry but this is unacceptable to call a guest at 3:3AM asking about anything unless its security related. The next morning I went to the front desk and asked to speak to the general manager and was told he would not be in until 1pm. I asked to speak to a manager that is responsible for the hotel that was on duty. The lady (very nice) said "I guess I am the manager". I asked of the whole hotel? She said yes-- this is amazing and now understand why the property looks like it does because it must have a relaxed style of management. The invoice I received under my door indicated that I was a no-show reservation for priceline.com. I questioned the invoice and resort fee to find out the resort fee covers parking, safety deposit box and work out room which was never disclosed to me when I checked in. She did credit the $15 and said that she would credit more but since I prepaid with priceline.com she could not do anything else for me. I did not go to the front desk asking for anything for free but she when she said that it seemed she really did not want to do anything but get rid of me because if she wanted to do something a little extra she would have picked up my $4.31 bill from the hotel store. The hotel store lady was very nice to talk with. Just got back yesterday so not sure if it hit my c/c or not. Seems the 14th floor is popular because room 1423 (I think that was the room I was in) appeared it has some major damaged and they found a day laborer to fix the repairs. The windows were do dirty we just closed the curtains. I understand, lived and traveled around oceans, gulfs and waterways so I know about how difficult it is to keep salt off windows and clean but this window was not cleaned for a very long (if ever) time. The pipes (or something) in the walls had a clanging sounds all night which was pretty hard to get to sleep and back to sleep after the 3:30AM phone call. My girls would not even swim the hotel pool because the water was dirty. I literally had to talk my wife and young daughters to stay in the room because of the perception of it not being cleaned. When I get back to Daytona, I think I may find the adjacent hotels a better option. The Ocean View or Hilton seemed very well taken care of. Mr General Manager- I’ve read your responses and if you truly want to create a great customer experience you would contact your customer instead off justifying everything that is wrong and reach out the customer instead of them calling you.

Reviews.Title: “loved the beach”
Reviews.Author: MswloriNM
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights over Memorial Day Weekend, May 2011 -- I did lots of researching hotels before purchasing a room at this hotel. Wonderful character being an old hotel, gorgeous architecture and inside designs, lots of old photos near the front desk. I booked an ocean front room and decided to "go for it" and pay the price for this type of room. I was sorely disappointed in the quality of the room and some of the features of the hotel itself. The view was stunning and we loved having the ocean breeze right into the room. The beds were very comfy and no complaints there. Wonderful flat screen TV (although we didn't use it at all). To begin with, the corners of the room had spider-webs and dirt; behind the dresser when I plugged in a phone charger were more spider-webs with dust on them. Obvious to me that it had not been cleaned in a while. The sliding doors onto the porch were so heavy and hard to open I had to ask my 20 yr old son to unlock and open/close each time I wanted to go onto the balcony. The balcony was very small (but there were 2 chairs and a small table). That was not a problem. BUT -- the chairs were dirty, the balcony overlooked part of the roof and there was a dirty, used child's diaper on the roof, various pieces of garbage, paper on the roof. The balcony itself needed to be scraped and painted because the railing had chips and flakes of paint coming off. The room had a counter with a small sink, microwave and refrigerator. Very nice! But, it was put in at the cost of bathroom space, which made the bathroom and the tub short and difficult to maneuver in. When in the bathroom and one opens the door, you are almost touching the tub and toilet to move out of the way of the door. The elevators were very small and very slow for the size of the hotel. The breakfast buffet was ridiculously expensive for cold cereal and muffins ($5, come on, it could have been included in the cost of the room). The wait staff in the breakfast buffet (we only ate there one morning, no other meals) were not attentive, we had to ask 3 times for coffee to be refilled, but when she brought the bill she wouldn't leave us alone trying to get us to pay and leave (there were lots of empty tables and no one waiting to be seated, breakfast had a couple of hours left for serving). The main areas of the hotel were clean and nice looking, we enjoyed looking at the history of the hotel! The front desk clerk was wonderful ( sorry, her name escapes me) and was able to print our boarding passes for us. Odd thing was this hotel did not have a business room with access to a basic printer. Had a computer kiosk in the lobby but no place to sit. Hotel had free Wi-Fi, which I expect from any hotel these days. The beach was wonderful and traffic - free. Very clean and well maintained all the way out from the retaining wall to the ocean. The pool area was very nice but the pool was dirty. True, it is right on the beach, but there was dirt in the bottom and the water was not clear and clean appearing. We used to live in Florida and understand the nature of the tourism business. However, for the cost of this room and the prime location in and on Daytona Beach, I was sorely disappointed. I expected much more in the quality of the room as well as cleanliness of the room. We will not stay there again and I have told multiple friends who are headed to Daytona to find another place in town. Access to the beach is very very easy in Daytona and it is not worth the cost of the rooms at the Plaza to stay right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Small elevators and bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: RobertI789
Reviews.Content: Hotel is off the boardwalk. Elevators are slow and smal. $15/day resort fee added to bill. Self park on small congested lot is available for FREE, vallet parking for $10. The AC unit was noisy. Most rooms have balconies but not mine, possible due to the large discount. Near restaurants, music and movies.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay near the action.”
Reviews.Author: Fl0ridab0y
Reviews.Content: The Staff need a little training. The good is average. The pool area is average. The store is good. The spa is small. The rooms and balconies are very nice. However, from what I understand this is one of the best hotels on the strip. The price was good.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: teakieweakie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plaza Beach Resort on Daytona beach for Memorial Day weekend and despite the awful reviews that we read our visit was quite the opposite! The room was large, clean, comfortable bed, plenty of towels and a nice ocean front view. This is an older hotel so a little cosmetic updating would benefit this establishment such as fresh paint in some areas such as the outer wall facing the beach, some areas in the hallways as well. Our room was on the third floor; the entry to the room faced the lobby so it got a little noisy on Saturday night but other than that it was a great visit! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place if you can.”
Reviews.Author: 34230Sd2011
Reviews.Content: We drove four and half hours to be told when we got there that we couldn't check in for another two and a half hours - 4:00pm was the "gauranteed" check in time and they said they would call when our room was ready. Well, we figured that since it was now 4:15 and no one had called us that it had to be ready. We ended up checking in at 4:30 and our cab was coming at 5:00pm for a wedding at 6:00pm. This gave us 30 minutes to get ready for a wedding! Horrible incompetent front desk staff and scheduling.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: helmuthubert
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on a Sunday around noon. Were told that we could not have a room till 4 pm. We asked for some towels so that we could go to the beach until our room would be ready: were told that we could not have towels. Went to the beach had a great time, it really is a beatiful beach. Our room was finally ready at 4, checked in. The room was disapointing, nor very clean, no screen on the sliding door, could not open our door because of bugs. Tried to borrow a cork crew and a couple of wine glasses, no deal, they would not let us have either. The staff was rude, except for the gentleman in the little convenience store. Tried to talk to the manager and explain our complaints, he was totally unreceptive and we were treated as an invonvenience. These folks have no idea about customer service. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at a Super 8 before I stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LovenIt72
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, good nor bad, but I couldn't in good conscious let this horrible experience go unnoticed. My husband and I travel frequently and this particular resort fell way short of its ratings. We planned a weekend getaway and arrived on a Friday afternoon about 4pm, one person was doing the valet, so needless to say we waited quite a while just to have the car checked. The front desk had us sign our registration card and hand us our keys, the bellman was nice; we get to our room and it is not at all what we expected, cheap bedding, dirty, our room overlooking a filthy gutter....it was unacceptable. They change our room, and the 2nd room is just as bad as the first. We decide not to stay (even though it was already completely paid for), it was that bad. The staff was unprofessional (not rude) just not what you expect for those rates and ratings. We decided to go home; when you are looking for a weekend getaway, you are not looking to spend it at hotel that feels like a motel 6. It felt like a bait and switch, not professional, not clean, rooms not as they describe, not-at-all like their website. I would not stay here again. To add insult to injury I see a $30 charge on my credit card come Monday, it is for being a guest. That's right just because they have privileged you and allowed you to stay with them. Ridiculous fee. Head my warning, you will not be pleased spending that kind of money to stay in a place like that, you get the same out of a Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, iffy rooms”
Reviews.Author: biggsy3
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is excellent, obviously been redone sometime. However, the rooms, not so much. Bathroom was very small and had a small amount of mold on the ceiling in the tub. There was some peeling paint and the towel racks were put on crooked. The carpet was stained. The little kitchen area was nice and appeared newer with granite tops. The location was excellent as we could walk to the shopping district and the pier, although it is under construction and closed. The beach at the hotel was excellent and not as crowded as 50 yards down in either direction. Nice view (oceanfront room), but no screen and the balcony was in need of upkeep. The spa looked nice although we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “A victim of the recession”
Reviews.Author: parafrog
Reviews.Content: A rapidly declining condominium property, many of the units now bank owned. Deferred maintenance has resulted in an almost "3d world" experience; dirty, unkempt and poorly managed. Quite simply it is in a failed business model; condo owners cannot pay for upkeep and the bank won't put the money into the units it owns. In addition to the substandard facilities (to include rooms), not surprisingly the staff is neither well trained nor supervised. The kitchen (room service) was substandard. Elevators caused fear for one's life. Parking approximated inner city New York in the garment district. The result is a predictable failure in the ability to provide even the most marginal of acceptable service or hospitality. Without a reasonable revenue stream, this property will continue to deteriorate. I recommend a corporate owned property with deeper pockets such as the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Plaza could be better”
Reviews.Author: LititzHometowngirl
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel room for the money, outside could be power-washed for nicer exterior, pool needed cleaned, We had no towels one day. The girl behind the registration desk did not smile ONCE. The Balcony could be cleaned more often. The air conditioner unit was coming apart. This place needs some TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Great Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: letsgova
Reviews.Content: We (six of us) stayed here for five nights during spring break. We had stayed here last year and wanted to return to a familiar place. We checked in late, around 9:45pm and got our requested rooms, oceanfront high floor. I asked when the Walgreen's closed across the street and was told 10pm...I didn't even go up to the room, I made the dash alone to get some drinks, including a case of water and a twelve pack of beer. As I started up the driveway to the lobby one of the security guards on duty ran down to meet me to help me carry the load. He was so very nice, he even helped me get everything to our rooms. That was the start of the excellent service we received. We got to our rooms and the view was amazing, even better than last year. The room was perfect, no bugs, just a nice clean comfortable room. There is a bar area with a sink, small refrigerator and a coffee maker. There were plates, bowls and cups for four. They provide two coffee services, not sure if they replenish that as we brought our own. The next morning we had some trouble locking the door. I called down to the front desk and the maintenance man was there in less than five minutes. He quickly fixed the hinge and we were off to enjoy the day at the pool and beach. The pool looked inviting, the water was cool, around the same temperature as the ocean which was 72 when we were there. There were plenty of loungers and around a dozen tables with umbrellas. They do need to update the loungers, last year they were fine, this year they seemed a bit beaten up. I suppose being exposed to the sun and salt air takes its toll on anything outdoors. We didn't use the outdoor shower, only the bottom shower to wash the sand off our feet...that part worked with no issues. There is a snack bar with the usual pool fare, sandwiches and cocktails, we didn't order anything but it looked good and the prices seemed reasonable. Last year they had a grill going outside with hotdogs, this year the hotel was much quieter and I guess it wasn't worth it to start it up. There are also alot of food trucks on the beach for lunch. There are rental loungers on the beach, I think they are around $20-30 a day for two with an umbrella. We thought about buying a couple of cheap sand chairs at Walgreen's ($10ea) but decided not to because we enjoyed the pool and the option of getting under an umbrella when needed. I used spf 15, should have used a higher #. The beach directly in front of the hotel has a lifeguard which was nice as they are spaced pretty far apart. The Plaza is in a good location, there are a couple of pizza places across the street and you can get pizza, hoagies, gyros and some outstanding salads. We walked up to Hyde Park in the Hilton for a great dinner. They have an early bird special that is well worth it for a special night out. There are also some beach/surf type stores right across the street. At the hotel they have a little shop for all sorts of necessities, they even have some frozen Marie Calenders boxed food items. All in all a great time was had by all. If we go back to Daytona we will surely stay at the Plaza Resort and Spa again. *Flying in and out of DAB is a pure pleasure, even without direct flights it is so much easier than any of the other big airports.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL, CLEAN HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: JZadow1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 13 year old son and my brother for a weekend spring break getaway. My son and I had a room with a balcony and ocean/city view, my brother had the room without a balcony. We had 2 double beds and a kitchen area along the wall, with sink, fridge, etc. He had a room with a king sized bed and a smaller but still decent sized kitchen area with the same. Both rooms were clean and spacious, massive flat screen tvs, and nice, clean spacious bathrooms with ceramic tiles. The pool was nice and massive with a pool-side bar and it was right on the beach. The lobby was beautiful, there were all kinds of amenities we never even had a chance to use! We had the nicest weekend there and I have to say that it was almost cancelled due to a review that I read on here left in Sept 2010, "Dirty rooms..." after reading that review I almost cancelled but I didn't because I would've lost half my money so I took a chance. It really annoys me because this person's review is so off-base, it is ridiculous. I could debate him on every point and I would hope a competitor hotel had nothing to do with his review!!!...the whole thing just sounds suspicious...just my opinion!! I know a beetle when I see one and I don't know how a roach was half alive and moving when it is only half there...it's not hard to find one for a photo op...also my brother is 6ft.2in, somehow he had no issues in the 'small' shower...what a load of BS...!! So...happy I didn't cancel because it was a wonderful weekend and the only issue we had were with a few big moths that flew in from the balcony, which we had fun chasing and setting free...I guess I could be a drama queen and complain about that, but really??? LOL!! Attaching pics of this lovely hotel!! They do charge a resort fee of $15/day which we didn't know about...next time I will let them park my car & I'll use the gym!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “If we had believed the reviews we would've missed out a lot of fun.”
Reviews.Author: spoiledrotten1Miami
Reviews.Content: We had a great time with our stay. Could we have focused on some negative details? Sure!! But why? For the price, it was a great value. Not a Ritz, but then again, the price isn't either! If I had one somewhat negative comment, (if you hotel administration guys are reading), how can you close all the restaurants and room service by 9 PM...??? WHO DOES THAT??? (I don't care if it was a Tuesday night). Besides that, the room was great, we had an oceanfront with an amazing view of the beach, the food was excellent, (I like lots of room service), and the location was perfect. right in the middle of everything. And yes, a couple of maintenance guys roaming around just taking care of little details would make the whole place sparkle in a couple of weeks, (if you like to nitpick about details)... otherwise, very well worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sherrykhanum
Reviews.Content: We got 3 nights in this place by priceline for $100. Upon arrival we asked the front door lady if we could pay to upgrade and without even checking, she told us NO. Upon walking into our room we saw a beetle scurry across the floor, and killed it. Luckily that was our only bug friend in the room. We went out and later that night, upon arrival, we decided to try one more time (there was a new guy at the door). The nice gentleman named Les looked around on his computer and allowed us to get a balcony room with oceanview for $20 a night. We switched rooms, and realized my boyfriend left his movado watch in the previous room. When we asked them later to chceck for it, they said they found nothing. Yeah right. Some cleaning lady must be very happy right now. There was a fraternity formal going on, so the people next door to us kept going on their balconies and shouting and screaming to rooms above or below them. That was annoying. But we couldn't switch rooms. By the way, there are a MILLION bugs on the balcony. So either don't go on it or close the door if you do. Oh, and there is mold all over the bathrooms (in both rooms we were in).

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jandsmack
Reviews.Content: very pleased with location, service and room layout. perfect for young kids. oceanfront room with stellar views. arrived early & parked on the beach for $5! front desk allowed early check in.Walking distance to Oceanwalk Shoppes & Restaurants. nice big pool could use some updating i.e. patios chipping & broken shower off beach. will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “I like it, clean and nice for Daytona.”
Reviews.Author: Vanwithkids
Reviews.Content: Just had a nice weekend here. We go to Daytona about once a year (Fla. residents) it has its tacky parts but also has nice elements. Teens get that 'Spring Break feel' even stuck with Mom :) No cars on this beach, though they are just to the north. This is a clean hotel, tastefully decorated, with a very nice staff. Oceanfront rooms have a killer view, large pool with bar/grill. Very comfortable beds, nice sheets, modern kitchenette area with small fridge and microwave. (Bring your own paper goods, though, it's not 'stocked') If they were to enhance something, it should be the pool area - old chairs, neglected-looking 'sport court'? No hot tub, kiddie pool or water features. Look on discount sites for deals, you'll like it more. The $5 continental breakfast was good and convenient. You can walk to the OceanWalk shops.restaurants and boardwalk area. Wish Daytona would get the pier reopened. Another place with that silly 'resort fee' ($15/day) - a way of getting revenue while not raising rates. At least it includes parking, that's usually a fee these days. Please do not confuse this hotel with the nearby Plaza Ocean Club, it's much better. I suspect a few of the really negative review here were meant for that one.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not up to my expectations for the price"S" they charge”
Reviews.Author: bettyboo9691
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a very nice room. It was barely mediocre. We opened the door and we all looked at each other and said are you kidding me? The room was small and cluttered. The bathroom would only allow one person in there at a time. No counter space in the bathroom except for the toilet and that was cracked on the top where it was flat. Mold was in the tub along the caulking. There was a large weird pink stain on the carpet right as you enter the bedroom portion. The Jacuzzi was unavailable in the evenings when we wanted to relax and was an additional charge of PER person of $10. This place was ridiculous with the additional charges, they charged 15 per night for parking which we had to make a long walk down to a north lot which was dark, not secured and open to the elements including disgusting bird droppings and film all over the vehicles. Then you get charge a resort fee of 15 dollars per day, why? There were no amenities useable....nothing....So why the charge? The parking was not even convenient. The garage is unmanned with no turn around space to get out because it is so tiny and always full. We were defiantly not happy campers. This was no better than the holiday Inn(their bathrooms are twice the size), and even they have all of their amenities open to their guest including a continental breakfast or EVEN A CUP OF COFFEE at no charge, they wanted $5 per person for a Continental breakfast and 11 for a basic small breakfast. These small things should not be additional fees EVERYWHERE. We will never stay there again. All of the add on's they charge ran the bill up an additional 25% and we did nothing except sleep for two nights with no services or basic expectations were provided like other reasonable hotels offer. NONE. 2 nights at $610.00 so far is outrageousus for this place. Others are right, the lobby does outshine the hotel by far......This place is not worth it, unless you are Daddywarbucks without a brain.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be swayed by the plush lobby”
Reviews.Author: girlonthego_54
Reviews.Content: Supposedly this hotel was upgraded in 2006 but I think the lobby was it. The lobby can make the hotel deceiving as it does not compare with the rest of the hotel with its wood-paneled columns, leather/upholstered furniture, lush greenery. As for our room, the towel bar broke the first day. Hotel staff promptly and cheerfully fixed it, but then the toilet would occasionally run. Slider to the balcony would not LOCK. The bed sheets were very cheap. The room had a strange odor (mold?). The bathroom was oddly too small as other reviewers mentioned - no shelving to put your items and no hooks to hang your towel/clothes while showering! This was frustrating. Also fan vent took forever to get rid of shower moisture. Paint peeling all around behind the sink in the bathroom. No trash can in the room only bathroom----we stayed for 5 days and the maid never picked up the trash that I kept piling up on the counter! The bed was comfortable however. And the only saving grace for this hotel was the friendly, good service we received. First night we arrived though, the desk clerk insisted our rate did not include breakfast. My husband found out it did the next day, so the staff gave us a $40 credit to use in the restaurant. All in all, not a very great experience. I will be returning to Daytona Beach next year, but will not be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive lobby, front desk-friendly and helpful, great location!”
Reviews.Author: blueeyes712
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Plenty of pillows and towels. Rooms are spacious, saf is a nice size for storing a laptop plus. Due to the cold weather we were not able to enjoy te balcony. It was a good thing we couldn't use the balcony due to balcony erosion on both sides, flt a bit uncomfortable standing on balcony. Also, no deent counterspace in the bathroom and there is plenty of room for a counter. Toilet is very low-so if someone has a back/knee problem it may make it difficult. We do not recommend the restaurant at all! We went to eat at 9am, decided to go for the buffet,-food was barely warm and you coud tell it seemed that the food sat there for some time. I found hair on my french toast and the waitress never even apologized-but we could hear them(mocking me) all in the kitchen about the hair in my food.(they had no clue we could hear them and we were sitting near the windows) If i wasn't for the restaurant, we would rate it a 5!!!!(TOPS)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable.....”
Reviews.Author: Schmooles
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly acceptable hotel. I think the staff makes up for what the hotel is lacking. The nightly average price should be lower for what you get. I was greeted by a lovely man who loaded up my luggage and took my car away. He was great; I wish I would have caught his name. Our room was clean and comfortable. The couch was a little sketchy and bright orange. It was a little dirty and didn't really "go" with the rest of the room. The heat did not work the first night but it was so late by the time we got back to our room we didn't mention it until the morning. The bathroom was clean but the toilet was a slow flusher and the shower drained even slower. Some of the towels didn't smell quite right but they brought new towels right away. The man that came to fix the heat in the morning was super friendly and polite. The security team was also friendly and polite while still maintaining professionalism. I would stay here again just for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “"UPSCALE ON THE BEACH"THIS PLACE IS NOT!”
Reviews.Author: ALLIE49
Reviews.Content: Security none. Anyone can walk into the hotel, without using a room key, even for the fitness room. Towel rack fell off the wall, because of a poor attempt of installing it. Lucky no one got hurt. Bathroom sink was also poorly installed. Sheets were stained. Not just in one bed but both and not all in one spot. Restaurant???????????? No hot tub. Spa was closed. The front desk clerk was great. But try to get anything to the room. Pillows, Etc. It took a few attempts and two hours later. Defective remote for tv. Pigeons on the balcony. Bugs in room on nightstand. Late check out time was for one o'clock but we couldn't wait to leave. You betcha we were gone in a flash that day.

Reviews.Title: “Mold & Mildew Ridden Sick Hotel”
Reviews.Author: southerngal58
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 miserable nights at this hotel last week. The mold & mildew was so strong you could smell it. I along with many others at my conference was sick and spent several sleepless nights because I kept coughing and choking. I finally had to sleep bundled up in blankets with the door open and the heater on to get enough fresh air to breath. I try to live a fairly green lifestyle, and I detested wasting that much energy. I would have moved to another hotel, but my conference was there with all my meals and nightly meetings. I felt trapped. The staff was wonderful, and the food was great. I felt sorry for the employees having to breath that stuff. I had a pretty view, and the hotel is right on the beach but in an older run down part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The spa is heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: ewoka13
Reviews.Content: My review is for the Ocean Waters Spa @ this resort. My husband and I had the spa pedicure and I got a haircut and style. We will definitely be back @ this spa anytime we're in the area. Aisha and Ashley took 5 star care of us! Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Outside looks good,"BEWARE OF THE ROOMS"”
Reviews.Author: ADKS1998
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't know where to start with this place, very disappointed we were here with family and for a football tournament. Would not have been my pick by far. Very disappointed in the room in general, needs a lot of up dates. Not clean at all, especially for having a toddler with you. I attached several pictures of the room. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Only tip i have is maybe not to put so much effort in lobby area, but the rooms need to be redone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: sewcrazyvina
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old Daughter stayed in this hotel November 10th through the 16th. It was referred to me by a friend who lives in Daytona. After reading some of the reviews I was a little hesitant but booked anyway trusting my friends advice. We checked in very late that night and the Staff was most helpful and very nice. Our room was beautiful! I hadn't requested an ocean view as I was saving money but received one at no extra charge, it was so beautiful! The Room was nice and large and very clean. The bathroom was a little small but really how much time do you spend in the bathroom. The pillows were to die for! We always had enough towels and pillows and they always left extra i never had to request any. With a 17 year old you go through a lot of towels. The Staff was AWESOME! Everyone was so nice, the manager made a point to introduce himself. The location was probably the best! and the Valet parking included in the $15 a day charge was well worth it! I'm planning another trip to Daytona Beach and I will for sure be staying at the Plaza Resort & Spa no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at The Plaza Resort & Spa AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: sueg32
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Resort & Spa placed a hold on my debit card on the first day of my two-night stay for $350 (the cost for two nights). At checkout, my friend charged one night's stay to her credit card, and I told them to apply the other half to my debit card. Now two days following my return home, the $350 hold still has not been released yet. When I called about it, and they only sent me another copy of my room charge via email. Today I called and left another message that the funds still haven’t been credited back to my account, and how I was never informed of this or else I would’ve given them a CHARGE card, not a debit/charge card. Still no charge for the actual room amount, just the debit of $350. I’ll never go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly supprised”
Reviews.Author: Morgana666
Reviews.Content: After reading various reviews, we were not sure about our stay at the Plaza, especially travelling from the UK. On the strength of the reviews we tried to swop hotels, but had left it too late. When we saw our room and the views we were very happy, we checked for bed bugs, behinde the fridge for roaches but found nothing. Staff were very helpful, rooms kept spotless, rooms done daily. We had a problem with the bill but it was rectified straight away, it was only a mistake by the travel company, soon rectified. We found the front desk staff helpful and polite. Definatelty would stay again, only witnessed akward customers, not akward staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kim2848
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved our stay at the Plaza Resort and Spa. When we returned to Dayton Beach this year, we could not stay there because there was no vacancy. I used some of the spa services and beautiful baskets were sent to us by our children because it was Mother's Day. Our grown children told us the baskets were not expensive. It was so fun to receive chocolate strawberries and champagne, Kalua and coffee, chocolate milk and cookies all laden with beautiful orchids. The basket were prepared by the hotel. Everywhere you looked, it was luxury! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would not return”
Reviews.Author: SMGChattanooga
Reviews.Content: Very poor customer service, they did not seem to really care. We stayed 4 nights - one day the valet literally lost our vehicle, one day the room was not cleaned until 4:30 pm, the music at the pool was very loud (no relaxing by the pool), and we were overcharged 2 days for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms with bedbugs and roaches”
Reviews.Author: kingpaco
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the plaza resort last year and we really liked it so we decided to stay here again this year and it was THE MOST DISGUSTING hotel we've been in so far.. You would think you're at a super 8 or a cheap motel.. The hotel looks amazing on the outside and the rooms are big and nicely equiped HOWEVER the scary things are all the disgusting bugs you find under the bed, ceiling, corner walls and night stand.. It all started when i went to get a shower and the shower head was mounted at shoulder level.. Im 5'9.. I had to bend under and backwards for this thing.. We went to the front desk to ask if all of the rooms were like this and the guy at the desk said "i have no idea" ... I mean really?.. But he let us check out another room.. When we walked into this room we saw a bunch of little black dots on the wall above the headboard and after further inspecting the room we noticed these same black things were everywhere and when i tried to clean it with a wet napkin.. It smeared all over the wall and a bug came out of this thing.. We inmediately left and asked to see another room...the next room was even worse.. As soon as we walked in we saw bugs running up the wall.. We left and told the front desk guy.. He told us to check out the next room.. And guess what..the third room was the same.. Nasty bugs on the wall.. Black markings on the bed sheets and mold and a dead bed bug on the coffee table.. We ran away.. And before stopping back at tje front desk decided to do a thorough inspection of our room.. As soon we checked under our bed we noticed a big roach.. Upside down but still moving... That did it for us and we checked out this morning and ended up staying at the hilton... All i gotta say is that the hilton is a different world.. Rooms are ultra clean.. We did our inspection and it checks out with flying colors..and the staff is extremely friendly and attentive... Dont stay at the plaza.. Believe all of the other reviews.. Theyre real..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: monkeybutt88
Reviews.Content: We were able to bet a room off priceline at $80 per night. Then when we went there, upgraded it to an oceanfront view for $30 (personally I always get ocean view rooms, otherwise, what is the point of coming all the way here?! Might as well just stay somewhere in the city at a way cheaper price) The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious with an extremely comfy bed and all kitchen equipments, so we were able to just walk across the road to Walgreens and buy something and cook (ok instant noodles requires some form of cooking too). Also a fridge where we kept our beers in. The room also has a safe, you can keep your valuables in there. 42'' TV. Nice balcony with a table and two chairs so you can just sit there and relax watching the ocean. All in all, The hotel provided many things I didn't expect from a 3-1/2 star hotel, which the Hilton hotel right beside it does NOT provide. If you are able to score the deal like I did on priceline, it's well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel on a perfect beach.”
Reviews.Author: ChiliPalmer
Reviews.Content: This is my response to some negative comments. I stayed at the Plaza Resort and Spa with my wife and two kids for 17 (Seventeen) days. At first I was a little bit scared with some previous reviews and made reservation for much shorter time, so we extended our stay twice and didn't want to leave. We had an inner corner room 721 with cityview which is larger than an average room from my understanding. The room is basic, but had everything we needed: two queen size beds with pull-out sofa, one large LCD TV and one older TV, well equiped kitchen with oversized microwave and small whirlpool fridge. Since we prefer city lights instead of dark night ocean, we were absolutely fine with getting that room. I didn't experience any kind of negative attitude from hotel staff. I had several packages delivered to the hotel during my stay, so it was most of my communication with the staff. Anyway I found them pretty friendly and ready to serve. Elevators work fine at weekdays and have some delays on Friday and Saturday when hotel is packed. I talked to a manager and was told that Plaza has more than 300 rooms and only three elevators, so at busy times elevators issue is true. Lobby area and convention area are nice looking and smelled okay with me. There were couple of weddings during our stay and a lot of family reunions and business meetings. The beach is incredible - great sand, great ocean with great waves, and just perfect seabreeze. The hotel stretch of the beach is pedestrians only and less crowdy than Hilton part of the beach. We enjoyed spending time at our beach. Pool area is pretty nice and the pool is down to 10 ft deep which is rare. The biggest issue is lack of pool towels. Wifi worked okay, they have free computer in the lobby. Walgreens is just across the street. Volusia mall is an old one, but the have A&F and Hollister which is a good sign. Overall, Daytona Beach is a great vacation destination with several own landmarks and things to see and very close to St. Augustine and Orlando. And The Plaza Resort and Spa is a nice older oceanfront hotel with long history, greatly located close to Ocean Walk, Lagoon Aquapark, Boardwalk and Intl Speedway. It has some issues I would like them to change or fix, but not sure if it's going to happen until FL economy will rise again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: StiltsGuy
Reviews.Content: We booked our room months prior through Travelocity and expected a great room with a great view but instead got a room no better than you would expect in a Super 8 motel. Our room had no view, the bathtub was clogged, the air conditioner (though loud) never got our room cool enough, and we could hear every vehicle passing by all night long. Also, upon check in we were told that we would have to pay a $15 per day "resort fee". If you want a good vacation, go to another hotel. Daytona is a nice place to visit, just avoid the Plaza Resort and Spa. It was built 99 years ago and shows it's age.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: emilythegreat
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a five day stay at Plaza Resort and Spa in Daytona Beach. Just a getaway for myself, my mom and my 3 children (ages 9, 8 and 2). I was pleasantly surprised upon arrival to the hotel. It is one of the more beautiful places on the A1A. Conveniently located near restaurants and recreational areas as well as banks, grocery and convenience stores. Our room was an oceanfront queen room with two beds, bath and kitchen area. The room also boasted a 42" (poss. bigger) flat screen television with basic cable programming and a balcony. Pros: Large room, even with 3 children, comfortable CLEAN beds, plenty of pillows, clean carpet, VERY quiet ( i think i was concerned more about our noise than any noise coming from elsewhere), Microwave, Mini Fridge, Granite countertops, Plenty of cabinet and drawer space in the kitchen area for snacks, cups and plates we purchased to avoid eating out every night, regular room service ( to keep bathroom well stocked with soaps, towels, shampoos, etc.), additional comfy chair and ottoman, privacy curtains on balcony door with additional sheer in case you want to have some light come in, table and two chairs for easy dining, tile entry way so you don't get the carpet wet and saturated with sand from the beach, in room safe, iron, blow dryer and ironing board, large closet for baggage, padded bench for additional seating, valet parking included in the resort fee which turned out to be a godsend because it was awefully hot, easy access to the beach, wonderful heated salt water pool with jacuzzi jetted area for legs and back (and trust me, i was in the pool every night). The children had an awesome time at the pool. Because it was so hot outside, we waited each day until almost sunset to do the beach and the pool. This hotel was wonderful to not have restrictions on when you can be in the pool. The kids had a ball in the pool every night, some nights until 11 or 11:30pm. Ample poolside seating, Ample beachfront seating with umbrellas provided daily. Upscale setting downstairs in the lobby and colonnades of the hotel. CONS: stepping onto the balcony, there is this annoying upstep that I hit my toe on a few times (a sign does warn you of this), a couple of moths came into our room with the balcony door open at night and lights on in the room, one large water beetle/roach thing ran in---these however are expected in that kind of setting, so the bugs really didn't bother me too much. Restaurant prices fairly high. I had a menu sent up for room service, but ended up ordering out because it just cost less. I was on the 12th floor and couldn't get a strong wifi signal. I was however able to get connected in the lobby, so i don't think it was my computer. Overall a great place to stay. Extremely happy with the tranquility of the view, the rooms and the noise level. No loud band playing which made our stay peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “first floor room COCKROACHES”
Reviews.Author: HifromCanada
Reviews.Content: Traveling from Canada after visting Disney decided to say at Daytona in a nice hotel beach front. Booked a 3 night say. Large nice room when we arrived with small patio pool side. First night stay moved a bag on the kitchen counter - something moved and moved fast !!! But really not sure what it was, second day, opened kitchen cupboard door COCKROACH scrambled I saw at least 5 and they where not little ran under the fridge and across the floor..... I went to front desk and quietly (because I am Canadian and a quiet person) said to the lady "Do you have any bug spray I have alot of bugs in my room" She didn't seem surprised and said she would call someone. I waited 1 1/2 hours called front desk two more times they finally sent a man with a can of pesicide to my room which sprayed the cupboards and the fridge a/c unit and under the beds. There was no discount or offer to change rooms NOTHING!! We cancelled the last night and headed home. I just returned from a long drive back to Canada and leaving my luggage in my car overnight I am not bringing it into my home until I check everybag. If this happened where I am from I would of had the biggest I am so sorry and given back my money for my stay... Never even got a free coffee cause I wasn't going to drink the coffee left in the room. Actually I had to throw out all the food we had just bought from the store due to the COCKROACHES and now they where covered with pesticide.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel...for cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: WROBZEUS
Reviews.Content: My family had four rooms, all on different floors, for four nights. Each of us had problems with cockroaches. I was soooo totally disgusted.

Reviews.Title: “Upon arrival the check in service person...”
Reviews.Author: avilasl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the check in service person was rude and unorganized. The hotel had valet service had one person working and cars backing up creating a cluster. "You paid for the service whether you used it or not!" The elevators were slow with long waits, the rooms air conditioner was covered in mold. The air unit never cooled the room down, the shower had mold. To top it off the pool was very dirty and murky with unknown slime surrounding the edges, won't ever return here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: PaLulu
Reviews.Content: We all had a great time the hotel was great and the pool and spa were fantastic. Its located right on the beach, quiet, friendly, the bathrooms could use some updating, but overall highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “If I didn't have a discounted rate, I would have been very upset.”
Reviews.Author: 2Carneys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found a discount for this hotel and decided to book it based on having previously admiring this hotel while driving past it. Before we left, I did look at the other reviews on Trip Advisor and became a bit worried. I did know about the $15 resort fee when we booked, so we were not surprised by that upon check in like the person in line in front of me was. The resort fee does cover your valet fee for your stay and we did get free breakfast each morning with our package that we booked. The free breakfast was the hotel's breakfast buffet which could best be described as edible food. There was hot and cold food available, we did enjoy the fresh fruit. We had paid a bit extra per night for an oceanfront room. We were given a 1st story room that was indeed oceanfront, but we had to look past the courtyard and pool to see the ocean in the distance. We were really looking forward to time spent on the balcony, but we had only a "patio" with one chair that was open to the pool/bar area. Not very private. The room was very clean and quite roomy. Nice large flat screen plasma t.v., also. We had no problem with our room, just it's location. We asked the front desk if we could move to a higher floor after the first night. We were told that they were full booked and there was no way. It was a Saturday, so we accepted it along with our free breakfast voucher. The location was great, we were able to walk to many places we wanted to go. The valet's were very friendly and polite. The next morning my husband asked the front desk if we could change rooms again, I thought he might have better luck... The lady told him that it was possible since many people were checking out and that we should check back after 2:00pm. We decided to go see a movie around 1:00, so we stopped by the front desk again to check on their progress. The same lady was there and she kindly told us that they didn't know yet, but she would make sure to keep us in mind and let the lady coming on to the next shift know what we wanted to do. When we returned around 4pm, we were told by the 2nd shift that "No, that's not possible, we're booked." This is the same "non-friendly" person who checked us in and couldn't help us the previous day with our request. I politely told her that the lady from the morning shift had said that she would keep us in mind and that maybe she had saved us a room. She replied " We've had some walk-in's, we're full." It's not like we wanted a different grade of room, just a different floor. Couldn't they have switched us with one of the walk-in's before they had walked in?! This could be a very beautiful hotel if it was better maintained. My husband is an achitecture buff, so we notice pretty much every detail. There were many small things that needed to be fixed. Over all, I might stay at this hotel again, but I would be sure to ask for a room not on the first floor or at least one not near the pool/bar because they leave the music and t.v.'s blaring all night long many nights. Each time the air conditioner turned off, you could hear the noise through the sliding glass door. I did finally call the front desk at 2am and ask them to please turn it off.....they did. The hotel's restaurant seemed a bit over priced given all the eateries around the hotel. We did have the free buffet breakfast with our package, but I would not have paid $10 a person for it. If you decided to stay here, make sure to read the fine print, don't take a room on the 1st floor and be prepared to wait for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Sucked”
Reviews.Author: BeckyLynne
Reviews.Content: The entire stay of 4 hours included everything from the jammed entry door at the end of the hall to the old damp smelling, wall unit A/C, to the roaches we disturbed by using 'their' A/C. Dirty, dingy bathroom and grimy carpet. Terrible experience. The staff at the front desk is extremely rude. What was good about the resort? Leaving! We left at 1:15 AM. Would we recommend? Negative!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a resort”
Reviews.Author: Erika20
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend July 8 - 11, two adults with our two young children, ages 2 and 10 months. Please note, we were hosted by my inlaws, so we did not pay for the room, etc. Here are my thoughts: Pros Room was quite large - we had a room with two queen beds, and we were able to fit in two pack and plays with no issue. One of the largest hotel rooms I've had in the US without it being a "suite" Room included a "wet bar" area with an empty fridge, coffee maker and microwave. It's my understanding that not all rooms included this. The pool area was clean Proximity to the beach was great and the beach area was clean, uncrowded and had no cars allowed There was wireless internet in the room Hotel is walking distance to a number of restaurants, bars and a movie complex The Cons The hotel was not the cleanest I have stayed in. There were ants in our room and on our balcony, and we found them in the bed as well. The balcony was literally not attached to the hotel wall - there was a gap of about 4 inches of missing concrete. Because of the kids' sleep schedule I spent some time out there reading, but held my breath most of the time. I would not have let my kids step foot on the balconies. The wireless internet was spotty at best. Ok for checking email, but not much else. The elevators are awful. There are not enough for the hotel; they stop and start on a whim, and pay little to no attention to what buttons are pushed/floors are requested. We rode up and down the entire hotel a number of times. The view of the ocean from your balcony is great; the view of the dirty rooftop that is also included is not. The staff at the front desk were awful and there was ALWAYS a line of at least 10 people. Parking costs a ridiculous amount of money. Overall, for a relatively inexpensive beach vacation, this isn't bad - there is a lot of space, a "kitchen" area that is great for keeping snacks and a nice beach and ocean just a few steps away. But do not, for a second, think that this is a resort or a 4 star hotel. It is the equivalent of a Holiday Inn on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Management is Horrible for a "Resort" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoldenIvy
Reviews.Content: We booked are stay the day of July 3 for a "discounted" rate of $199.99 plus taxes and hotel fees!! We were told we were getting a King suite, however we got a room with a queen sized bed. I called the front desk to inform them we paid for a king suite but our room had a queen bed and we needed a rate adjustment. The lady at the front desk said I first had to have a housekeeper come and confirm my bed size then speak to the "only" manager that didnt come on duty until 11am. So I sort out the housekeeper who couldnt speak or write fluent english, however she did confirm our bed was a queen bed. Before check out I kept calling down for the manager who never showed up before our late check out and there was no one else on duty who could make a price adjustment. We stayed in Dayton awhile just so we can wait for the manager Ed Myers who never showed up!! In the following days I kept calling him and leaving messages and got no return calls. Finally a week later I got an assistant manager who said she could give me a $60.00 rate adjustment. This was so unprofessional for this resort!! For the money it is not worth it at all!! I will never stay here again. Its overrated and pricey as heck!!

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great...”
Reviews.Author: tonyvtravels
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this 'resort' are clearly mixed. My wife and I traveled to Daytona for the NASCAR July race. After reviewing the other reviews, we decided to go in with the best possible attitude. (NOTE: we have noticed that stays at motels are generally what you make them to be). Overall Plaza Resort and Spa was a strong 3 star - not a 4. We do travel a lot and this is honestly not a 4. However, our room was clean and updated. This is an older property. Thus the bathroom is small. The a/c is loud - but not terrible. The hallways did have a slight musky smell to them but so do lots of properties on the beach. We found the front desk friendly and helpful. The lobby is very nice and the pool areas as well. The average room price at the resort during the July 4th weekend was $329. We would have been disappointed if we paid that price. However, we would NEVER pay that price at any resort. We booked through priceline and paid $125/night. The room had two queen beds and the view was not ocean view. Again, for us, that was okay. We never spend time looking out the window at the beach. Another thing to consider. Daytona is an older beach town. The whole town has an old feel to it. From what we saw, there was very little new development of resorts. We would not choose Daytona Beach for a vacation spot. 25-50 years ago this would have been a great vacation spot - but not now. Keeping the surrounding area in mind the Plaza Spa and Resort was a nice place in an older beach town. TonyTravels

Reviews.Title: “RESORT--NOT SO!!!”
Reviews.Author: tripper068
Reviews.Content: I just wish I had read the reviews before booking this "resort??". Folks it's awful. They have only 2 attendants parking your car. Wait is long to get the car. The first morning, we tried to get a cup of coffee from the market downstairs. Mgr. was suppose to open at 7:00. At 7:15 my daughter inlaw asked the desk. When the Mrg. arrived he was told by the desk we were waiting...His reply was rude and insulted my daughter inlaw that she didn't want to go into the store. He almost got poked in the mush from me. Same morning pool opens at 7:00. I walked out to pool (which by the way is HOT AND SALTY), Before the kids could swim they had to fish out 3 lounges and 2 chairs. Booze cups all over the place near the pool. Finally at 8:30 someone arrived to "clean" up. There is NO SECURITY at this place. You will spend a lot of money here with very little in return. There are 3 elevators servicing this place which is very large. Plan on spending a lot of time waiting for elevators or walking to stairs. It is not a clean place to be called a resort. Save your money...there's a Holiday Inn Resort down the street about a block.

Reviews.Title: “not even close to a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsA02
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not even close to a 4 star hotel unless daytnoa beach has become a real dump. They nickel and dime you for everything in the hotel. The rooms where very small for me, my husband and my 8 year old son. It was hot that week and the pool is salt water and heated which it did Not need to be. We couldn't watch TV at night because then my son would stay up and watch with us, they gave us a king size bed with a pull out couch with a baalcony. Way to small for 3 people. There is No place to put your clothes since they have a mini-fridge filled with their drinksin the room underneath the TV and then a whole draw full of goodies, so three small draws on each side. My husband lived out of his suitcase. Then we asked to switch rooms which would be the same size but 2 queen size beds and No balcony. So we couldn't win. I would not go back there and would not reccommend it. We even left early did Not even stay the whole week.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be, I wouldn't recommend again”
Reviews.Author: ryanjulia
Reviews.Content: I had recommended this hotel in a prior review, but must say my opinion has changed since 3 years ago. We stayed Memorial day weekend. When we got to our room it was in poor condition. I had to call and have the carpets vaccumed as they were filthy. They looked like they hadn't been vaccumed in weeks. all along the sliding door to the balcony, there were dead dried up bugs inside the room, this was a huge problem as I have a young child that puts stuff in her mouth. They were very visible and looked like they had been collecting for weeks. Something housekeeping should have def taken care of. The tub in the room had mold and mildew growing in the corners...also something a little bleach could take care of if attended to. When the person did come to vaccum, she had a very dated "commercial" vaccum that didn't seem to have any suction and still didn't clean very well, she had to go over places repeatedly to pick up the debris. Housekeeping didn't come until after 3 when my kids were napping so some days I just had to ask for clean towels. The hotel does not seem to have enough staff, especially around the pool area. One late morning I took the kids to the pool and sat my stuff at a table with an umbrella, using 2 chairs. There was what appeared to be a discarded soda can at the table and noone around it. Soon after I sat down a "female" came to the table and said I would have to get up that she was reserving it and had been all morning. I replied that there is no one at it and I was only using 2 chairs. She was very rude and we had a a couple of exchanges before a nice man at the next table offered to share his with my family. This should not be allowed. This hotel does not feel like a 4 star resort at all. You basically have to fend for yourself in all aspects of your stay. From housekeeping to using pool facilities.
