Thus, after paying $15 per day as a resort fee. The beach is very nice, but the hotel has become very run down. I'm going back to Daytona over 4th of July, however I am staying at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “WORST STAY EVER! THE PLAZA DOESN'T CARE ABOUT THERE CUSTOMERS!”
Reviews.Author: trisha_dickens1
Reviews.Content: This is the letter I send to the GM and never got a response: To the General Manager or whom it may concern (if anyone cares) I would like to tell you about my stay at your hotel: FIRST, I would just like to say the Ocean Waters Spa is WONDERFUL! We had great service and an amazing couples massage there! Its like it was a totally separate entity from the hotel. NOW let me tell you about our experience at your hotel. We had booked our room ( a king bed oceanfront) several weeks in advance from the 28th of May through the 31st of May. It was Memorial Day weekend, I understand that, but for my boyfriend and I it was a special getaway to celebrate our anniversary. I called the front desk in the early afternoon (on the 28th) to let them know that we were driving from the other coast after we got off work and that we would not be able to check in til' after 10pm (We didn't want our room given away). The lady I talked to said it would be fine and that she would make note of that. When we arrived the lady at the check-in counter informed us that we were "upgraded" to a hospitality suite Room #537. When we went in the room we were sorely disappointed! This room smelt musty and damp. We were also really disappointed about the lack of privacy on the balcony and the fact that our room being located behind the pool & tucked away in the corner wasn't really our idea of an oceanfront room (by the way I would like to know what I needed to say when I booked the room besides "oceanfront" to actually get a room on the "oceanfront"). I called the front desk to see about changing rooms to the one I thought we had booked and we were informed that the hotel was full and this was not possible. We then decided it wasn't going to be the end of the world, so we started to unpack our things. Then we saw our second cockroach! The first one we saw upon immediately arriving in the room, and I had mentioned it to the front desk when I had called about changing rooms . The man I had talked to was stuffy and treated me like I was stupid. He said "this is Florida" and "You can't keep them out this time of year." I was thinking "I live in Florida!" and "Yes you can!" I honestly felt like he didn't believe me. I felt like he thought I was making it up to get moved to another room. The third cockroach followed shortly and I called the front desk again and complained, and once again I was treated like I was stupid and like I was supposed to just deal with it! It took a third phone call of dismissal, and then I finally went down to the front desk myself. I respectfully and calmly gave him my grievances. He was still just as smug as he had been on the phone. I couldn't believe his attitude! I was being VERY nice considering the situation and I wasn't being taken seriously at all! He said he would send up the security guard on duty, because he handles all "incidences" at night. The security guard was the nicest man and he totally understood why we were upset with the conditions of the room. He said he would go down to the front desk and see what they could do for us. While he was away we saw ANOTHER cockroach! and then another one! there were even baby ones! We freaked out! How could such a beautiful highly rated hotel be this GROSS! and EXPECT US TO EXCEPT IT! We quickly packed our things! There was NO WAY we were going to sleep in that room. We also smashed two of the cockroaches (although they were still kicking) and put them in a clear bag to show the man at the front desk who was treating me like an idiot . The security guard returned within 10min. and we were all packed up and ready to go when he returned. He said they could move us, and reassured us that the other rooms in your hotel DID NOT have bugs like this one. He said a room like the one we originally thought we were paying for was not available, so we had a choice of two different types of rooms, both of which were inferior to want we had wanted and thought we purchased. We had to make the choice to spend our weekend sleeping in separate beds or looking at the street from the balcony. We went with the oceanfront room #433 and tried to share a small bed all weekend. Our new room was very clean and NOT musty smelling at all, there were no bugs and it was way more what we had expected from this hotel. We made the best of our stay and had no further issues til' Monday the 31st we had ordered room service for breakfast at 10:30. We had requested to pay for late checkout at 3pm. So we wanted to sleep til' around 10:15 or so and wake up and have breakfast at our leisure in our room. We received a call around 9:15 or so rudely awaking us, the lady on the other end of the phone said they had experienced a loss of power and that our room service would not be available that morning. She said that however that were offering a breakfast buffet for a small fee and that it included all of the items that we had requested. I was way too tired and just wanted to forget about it at that point. I told her no thank you and went back to sleep. It was about 10:10 and I was awakened with yet another phone call, the lady said that they could now provide us with the room service we requested. I said "OK". At 10:30 we got our breakfast. Absolutely everything was stone cold as if it had been sitting out. It was either soggy or hard. It was completely inedible. We couldn't even finish it, and we are NOT picky eaters. We paid $41 for that inedible breakfast. We paid for a 3 night stay at your hotel. We paid for late checkout (btw we had 3 knocks on our door by maid's asking if we were checking out late when we told the front desk we were at check in) We paid for parking every day. We spent money at your hotel's spa for massages. We were good customers to your establishment! We never yelled at anyone about these issues. We never caused a scene. We are laid back people. I have NO problem spending money on a vacation, but honestly after that weekend I felt like the Plaza Resort & Spa totally ripped me off! We definitely did NOT get what we paid for. It has been weeks and it still makes me so upset at how nobody cares about stuff like this. That weekend my boyfriend proposed to me and will soon be my husband. It was a very memorable weekend, but the memory is tainted by the difficulties and ill treatment at your hotel. I would NOT recommend this hotel to other people. It's beautiful, has an excellent beach front and great spa, but the customer service at this hotel is THE WORST I have ever experienced. Its like they didn't care if we were even there. That they would rather have us go away and not deal with us, and we didn't do ANYTHING wrong except choose your establishment for our special mini vacation. I have never vented like this about an experience at any place of hospitality before, but this one definitely merits it. I just want someone to make this right by me and my fiance. I just want someone to care. That's all I have to say. Trisha Ann Dickens/Adam C. Boltz

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjtodd11
Reviews.Content: We went to Daytona for spring break and this hotel was perfect. The staff was very understanding of college students and actually catered to us. The location was great and anything you would want to do in Daytona was right there. The best part was the pool party everyday, 6 dollar all you could drink beer. I have no idea why they don't advertise this. I would highly recommend this for a cheap spring break, though not for families during this time.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Chris2433
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in the middle of the week. The hotel was very family oriented and convenient to restaurants, activities and of course the beach. Cars are not allowed on this section of the beach which we preferred. The pool was clean and very nice. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel restaurant and it was delicious. We stayed in a King on the sixth floor overlooking the beach. The room was large, but as has been mentioned already, the bathroom has almost no place to put personal items (not a huge issue for us) and there is not a lot of water pressure which was an issue for my husband. The balcony had cracks along the side edges which gave us pause especially as we could see small chunks of concrete missing from the underside of some of the other balconies. The bed wasn 't particularly comfortable although it wasn't bad either. The carpet needed cleaning but overall the room was clean, attractive and updated. The a/c is definitely on the loud side. It didn't wake me up and I'm a light sleeper; however when it would come on; we had to turn the TV up quite a bit. The room did have a very nice large flat screen TV as well as a mini-fridge, microwave, etc. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. The view was lovely and the overall feel of the hotel was relaxed and laid back. We would definitely stay here again even with the few negatives mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: forgetmenotphotosllc
Reviews.Content: We stayed over memorial weekend. Friday - Monday. There were 25 of us in total in various rooms/ floors thru-out the hotel. There were 4 in my room, myself, my husband, my son and daughter. We normally stay at the Marriott, this hotel was chosen by a friend we went with. She found $90. a night rate. We reviewed Trip Advisor, saw the horrible reviews, but we already were booked thru her, we went in with an open mind. I am doing this review very un-bias. Considering some of the details, I all in all did not have a bad time. I love trip advisor and its members, so Im just stating facts as we saw them. You walk into the hotel, the lobby is beautiful. It is set right on the beach, there isnt a ton of grounds, the pool is small for the hotel size, but clean, there is a small set of stairs that leads right down to the ocean. We went to our room. Appeared decent enough. Bathrooms are very small, no counter space for bathroom products. The corners/ seams of the shower had mold, there was hair on the floor, and the door bottom was banged up/ chipped pretty bad. The beds seemed clean, pillows soft / comfy, we had microwave/ coffee maker , sink and fridge all worked. We had a balcony, the door handle to the balcony was disgusting caked on fingerprint/ dirt (i took a pic if anyone wants to view) there was dust and garbage/ under and behind dressers and beds. Elevetors were HORRIBLE. They would stop on every floor / whether anyone was there or not, doors would not close again for 30-40 seconds. Elevetors were very old and in need of repair, very scary to take them, but we were on the 11th floor with alot of stuff and a little girl. Water went out for several hours one day, Elevetors were completly broke on monday morning- it was our parties check-out day, which means everyone had lug all the luggage and disable people down stairs. Not fun. Power went out monday morning as well. There was a roach-not Palmetto (common in florida ) in our room on two seperate days (I have pictures) also there is a restraunt down stairs several of our party went to have breakfast at while hoping the elevators would be fixed - ( i did not go) but they all saw several roaches at the restraunt. There is no security at the hotel, in the cabana outside a couple was 99% close to having intercourse, very drunk, 1pm and u couldnt find anyone to ask them to cease the behaviour. Also there are security keys to enter the building, but the doors in the back/ basement and by the pool just dont close so anyone can walk in. There are multiple hotels on the strip, I would really consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A SAFE PLACE !!!”
Reviews.Author: chefski
Reviews.Content: I’m a Hotel executive member of a large chain ( top three brands ) and I normally do not write review whether bad or good, I would normally pick up the phone and talk to the General Manager personally and convey my praise or issues so it could be resolved. After repeated calls to the G.M with no response I though I would just move on, however after my bad experiences I felt it absolutely necessary to write a review. The disappointment first started when making a reservation , I called and had a gift certificate and as listed on the gift certificate " No restriction apply " however as the first agent took my info they told me the gift certificates were sold out for the weekend? After the first call the GM I received a follow up call by someone who did not leave their name, ( it was not the GM however ) before I returned their call I called on the Hotel one more time to talk to another shift, and try again with my reservation, it was accepted the second time. I’m not sure who I spoke to, whether the first or second person or who was correct, I suppose the first reservation agent was incorrect. The second incident happened after we checked out. We left our camcorder and a small pocket book in the safe in our room, after being over 2 hours away we called and was told it would cost us to mail the items back to us. Again I work for a hotel chain and we never charge to return forgotten items back to the guest, its just good business, and when you do that for a guest you are assured a repeat customer. Not a fight I am willing to fight, I paid the $16.00 to mail the item back to me. Upon receiving the items back to us in the mail we noticed $200.00 cash ( 2- $100's) where missing, I again called on the general manager the second time and as of this e-mail we have not received a call back from the anyone at the hotel. Check out date was Sunday May 16th. If anyone at this hotel wishes to address these issues please e-mail me at chefski40 @yahoo.com. However I would not feel safe at this hotel (resort) and would keep a close eye on all your belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: greattrip2215
Reviews.Content: The Plaza is everything we could have dreamed of and more! We loved how accessible everything was and how accommodating the staff was... I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Daytona. With its historic presence you can't help falling in love with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: Crazii
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the restaurant were nice. But, most of the staff was not very pleasant at all. The toilet did run off and on a lot; could have gotten it fixed but didn't want to wait for someone to come and waste valuable vacation time. Also, the air conditioner was pretty loud. The balconies were really small for the oceanfront rooms. However, the bathroom was pretty big. The elevators were really quick - especially for Spring Break time. Overall, the experience was great and I would stay again. HOWEVER - PLEASE BE CAREFUL ABOUT THE BALCONIES! The building and balconies looked like some were going to collapse - these should be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “We gave it another chance, but never again.”
Reviews.Author: musketeers82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 7 years ago during spring break and it was mostly families staying. We received poor service, so we got a discount to come and try again. Once again, we had the same problems. Unclean rooms. 3 hours to get towels for the rooms. One time, we asked for clean sheets, and they acted like they changed them twice and kept pulling the same sheets back up.But the biggest problem was that we weren't able to use the pool or feel safe in the hotel because management decided at the last minute to drop the age restriction for renting a room down from 25 and to invite other breakers from the strip and locals to have $6 unlimited beers all afternoon, booty shaking contests, wet t-shirt contests, stripper poles, etc. Which resulted in a rape of an unconscious girl that was witnessed by 2 employees of the hotel. Which was reported in the local newspaper.This was a resort and spa $256 a night room. Basically no security!

Reviews.Title: “Did he really say that?”
Reviews.Author: AtlCheerMom
Reviews.Content: We arrived to sunny Daytona Beach on a pleasant Friday afternoon for my 11 yr old daughter's cheer competition. We were very impressed with the outer and lobby appearance of the hotel. The rooms were decent size however the bathrooms were very small and lacked cleaning. The closet doors were hanging off and fell on my oldest son's head when he tried to open them. We tripped over the steel pole that sits between the sliding door and the balcony. Not to mention that fact, that it wouldn't lock. There were only 2 service reps that were helpful out of the 8 that were standing there. Requests for additional items such as towels or bathclothes took hours. The view from the balcony was great (oceanside) and the kids enjoyed it. The night valet service was horrible. The gentleman had no form of id, other than his driver's license (his words exactly) and told me that if I didn't want him to park my car, I could do it myself. All of this rude and disrespectful behavior, because I, the paying customer, asked if he had id. I will never again stay in this hotel and it should not have four stars.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: pletzkeb
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful historic hotel on the beach. We had a room with 2 queen beds, large flat screen TV, safe, wet bar which was stocked with 2 glasses and 2 coffee cups, refrigerator, microwave, coffee service, and balcony with a view of the beach and Atlantic Ave. The beds and linens are high quality. They offer free internet. Parking is either $8.00 per day to self park or $12.00 a day valet. We opted to valet park and the service was fast and friendly. There is an on-site restaurant, room service, and Market Cafe with many food items. You can opt to order a Caesar Salad from room service for $12.00 plus $2.00 room service charge and 18% gratuity, or purchase the same Caesar Salad from the Market Cafe for $4.95. We had some of issues with the room. The closet doors were broken and difficult to slide open and closed. The balcony door did not lock, but had a pull down Charlie bar. I would put the bar down when leaving the room for the day to lock the balcony door. However, when I returned, housekeeping would always put the bar up, unlocking the door. The entry door to the room was difficult to close and had to be slammed shut. The bathroom was very small with little or no space to store personal items and it needed some grout work in the shower. Housekeeping was average, one day cleaning the coffee pot and one day not. But, the worst issue was when I found a roach running up the wall at the wet bar. I managed to kill it and leave it in the sink for housekeeping to see. I mention this since the room was $135.88 the first and last nights of our stay and $552.13 for five nights in between due to it being Race Week and the Daytona 500. All of the hotels jack up the price during the races. When I complained, I was compensated with $50.00 off the room for that night and complimentary breakfast for the remainder of our stay (3 days), although we could not order off the breakfast menu. We had our choice of the buffet, which was not always available, or a set menu. My last issue with the hotel is that on three or more days of our stay there were Girl Scouts selling cookies in the lobby. My husband and I buy GS cookies for us and the military troops from our granddaughter every year, so I wasn't interested in buying cookies. They practically badgered you and if you didn't buy, they were a little sarcastic. This should not happen in a hotel. Would recommend with some reservations.

Reviews.Title: “"claiming too many stars"”
Reviews.Author: DUTCHANDFREE54
Reviews.Content: At one time this might have been a four star resort......however the claim to fame shows ragged edges and lack of maintenance. Service when we checked in was spotty, no attention to the email i send asking for feather free room, and front desk response was indifferent....and that is being nice. Valet parking.......yeah if you can find your keys yourself and then find your car...the "valet" was not to be found. The rooms are tired, carpet, furniture and walls all proclaim that the battle was fought several years ago....and since then no further efford. Compared to The Shores we stayed in a few weeks ago...there simply is no competition, The Shores wins hands down.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great valet service”
Reviews.Author: lockheed101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the plaza resort for 3 days on business. Due to business I travel a lot and after a long day of work, all I want to do is relax in my room. The room stayed in top notch condition for my entire length of stay and the valet service was the best by far out of every hotel I've ever stayed at. Everyone was extremely helpful and it almost made my stay more of a vacation than business. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: discerning4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met her sister and family in Daytona this weekend. We stayed and the Plaza Resort and Spa. It was wonderful. We stayed on the 10th floor facing North. We could see both the Ocean and the City. The hotel was clean and has a beautiful lobby. The staff was very attentive and was genuinely interested in taking care of their guests. The room was very nice but the bathroom was small by most standards. It just needs a little more shelf space but this is an older property and that is the way they were back in the day. All in all all of us agreed that we would be happy to stay there again and look forward to the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “well located, but tired, dated with a cosmetic facelift”
Reviews.Author: acmidas
Reviews.Content: Must be 30+years old, and is now a condominium hotel. Our room had a great view of the beach and city, but was obscured by "fogging" on the window. Doubt the window was externally washed in 10 years. The bathroom was tiny, but the room was acceptable. The room looked to be renovated on the cheap, maybe 10 years ago. We booked on priceline, and got good value. Would not pay over $70/night. There is also a charge for parking and "mini safe" rental not shown when booking. There is a great family owned pizzeria across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A very refreshing and relaxing vacation, I never wanted it to end.”
Reviews.Author: imdadog
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a wonderful holiday vacation. It was better than we anticipated. My family was hesitant to spend the holidays away from home because we just did not think it would be the same without snow but we soon found that the resort had so much to offer that we soon forgot about that. The staff was great and very friendly, they made us feel very welcome. The first impression was amazing it was very big, beautiful and very clean. I think they offered something for just about everyone. It was our first visit here but we will certainly return again in the future. I would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great ammenities & service”
Reviews.Author: warmerweatherplease
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the usual beachside hotel, but the Plaza is a step above those everyday accommodations. The hotel has a lovely, intimate restaurant, great pool area with a poolside bar, and my wife was able to schedule a massage at the spa. The bar inside the hotel sports a billiard table and occasional live music. We attended a wedding in one of the ballrooms and they are quite lavish as well. The staff was friendly and courteous. All in all a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: lmkpt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Plaza Resort and had a wonderful time. The service at check in was great! The restaurant and spa are excellent. All of the staff is so friendly and it is nice to see a smiling face at the front desk after a long day of traveling. The room was clean and you can't beat the 42" plasma. The hotel is located in a perfect area surrounded by restaurants, shops and clubs that you can walk to. I can't wait to go back and spend more than just a couple days.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 or even 3 and a half Star”
Reviews.Author: toddling40
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to Priceline a New Year's Eve getaway. I thought, what the heck, and I tried for a 4-star first. Normally, Priceline is very accurate or at least pretty close with star ratings. The Plaza is no 4-star hotel. The good: --Very friendly beginning; the parking valet was an incredibly nice young man who was very efficient, too. --Attractive lobby; lots of original, elegant dark wood. --Sublimely comfortable beds. --Great location, a quick 5-minute walk down the street or the beach to the Ocan Walk area, 10 minutes to the pier. --Fridge and microwave in the room --Reliable free high speed wireless internet The mediocre: --Strangely laid out bathroom with no vanity, just a pedestal sink and two very small glass shelves, laden with towels. --banged up and dinged features everywhere in the hotel; very worn --Semi-professional desk staff making rude comments about other hotel staff (one called the manager an idiot in front of me!) and another basically tell a woman who needed a printer for tickets to go take a hike. Unacceptable staff, really, if we're going to try to call it 4 or even 3 star, and what hotel doesn't have a freaking printer that a guest can use these days? --Dreadful, generic cheap motel coffee --Only one trash can for the whole room; it's in the bathroom The bad: --Very noisy. --Dirty windows and graffiti carved into the windowsill --Sneaky $2.00 "safe fee" tacked onto bill. I think this is worse than "resort" fees. This, however, is admittedly somewhat offset by the fact that high speed was free--that's rare at 3, 4, and 5 star properties. --Just one glass in the room and it was spotty. So, nothing terrible about the place, but it doesn't meet any of the standards that one expects for a 4-star property, or even the 3 and a half that Tripadvisor affords to it. I wouldn't stay there again; I'd just shell out for the Hilton down the street rather than risk the Priceline bid.

Reviews.Title: “Management & Service Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: dchanel875
Reviews.Content: I chose this property to celebrate a special occassion with my mom-and it was ruined. I work in a 5 star hotel-and only see my mom once a year, and wanted something nice, on the beach with a spa and restaurant--and this was 4 star rated. What a joke. Although much of Daytona is older and run down-this hotel looked nice..but the rooms however, were much older than pictured. I paid additional to have an oceanfront room-but the balcony was really really small. You could not even face your deck chair forward it was so narrow. My mom received a serious electrical shock when the metal balcony deck chair she was sitting in brushed the a/c unit -because it was not grounded. Because the balcony is so small-it was hard not to brush up against the unit. There is also a 4 inch metal lip that separates the room from the balcony-and it's easy to trip over. After check in-I called the spa and they only had one half hour appointment the following day, and I was told they were closing early. We were disappointed-as we wanted a girls day at the spa, but we decided to have a cocktail and dinner early instead. Disappointed again. We went downstairs and found that the lounge. poolside grill, tiki bar and restaurant were all completely closed--which was not posted anywhere-and I was not advised of that at check in. The giftshop in the lobby had also closed 5 hours early-so we couldnt even get a water. I approached the manager to speak with him. I explained my mom had had surgery, and that I selected the property for all of their amenities-none which were available. He was extremely rude-and said it was slow-so they decided to close without warning. He then added if I "really" worked in a hotel-I should know that, and he made a snide comment to the front desk clerk next to him.My mom had had knee surgery--so those were amenities were very important in my selection of a hotel, however I did not even receive an apology. I was also suppossed to receive a $25 hotel credit-which I did not get--but I was billed in advance for parking and a room safe that I did not use. The next time I fly to Florida for a one day special trip, I will not be staying at this hotel. Very very disappointing. Management was disgraceful.

Reviews.Title: “nice for the price, nice spa”
Reviews.Author: beach_mom_leesburg
Reviews.Content: this was my first visit to daytona beach...i traveled with my sister for a girls weekend & spa trip...the hotel was "nice" certain things could you some updating, the rooms are on the smaller side & the bathroom small, everything seemed very clean & the staff was pleasant...had breakfast in the restaurant there, it was good...drinks out on the veranda at night was nice! hotel was mostly empty so not much excitement going on this time of year i guess...the spa was very nice! must nicer than it appears for the outside, the girls who did the treatments (massage, facials, pedicures, manicures) were awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetoscrapbook
Reviews.Content: Imagine the Titanic – as a hotel! The building has beautiful crown molding and regal furnishings with beautiful lounging areas that allow you to enjoy the gorgeous view of the beach. I was equally impressed with the staff. There was not a single staff member that we met that was not curious and helpful. During or stay we also enjoyed on many occasions the Magnolia Restaurant located across from the hotel lobby. I must say from breakfast to dinner the portions where large and the price very reasonable. It was nice to not have to leave the hotel in search off quality food at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: morncely
Reviews.Content: People at front desk were very polite, helpful, had many suggestions for our traveling experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Sunshine80
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing about this hotel is its beachfront location. Their pool area is also great. That’s about it. Upon our check-in, we had the rudest person working at the front desk that wouldn’t even answer basic questions regarding the area. Parking is $8 a day in their garage that doesn’t have security gate or any security staff. You only receive a tag from front desk. Also as many other travelers complained about is the elevator issue. It is horrible. It takes about 15 mins to get from bottom floor to the room. There was always the line for the elevator and it made it was just horrible. Hotel rooms are decent, however bathrooms are the smallest I have ever seen! One sink and no vanity at all. As I mentioned earlier location and pool are the only benefits, but for that price there are many other beautiful hotels in the same location and beautiful pools with much nicer staff and many more amenities. I would rate it as 2.5 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-Away!”
Reviews.Author: RonLizD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here often and love the staff, its location, historical yet up-to-date decor, and the beach front!. My wife is a realtor has recommended the Plza to many of her clients. Those who've stayed loved it too. The down side is the elevators may be slow during high traffic hours. All the pluses overcompensate for this shortcoming though.

Reviews.Title: “Bring an escape ladder ...you ll need it if you want to leave your room”
Reviews.Author: elizabethF67
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the Plaza is a very nice hotel with an outstanding beach front location. The support staff are wonderful. We truly enjoyed the beachfront room. It was clean and well decorated, bathrooms are small though. Now comes the bad news... On our first evening, at around 11pm after a full day of flying shopping etc, my husband went to open the door to hang the do not disturb sign, unfortunately the dead bolt jammed and we were locked in...we couldnt get out of our room...we called the front desk, they sent up the engineers and after 20 minutes of hard work and busting the door open, we were free!! Another room was ready for us, only after my husband called down to make sure they had one , because no one thought about it...nice. Any way we could only have the 2nd room until the next day, and then, yes you guessed right, we were moved a 3rd time . Imagine repacking and unpacking again. We are now in room #3...I get up in the morning, go to open the door, the dead bolt on the new rooms door jams...we cannot believe it, we are locked in our room again! Needless to say, the dead bolt was removed, with out any damage to the door, which allowed us to stay in this room.....Thank goodness. We brought it to the attention of the manager, I mean who wouldnt...this is ridiculous, and completely unsafe to say the least. Im wondering if the Daytona Fire Department is aware of the faulty cheap dead bolts being used in this hotel. This is a huge safety issue, imagine if we had to evacuate..11 th floor and 5th floor, we would have died plain and simple. 2 bolts in two days and in 2 separate incidents? Not good at all. The manager did not apologize, he even had the odacity to imply that we were after compensation...how dare he. What an ignorant person he is. We as a family, love Florida and its fine beaches...we just cant get over how truly disgusting that the manager of the Daytona Plaza and Resort treated us, after what we went through.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was beautiful as it was located right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: mvensel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The rooms were spacious and the breakfast buffet was delicious. The only complaint would be the elevators. At the peak of departure, only two of the three were in operation. This made leaving quite the adventure. There were lines to get on the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and very relaxing and pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinLove
Reviews.Content: We came to Daytona because we were flying out of Sanford. We always went to Fort Myers Beach but I think we found a new place. Wish we would of had more time. I would of liked of went to the spa for the day. The beach was awsome compared to the Gulf side. Love the ocean front room. My husband justed picked this hotel when we were driving down the street. He did a great job choosing, He impressed me again!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL FAMILY REUNION STAY”
Reviews.Author: Amberscute
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Resort & Spa was a wonderful place for a family reunion. We enjoyed the lovely rooms that have been updated and all of our rooms had balconies(which are hard to find in Daytona). The housekeeping service was terrific. The restaurant offered a hearty breakfast buffet and the pool restaurant/bar was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “this place is outstanding !”
Reviews.Author: wetravel1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were checked in by a friendly lady ! when we got to our room it was outstanding the flat screen was nice the room service was fast our bed was big and comfy ! breakfast was great eggs bene was to die for rest. staff was extremely friendly and the pool was great to ! thanks plaza we enjoyed ourselves !

Reviews.Title: “Deception...Read Carefully.”
Reviews.Author: getawaysam
Reviews.Content: Like with other readers, I would have left if not booked on Priceline. I would love to know how Priceline calculates their "stars". I would give this place a 1 out of 5 smiley faces, at best. Hotel needs updating to say the least. Horrible odors waft the hallways and hotel attacts a Motley crowd, even for Daytona. The pool was cloudy and overloaded with bathers. Overall, an outdated and unclean experience.

Reviews.Title: “We will not stay at the Plaza again.”
Reviews.Author: octoberred
Reviews.Content: Be aware that there is an mandatory $8 per day parking fee, which does not guarantee that you will be able to park at the hotel. They tell you at check in that you must display the parking tag to prevent your car from being towed. The parking deck has many signs stating that unauthorized vehicles will be towed. On our second night, we were not able to find a parking spot after dinner. We were told to park across the street. When we got to the hotel, we went around and counted no less than 11 cars and one motorcycle without parking tags. When we went to the front desk to complain, we were told, "Those people are really brave." We never once saw a tow truck on the property over the long weekend that we stayed there. The Plaza has many, many more rooms than it does parking spaces, so to charge a fee for a parking space "lotto" without stating it as such upfront is almost stealing. Plus, allowing "party" attendees who were there attending functions at the hotel conference rooms to park in the hotel parking spaces and not requiring them to pay $8 is bad policy. They should park across the street. Additionally, there is a $2 per day charge to use the safe, but this is not divulged unless you ask. I cannot believe this hotel had a 4-star rating. The rooms are OK, but we heard several people at the pool complain about roaches. We only saw one in the hall in the basement. At check in, they assigned us to a "city view" room, despite the fact that I had contacted them ahead of time and requested an ocean view room. We were told that all ocean front rooms were sold out. Only after I came down from the room in person and stood in line behind several other disgruntled customers did the guest relations person tell me "OK, I'll just give it to you." I had already paid for it! Of the 50 plus ocean front rooms, we only saw evidence of occcupancy in about 20 of them, if that. They have towels at the pool bar for use at the pool that you have to sign for, but there is just a bin for returns. We found out later, that if you don't sign when you return them, you are charged $2 per towel. The towel girl did not say anything about this when I got towels. There are two "cabanas" at the pool. We watched different people go and sit in the cabanas throughout the day and then get booted out by the pool towel girl. She told some of them that it could be reserved for $50 for the day. A simple sign stating these things would have been a lot more courteous to the customers. At check out, I was charged $2 per day for the safe (after I had just called on the phone to inquire about it). The safe was locked with a sign stating that you would be charged $25 if you left it locked when you checked out. I called down to make sure they knew that it was locked when I got there. I did get credited for one day's parking fee without a fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and a huge waste of money”
Reviews.Author: mssche
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a smal family getaway with the kids but it was a horible experience for us. We arrived at the hotel "suppose to be spa" and checkin went fine. I wa a little upset because they couldont put us on the same floor but I was able to forget about that when I walked into the room. When we entered the room, we were greeted by a huge waterbug so I went back to the front desk and told them what had happened and that I wanted another room but the lady at the front was very rude and inconsiderate. She basically said to find another hotel. So we asked for the manager and needless to say, she said that he was not in. So my father went back to the front desk and the manager was there and he gave us a key to another room but I guess there was another lock on it because we couldnt get in. So the manager told my father that we would be moved to another room the next morn. But what they didnt relaize is that we tried to get throught the night. To make a long story short, by the morn we had come across six (6) altogether. I took pictures to show to the front office staff but they did not want to see it. So I winder how they thought we ere feeling at that point. I am so upset because I was told that this was one of the best hotels but I was fooled. I would not recommend this hotel to ABSOLUTELY NO ONE. my entire weekend was horrible due to my first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Deception is key”
Reviews.Author: ilikereviews
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel through Orbitz. The room came with a free breakfast each day. We noticed immediately, upon calling the hotel to confirm the reservation and breakfast, the unfriendly staff. Nothing rude, just very unfriendly. Upon arriving, we were amazed at how nice the hotel looked. We pulled up, checked in (once again with a somewhat cold employee), then pulled around to see the deteriorating parking deck. We carried our bag down a few stairs to the elevator (not wheelchair friendly). There are 3 elevators, all side by side, that work at their own pace for the 13 story hotel. We got to our room on the 6th floor which looked like it used to be really nice...in the 1970s. It did have a refridgerator, microwave, and an LCD TV, but the room smelled of mold. The closet doors were off the sliders. The bathroom light didn't work. We were missing a chair on our balcony. The "oceanview" room had a beautiful view of the disgusting, old parking lot, and a peripheral shot of the ocean. The balconies were very crowded and impersonal. Had someone stayed next to us on either side, we could easily shake their hand from our balcony. The sliding glass door which led to the balcony had a 4 inch high threshold that we had to step over (usually trip and stub our toes) to go outside. The bed was a large and rather comfortable king sized bed with nice pillows. The shower had the basic hotel semi-weak showerhead. The bath tub was long and narrow. There was a lack of counter space in the bathroom as there was only a stand alone sink, a toilet, and two 4x20 inch glass shelves. As for the breakfast...there is nothing I can say that could describe its awfulness. The servers wear ties and appear professional. In actuality, they aren't very friendly (if you haven't noticed this pattern about their employees yet). The "free" breakfast includes the All-American breakfast with eggs, bacon, and grits, or the buffet which consists of cereal, breads, bacon, grits, sausage, french toast, fruit, and milk. It does not include a drink. The french toast tastes like plain bread. Bacon is super greasy. Milk tastes very weird. It's an altogether disaster of a meal. No better way to start the day than with an upset stomach. The pool was nice with plenty of seating and a meal/bar area. The entertainment at the pool was rather boring and obtrusive. The walk through the three foot tall weeds to get to the beach was rather uncomfortable. The parking deck looks as though it may fall at any moment. It appeared to have enough parking spots until Saturday came around and we found ourselves parking a block up the street. Altogether, The Plaza puts up a fancy front, but has nothing to offer behind it. I'm sure it was cream of the crop back in the 1970s, but it has done little to improve since then. Shave $30 off of the price, offer friendlier service, or don't cover up what it really is, and I would recommend this hotel. But as it stands, this place is just not worth the price, service, or experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - great location - no complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: jgordon24
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I went for the Daytona 400 race - arrived June 30 - checked out July 7. We loved it!! We had a king oceanfront room - the bed was very comfortable - similar to those at the Marriott - the balcony was very narrow but we were comfortable with the two chairs and table provided. The bathroom is tight and there is very little room to put anything - the sink was a pedastol sink and there were two glass shelves over the toilet to put any items which you may have. I wouldn't rate this as horrible - just small. In our room we had a microwave and small fridge - yes, there were areas on the carepet that appeared worn however the room was clean. TThe air conditioning was a tad noisy at times but did not disturb our sleep. There was also a flat screen tv and enough room to put your clothes.... the pool deck was fantastic with a jr. olympic pool - there was enough room for everyone.... very clean... great pool deck bar. There is also a nice lounge inside. We ate breakfast at the restaurant - would recommend the Starlite Diner down the street across from the Ocean Walk hotel. The beach infront of the hotel does not permit cars to pak infront of it which is also nice. Walking distrance to everything... try Cruisin' restaurant/bar if you are a NASCAR fan on Main and A1A. We were very happy here and are looking forward to returning as soon as possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...but don't forget anything....because you will never get it back”
Reviews.Author: nebraskanlady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great stay. The hotel was pricey but considering it was race week we were very luck to stay on the beach. All was well....but when I left I forgot my watch and earrings in the room. I called the next day and nothing was found...hmmm amazing. At that point I figured housekeeping now had new jewelry. Yes it was my mistake walking off and leaving them in the room but I knew they were there. Misteriously they were never found. Word to the wise...don't trust this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for this family!”
Reviews.Author: momwithopinion
Reviews.Content: If you just need a cheap place to stay on the beach, this is the place. We booked through Priceline so the room was paid in advance, otherwise I probably would have left. By the way Priceline rates this 3.5 stars, no way! The hotel looks great from the outside, but it really needs a good cleaning, some minor repairs, and updating. When we arrived at the check-in time, our room was not ready. We had to wait another hour for our room, so we weren't able to check in until 5pm. We didn't understand this until check-out when we received a paper giving us the option of late check-out for an additional fee. Don't offer the service if you can't have the rooms ready for the next check-in! Finally, we get checked in and go to our room. It was fine, not a total dump, but nothing special. It was a large room, but it just looked a little worn. I guess I was still expecting that 3.5 star hotel! The bathroom was horrible! Small, low sink with no place to put anything. There was a huge hole in the ceiling and the shower faucet would move in and out. Every 10 or 15 minutes the toliet would run, someone using water in the room above? Our son went out to go for a swim in the pool, but it was full of beer bottles and trash. I don't mean one or two, more like 15 or 20. (I am going to assume that they cleaned the pool the next morning) Now for the positives, the location was great. Everything was in walking distance! If you want to take your family to the beach and stay oceanfront, this price is great. I think we paid $64 a night through Priceline. We booked two hotels with Priceline for this trip, the first one was terrific (The Sawgrass Resort), but this one was a disappointment. To be fair we got what we paid for, but be aware that this is a 2.5 star hotel at best

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: mismalorie
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Hotel was awful. The hotel is massive with only three elevators- two of which were broken for the duration of our stay (3 days). Waiting 15 minutes for an elevator is obscene. Also- the elevators are tiny- many people were cramming inside in wet bathing suits and in all stages of undress. It was un comfortable and very un pleasant- especially since there are 14 floors of quests who need to squeeze into one working elevator. The stairwells were not easily located and were very hot and dirty. The parking was terrible- there werent enough parking spots for the all of the guests and there were no elevators in the garage which made hauling luggage very difficult. We never received maid service even though we called and complained and even spoke to the maid (in charge of our floor) herself! We were assured we would receive maid service but we never did (neither room- we had two rooms booked here) The hotel was also not well maintained- the 4 star rating as to be some sort of joke. The staff was friendly but not overly helpful- or willing to offer anything- after not receiving maid service or being unable to park our car- even though we were paying $8 a day for parking. Also- the pool deck was filthy along with a few of their other outdoor areas. All in all it was very dissapointing and at $160 per night- while it is close to the beach as well as the boardwalk- you could do a lot better for the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Average--Not Terrible, Not Great.”
Reviews.Author: FloriidaFlats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plaza for 5 nights with our 9 and 10 year old boys. It was decent, but certainly not at a 4-star level. Initially we had some problems. The couch frame was broken and could not be used for sitting, but the staff traded out the couch with one that worked. The A/C was also blowing warm, but they quickly fixed it. We also had booked the one bedroom suite, but found there is no door to the bedroom, only a wide walkway, so it is basically one large L-shaped hotel room with no privacy between the bedroom and the living room. That was disappointing. Also, we only had two towels and one bar of soap between the two bathrooms. That, too, was quickly rectified. One bathroom was huge, the other only had room for one person at a time. The room had a large HD TV, but the picture was fuzzy. The A/C was very noisy, which didn't really bother me, because it blew very cold once fixed and set on 68, which is how I like my room for sleeping. The king bed was incredibly comfortable. Overall the room was clean, except for the shower in the big bathroom. The hotel was in a good location, and our view of the beach was really nice. There were some restaurants within walking distance, and other good ones within a short drive. The pool was nice, but unspectacular. The boys enjoyed the 10 ft. depth. The beach location is great, just blocks from the pier, and outside of the area where cars are allowed to drive. It was great for walking and riding skim boards and boogie boards. No shells to speak of. The parking was easy to use and access during the weeks nights. On the weekend we had difficulty finding a parking space, until someone left. The security was lax. The hotel can be accessed by anyone from the beach or the parking garage, and one lady told us their room was ransacked earlier in the day. The lobby is very nice, and the hotel restaurant was hit-or-miss. The lobster bisque and the grouper were very fishy and lousy, but the crab cakes were excellent. Go figure. The breakfast buffet has plenty of food, but is very average in taste. The breakfast pastries were cellophane-wrapped muffins, like at a 7-11. Overall, there are a lot worse places to stay in Daytona, as I have found from personal experience, but there are probably a few better ones, as well. The Hilton's exterior and lobby looked very nice with a similar location. For the right price -- about $125 or below -- I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “never ever again, bugs in room, very disapointed,no secured parking”
Reviews.Author: soffie
Reviews.Content: my husband and i booked a honeymoon getaway. this was one of the better hotels , so we thought. upon arrival, we were told we had to check in ,then park our car ourselfs. after driving around the unsecured parking lot, with no space availble, we were told there was parking across the street. the area is a very poor location...very very scary. we booked and ocean front front.. we were never told the rooms weresold out. the room was over looking the roof with a long distance view of the ocean. we were moved to a better room according to their standard, to our surprised we weregreeted by bugs on the bed, roaches on the walls, after complaining about the bugs, they promised someone would come in to change the bugie sheets and removed bugs. its now 11.30 pm .....we left for a quick meal, came back the bugs was still there, the hotel staff claims we needed to be in the room in order to service it...never heard that before. we were finally moved to another room at 2am . after all of this...we never had a good night sleep. the a/c vent is very very very loud. the windows were very dirty with bugs and finger prints. the bathrooms are very small. cleanliness was very poor. our trip was a nightmare. this hotel did not live up to its standed as claims. would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “5 star wanna be hotel”
Reviews.Author: btsmom
Reviews.Content: When we entered the rather massive lobby, the only thing I remember about it is the smell of mold. Check in at this hotel was mediocre, the greeting was nothing to speak of, we were not really made to feel welcomed to be staying at this hotel. The hotel is 14 stories and our room was on the fifth floor, ocean view. In addition to the ocean however, we overlooked a roof top with standing water. This is florida, a definite mosquito breeding ground. I immediately called the front desk and stated that with all the rooms in this hotel, and with what my nightly rate is, the best you could do was a rooftop full of standing water view? Our room was immediately changed, the security person (dressed in a polo shirt??) delivered our new room keys to us. The location of the second room was more ocean view. As the evening/night progressed, I discovered our room, which was ample size, had not one single wastebasket and when I went to hang my clothes in the closet, neither closet door was on the tracks and the both fell backwards into the closet as I tried to slide them over. The best thing of all though was when we got into our beds at night and the sheets were damp and wet. It was at this time midnight. While I should have checked out IMMEDIATELY, we didn't. I did however call the comfort inn just a few hotels away and made reservations for the next. day. We checked out the first thing in the morning, two days early!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience!! Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DNP2112
Reviews.Content: This hotel unfortunately does not live up to it's once grand standards. Beware, if you book a beach view room you will most likely get a room overlooking the parking lot with the view of the beach in the distance. Breakfast had to be one of the worst meals we have ever eaten in our lives. The only bright spot is the spa! We were hoping for a lot more class from the Plaza and unfortunately, what we got was spring break in your face. But, I guess that is what we should have expected from Daytona Beach. We even canceled nights at the hotel after we had been there less than 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: tke341
Reviews.Content: Although this place isn't worth it's 4-star rating (3.5 at best), it wasn't that bad. I paid $70/night (priceline.com). It was worth that just based on it's location. Right on the beach and within walking distance of many places to eat and the boardwalk. We got a room right behind the elevators and ice machine and never heard them at all. I was impressed with that. Pros: - Clean & Quiet Rooms - On beach - OK Pool - Great prices on food at the pool bar - Walking distance to plenty of shops and rest. Cons: - Check-in a little unorganized - pool and deck not really resort level In the end, I would come back for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Only a 2 night stay, but I would not hesitate to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: mew0359
Reviews.Content: Ok, here is an unbiased review. I have never visited Daytona Beach before, but I did careful research and was intrigued by the history of the Plaza Resort and Spa. First, after driving 9 hours from Myrtle Beach (most of it in heavy pouring rain) we arrived at 9pm on a Monday, very tired! The weather was perfect when we arrived. The check-in couldn't have been any faster or smoother! It was literally 2 or 3 minutes. The rooms where exactly like they where in the photos on-line! Very comfortable beds, I believe I feel asleep in 2-3 minutes. The next morning, breakfast at Magnolia's Cafe was excellent! The location of this Hotel is great! It's not very far from I-95 and it is walking distance to the Ocean Walk Shops, the Boardwalk and Pier. The first night we arrived, we had to walk about 1 block to find an open Restaurant for Dinner (we arrived after 9pm and the Hotel Restaurant was closed) I had no hesitation about walking around the immediate area at night. It seemed fine to me. The pool is fine but not heated. (At least not in April) One thing the Plaza Resort could use-a Hot Tub outside. I believe there is a sauna and whirlpool in the Ocean Waters Spa, but there is plenty of room outside to locate a hot tub. The staff is great, and I must recommend the Spa. My daughter had a pedicure and couldn't stop raving about the service-she even sent me a text message during her Spa treatment. In closing-I would not hesiate for a minute about going back. The overall ambience, decor, location of the Plaza Resort and Spa makes you feel like you are at a much more expensive property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice: clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: prs2007
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews here, I was a bit concerned, but I have learned to read the reviews of people who travel alot, and have better 'comparisons' to make. With that in mind, here is a lengthy review. Since I travel several times a year for leisure and a few trips a year for business, I've stayed in everything from a Fairfield Inn to the Waldorf Astoria. For this trip, I was looking for a 4 star hotel because I was staying 5 nights and it was to be a relaxing vacation. The Plaza was one of the few 4+ star options in the area. While there I used all of the facilities including the spa, fitness center, pool, beach access and restaurants. By the way, it turns out the hotel does not allow anyone under the age of 25 to book a room. I found that advantageous! The Plaza just meets the 4 star rating. It is definitely better then a 3 star, but I've stayed in slightly better 4 stars. The only true negative I had was the noise level. I was fortunate to be staying at a quiet time, but in the middle of bike week or spring break I suspect ear plugs are necessary. The other reasons the hotel just meets a 4 star rating is the fitness center. It is small with older equipment with no treadmill or eliptical. However I was able to get in a decent 20 minute workout each day. The pool is large but plain. What makes it nice is the large deck area and easy access directly to beach. There is also an upper deck which I liked because it was a little more private. There is a bar/grill at the pool. Plenty of deck chairs/loungers too. The rooms are large and clean. I had a king sized bed that was fairly comfortable. I had a 'river view'. I am not one to 'pay extra' for an 'ocean view' unless it is Hawaii. Frankly, I spend enough time on the beach, I'm not concerned about 'viewing' it from my room. The room had a microwave and fridge which I always appreciate. As soon as I get in town I find a local supermarket and pickup water and soda and a few snacks. It helps keep the costs down a little. (by the way, there is a Krispy Kreme donut shop a short drive away!!!! I used the microwave to 'warm' them up each morning!!! ) There is a very large flat screen TV in the room but no DVD player in the room nor available from the hotel. I have seen negative reviews about the bathrooms. Mine was fine. It was obvious that the 'upgrades' the hotel made were in part to the bathrooms where they put up marble walls in the tub area and new tile on the floor. The tub itself is still a standard porcelen tub. But the bathroom was a good size, and I had two glass shelves to 'put my stuff'. I was alone though so perhaps if the man in your life is coming along and has alot of his own 'stuff' it gets a bit tough, but it was fine for me. I saw some negative comments about the slow elevators. I did not find them any slower then most hotels. The staff is very nice and helpful. During my stay they helped me 'online check in' with southwest airlines, found me a place to watch the NCAA March madness games, found my cell phone, and gave me directions to the local library and lighthouse. Each time they were friendly, responsive, and knowledgable. I ran into my room maid a couple of times and even she was friendly! There is a decent selection of snacks and items in the gift shop. Including some frozen dinners and such. The Spa is decent. Better then most but not an Elizabeth Arden Red Door level. I paid $10 for a day pass to try out the steam room and jacuzzi. Nice locker areas, nice shower areas, nice area for mani/pedis, and nice steam/jacuzzi area. All services are priced at 'resort' level pricing (those of you who travel alot to spa resorts will know what I mean) I also tried out a spa a few miles away so there are decent options locally at better prices. But it is nice to just jump on the elevator and head down to the spa. That brings me to the location of the hotel. For me it was ideal. If I had booked my flights right, I would have been able to take the "Do" shuttle from Orlando International Airport to Daytona and avoided the cost of the car rental. Within easy walking distance are a number of restauant options. I was not impressed with the pizza shop directly across the street. The pizza was not good. There is another pizza shop between the hotel and the Oyster Pub so try it first. I was able to catch the games at the Oyster Pub sports bar which is one block from the hotel. The food there was ok, but not impressive. However, the staff at the Oyster Pub was friendly and fun and the place had about 30 TVs. There is also a movie theatre about 4 blocks (very walkable). Within a few blocks there is a Burger King, Quiznos, Bubba Gump, IHOP, and a couple of italian places (low to mid cost). In the hotel, I ate at Magnolias and the food was good at almost reasonable prices. Also one block away is a dance club Razzles (owned by Oyster Pub). I never did find an internet cafe so I headed to the local library and checked my email there once or twice. There is a $5 per day fee to use the library's computers. You get 2 hours for $5 but can use that 2 hours anytime during that day. The hotel has internet access if you bring your computer. There is a Walgreens across the street which has just about everything you could need and you can do 'cash back' if you run low. Save yourself the ATM fees. The lighthouse is definitely worth the effort. It is a 10-15 minute drive down the coast and very nicely kept up. Drive south down A1A until you can't drive any further. You'll see the signs. There is also a quaint chocolate factory a couple miles away. Free tours and samples. I plan to return to the Plaza. Especially if I get another great price! (Can't beat priceline's $95 a night including tax). You won't go wrong staying at the Plaza. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful in the”
Reviews.Author: abbotts55
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK, minus the dirty A1A with no restaurants, loud cars, and general mayhem. However, I would never stay at this hotel again because of the poor security in the supposedly safe parking garage. There is one security person for 4 levels with only a walkie talkie. We witnessed 10 cops chasing an armed man into the garage 15 feet from us. To add insult to injury, the door to access the hotel, which was advertised as needing a key to open, was unlocked. Our friend's window was smashed and all the items in the car were stolen, we witnessed 2 drug deals, a hit and run on a car, and men urinating each night upon our return. Luxury hotel? I think not. Save your money, or else head south 3-5 miles and stay off this strip. On another note, to describe the workout room as a fitness center is an absolute joke...it was smelly, small, and had only 2 ancient bikes for cardio. It was torture trying to work out there for 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but poor area”
Reviews.Author: Gamerwillz
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very relaxing and homely. Just feels like home because it's very clean and relaxing. Nice carpets and decor with good furnishings. Staff were friendly and helpful. Swimming pool is nice with beach view, but the pool is a bit dirty at first but it was cleaned after few days. There is a pool-bar where you can go for a drink or quality burger and chips while you are relaxing at the pool! There is a computer in the hotel for Internet access, it was good. Lift are lovely, there are even curtains in the lifts! Clean and worked well. There are comfortable sofas in the lobby with windows to see the pool and beach - It's really nice to sit there and relax. There is a mini shop in the hotel where you can buy crisps, sandwiches, soft drinks, sweets, magazines and you can buy hot pizza from there which is delicious! Nice breakfast food. Also, there is a bar inside the hotel for nights, I ordered a burger and chips, again, they were delicious, also there is a pool table and TV. The rooms are fantastic with comfortable beds with widescreen LCD TV also the room was very, very clean. Everyday, staff came into our room to make our beds, when we came into the room, we were impressed how well they made the bed and left the room. It is a hotel of high quality. Negative stuff here. The area around Daytona Beach is run-down and it didn't feel safe walking in streets at night. The area just looked rough. Beach in front of our hotel was not good, we expected it to be clear blue sea but it was just dark dirty water with hard sand. I highly recommend going there just for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: We were looking for just a couple of days for a spa getaway at an upscale (not Super 8 or other budget chain) hotel. We also wanted to go where the weather was warm and sunny. I browsed online and found the Plaza Hotel. It looked nice from the photos, so I booked the room for two nights. When I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted in a very friendly and pleasant way by the lady at the front desk. She checked me in quickly. The hotel was decorated beautifully for Christmas, with many lit and decorated trees, poinsettia plants, etc. The room and the rest of the property lived up to my expectations. As hotel rooms go, it was exceptionally large and well decorated. There was a new plasma TV, and all of the carpeting and furnishings were quite attractive. We had an oceanfront room, and this certainly enhanced our visit. We had a trip to the spa for one day. The spa treatments were excellent, and the people were very friendly. I would definitely return to stay at the Plaza Hotel when I'm looking for a step above the usual budget chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury”
Reviews.Author: JoysMaE
Reviews.Content: First things first, just because the hotel has a spa inside does not make it luxury! My stay started on a bad note at registration -- although I stood for 10 minutes in front of the desk neither one of the two women at the desk offered to help me or even acknowledged me because evidently both of them were needed ot upgrade the one family in front of me. The hotel room was nice, big beds and flatscreen tv and a nice view (even if it wasn't oceanside). The location is VERY good, close to other places to eat, (because the egg breakfast here is $8) convenience stores and the beach, which is nice. The bathroom was ridiculously small, but the kitchenette was very nice. Microwave and minifridge provided. There is no indoor pool, and when i called to inquire about the outdoor pool, the attendant was curt with me. The outside and the Lobby are beautiful,; the restaurants are very nice, and the spa looks wonderful but the rates are insane. No offense to Plaza, but i've been in Days Inns that I've enjoyed more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - but some unforseen issues.”
Reviews.Author: JoeSc
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nicely furnished, well maintained, and with a great location, but had a few surprises. It wasn't until we got our checkout bill that we found out that there was a $10.52 charge per day for parking and room safe; no mention of this at check-in. Also, apparently the resort doesn't have access to the rates listed on their website (plazaresportandspa.com), DaytonaHotels.com , or Hotelplanner.com. All rates were the same, but had to call 1-800-Daytona (even though we had a printed copy of the accomodations with rates) and the hotel changed the rates to what was listed, significantly lower. Would recommend prebooking to ensure rate. Overall, a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, brilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: angelousbabe
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Plaza Resort and Spa from the 18 Sept until 2nd Oct 2008. We had to change our holiday from Cuba when Ike hit and as there were very few locations to choose from we opted for this lovely hotel. The hotel was everything we expected it to be. It was always lovely and clean, everyone was very polite and helpful and we have very little we could complain about. Being late Sept it was a quieter time in Daytona beach and in the hotel so there was very little noise at anytime. The room was very large and spacious. Could have done with a sofa as a lot of the time you would have to sit on the beds if you were just lounging around. I agree with another reviewer that if you ware going to supply cooking facilities you should supply the basic utensils. We never tried the pool although it was always very clean and tidy around the area. They did try to charge us for parking but as we had never been told about the charge prior to booking they happily cancelled the charge. We only ate once in the restaurant and the food was very tasty and plenty of it. All in all we had a great holiday and that was in part due to the lovely accomodation we had. I would happily recommend this hotel to others. The only down side we could find was one of the repair men who we had to call up as the safe went wrong at least three times was the only unfriendly person we met all holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Plaza. Goods Outweigh the Bads.”
Reviews.Author: scarlett329
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our Florida vacation. We stayed in Daytona for only 1 day for the beach experience before starting our Orlando condo rental stay at Windsor Hills. (Will write a review about that later). Based on what we saw of the Daytona Beach area, we would not choose it as a family vacation destination. Not very impressed with the Daytona Beach area. There are much nicer family destinations like in Myrtle Beach. GOOD THINGS ABOUT THE HOTEL: Location, 2 blocks from "The Pier" if that matters to some people, and easy to get to right at the end of the road one hotel to the left. If you went straight you'd be in the ocean:) Very large room. Very well decorated Very clean. Very large awesome plasma TV. 9th floor OceanFRONT room had a private balcony. Nice but small with a table and 2 chairs. Very nice lobby Fast efficient pleaseant check in experience (possibly because we were almost the only one's in the hotel:) Clean beach, non-driving area. Pool area had tons of lounge chairs and large pool. Kitchenette: sink, microwave, mini-fridge, granite counters and cabinets. TIP: kitchen only had coffee cups and glasses. Need to buy your own utensils if eating or cooking in. Priceline price for ocean front room was less than any of the other online prices for an ocean view room and I knew ahead of time that I was booking at The Plaza. No blind bidding. They did not charge us for parking because we came at a very low visitor time. We had no trouble parking in the attached garage, but I could see where it would be very troublesome during peak tourist season. BAD THINGS ABOUT THE HOTEL: Small bathroom. Not only that but it had a pedestal sink that made it even worse. Absolutely no counter space. At least a vanity of some sorts would allow you to put a toothbrush on it! Shower needed to have INSTRUCTIONS on how to operate it. Maybe it's just us, but we had to figure out how to make the water come out of the shower head. For those of you not familiar with this type of shower, from what I can remember you have to pull DOWN on the end of the part where the water comes into the bathtub (spicket) and that makes the water come out of the shower. Never saw that before, maybe some of you have. Very weird smell in the room. Not musty per se but just funky. Too bad for such a lovely room. Hubby had to go down several floors to get ice because the ice machine on our floor wasn't working and he said the other floors smell bad as well. I can understand all the hotels on the beach especially if they are old having a musty smell because of the humidity, but this was more than a musty smell. Maybe they should use a nice fresh smelling room deoderizer to as least give the guest a good first impression when they walk in the room. As others have said, air conditioner was very noisy. Even though the controls are on the wall for easy adjusting, the cool air comes from an a/c unit rather than through the duct work. Maybe it just me, but we've never encountered having to use your room key to get ice from an ice machine. Maybe some of you more seasoned travlelers have but it was news to us. Not a problem just a tip to bring your room key with you when you set off to get ice:) The pool was nice but had some algae on the sides. No hot tub:( No kiddy pool area or play things. (that I saw) The "putting green" area and basketball area was not well kept. They should tear that out all together and use it for something else or redo it. A large hot tub area would be nice and might as well throw in a tiki bar:) The shower to the beach area was in disrepair and not what you would expect from such a nice hotel. It looked like it belonged to a low budget hotel. The steps down to the beach and the area around the steps was not very nice either. Not well kept with trash and over growth of weeds. Again, not on par with such a nice hotel. Another bad thing is the inconsistency of the "neighborhood". Good hotels next to not so good hotels and so on. If you look at one of the othere reviewer's pictures you can see one of the not so good looking hotels roof top and balconies right next to the Plaza on the right as you face the ocean. TIP/TOE STUBBING/TRIPPING WARNING: There is a 3" metal bar by the sliding glass door that goes out to the balcony that you have to step over to go out onto the balcony. So please be careful. Do not trip! Your drinks might go flying over the small balcony if you trip:) The area was basically deserted when we were there. So, if you like to have the hotel and beach almost all to yourself, September is a great time to go. But keep an eye on hurricanes since it is smack in the peak of hurricane season. (Which I just found out:). But we timed it perfectly and the weather for our whole Florida visit was perfect in Daytona Beach and Orlando. Hope this helps. Feel free to contact me to ask a question. Will post pictures later. The hotel website pictures are an accurate representation of the rooms. Don't let the bad things I've written scare you from staying here. The goods far outweigh the bads. The bads were merely annoyances and not prohibitives. Although I'm sure there are many better more expensive hotels in the area there are a lot worse if you've checked out any of the other reviews online. For the money, I WOULD stay here again. All in all, it was a very nice experience. /scarlett329

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: MomO3Sons
Reviews.Content: After searching for hours the reviews of The Plaza Resort and Spa, I decided to take my chances and stay here for the Labor Day Weekend. I saw many negative reviews, but when I went to Maui, the hotel I stayed in had a lot of negative reviews and we LOVED it, so I took that into consideration. Well, the negative reviews about The Plaza Resort and Spa were right on. First off, the hotel looks beautiful from the outside and from the lobby. However, when we got to our room, the floor had a musty smell and so did the room. There was ONE towel in the tiny bathroom that also had absolutely no counter space at all. Don't even think about having more than one person in the bathroom. Hubby couldn't take a shower while I was blow drying my hair because the room is so tiny. We have a 3 1/2 month old baby and a 14 year old. Our baby seemed sick on Friday night with post-nasal drip and a cough. Our 14 year old enjoyed the pool, but also felt the room was dirty. Now that we're home, my baby is perfectly fine. Maybe mold in the room? The air conditioner was loud and we could never maintain a comfortable temperature. We were on the 12th floor, and the noise from the motorcycles on A1A was HORRIBLE! Forget a good night's sleep. The beds were NOT comfortable and there were no extra pillows. I always book a hotel with a fitness center, but could not use the gym because the smell was so bad. Okay, that was the DISLIKES. There were a few things I liked. The pool was heated and they have tons of lounge chairs and tables. The tiki bar food was really good, though a bit pricey (which was expected). The location of the hotel is awesome. 1/2 mile from the boardwalk, close to different restaurants, etc. Beach access is great too. The customer service is also really good. The bell hops and front counter people are very friendly and helpful. Overall, this is an okay hotel....NOT a resort and spa type that's advertised. My family and I have traveled a lot and we normally pay for extended check out at every hotel we've stayed in. However, as soon as we woke up this morning, we packed and checked out at 8:30 a.m. to go home. I will not be visiting The Plaza Resort and Spa again.

Reviews.Title: “Plaza Resort: The Perfect Location for a Well Rounded Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JKLA10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are both professionals and when we time off from our very busy jobs, we like to head to Daytona Beach. We have become avid fans of the Daytona Beach area because it is the perfect destination for a well-rounded vacation. He loves motorcycles and chooses to vacation in Daytona because it's a "motorcycle friendly town" and I love the beautiful beaches! So we get the best of both worlds. When we fly down from Ohio, my boyfriend, a huge motorcycle enthusisast, rents a motorcycle from Beach Street Harley Davdison, so we can hop around the Daytona/Flagler/Ormond/Port Orange area. After lots of internet research, we chose the Plaza Resort & Spa because of it's location, amenities and ability to offer us that well-rounded experience that we were looking to achieve. Not only is The Plaza steeped in history as it is Daytona's oldest and grandest hotel, the location is perfect for the both of us. It is close to Main Street where we can experience all of Daytona's famous biker bar watering holes durng the off season.
