In addition, the Plaza is within walking distance when we park the bike at night and enjoy the shops, outdoor concert and numerous restaurants like Bubba Gump's located at Ocean Walk. Walgreens is also across the street and a Dunkin Donuts was easily walkable from the Plaza for a morning stroll to get a good cup of coffee and bagel. The Plaza also has an inhouse store with an assortment of food and beach staples available for purchase. We requested an ocean front room on the 14th floor and got it. The view was breath-taking. Our room was large with a sitting area. The private balcony had table and chairs so we could fully enjoy that ocean front view when we were in the room. Our room was neat and clean. The king size bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. I will agree with other posts that report small bathrooms and lacked counter space to place toiletries or hair appliances--that is one area the hotel could improve. However, the bathroom space was my only complaint. As for me, the beach lover, the Plaza has beautiful two-tiered patios affording awesome views of the Atlantic ocean with lots of lounge chairs and tables with umbrellas and beach access was easy. The lobby is tastefully furnished, elegant and comfortable with beautiful views of the pool deck and beach from every angle. I never used the pool as I was always at the beach! The Plaza's portion of the beach was a no-vehicle access area which was a great plus not not having to deal with cars on the beach. The staff were also very accomodating and we were able to park our motorcycle in a safe, covered patio area which was easily accessible. All in all, the Plaza receives our recommendation for travelers seeking a well rounded vacation experience in a historical hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a little Pricy”
Reviews.Author: sew7770
Reviews.Content: This property was very nice and upscale. The pool area was a little small but was very nice and relaxing. I loved the poolside bar. This trip was for my husband and my first year anniversary and I wanted something oceanfront and a little upsacale. The hotel was perfect for that. The only problem I had was that the prices were overall a little high, but we had a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Quick weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Lori256
Reviews.Content: We made a quick overnight visit to Daytona Beach for a family celebration and stayed here. The old hotel has been updated with nice rooms and a little kitchenette. It would be perfect for families. The pool area was very nice with a snack bar available and the beach is very easily accessible down a flight of stairs. When we checked out on sunday morning there was quite a wait for the elevators with everybody leaving at the same time. The Magnolia Cafe restaurant inside the facility was very nice with a creative southern themed menu. We didn't have time for the spa but it looked very nice. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What's that smell?”
Reviews.Author: Med74
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were on the 12th floor. The entrance was nice but the renovation they keep bragging about was not a great one. They basically slapped some paint on most of the place and you can tell. The elevators were horribly slow and small. The hallway of the 12th floor stunk!! It smelled old and dirty. I could smell it coming in under the door of the room sometimes which was not nice. We could not get the sliding glass door open. Bath was REALLY tiny. Having a fridge and microwave was nice but not worth $165 per night. Pool area was nice. Oceanview means half oceanview and half parking lot or A1A view (depends on what side you are on). Staff was very helpful and friendly..best part. If you want to stay in a LUXURY hotel do not stay here. If you just want a decent place to sleep and chill then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “The Plaza is a great place for a family!”
Reviews.Author: Passengeronthemove
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews for this hotel and was kinda afraid what I may have signed myself up for. However, this hotel was a huge surprise. The plaza is a great hotel for families. It provides a great ambience but yet it has a great family appeal. We stayed in a limited view room and when they say limited view they mean just that. You may be able to see a little bit of the beach but not much. But... if you kids are at the pool or beach all day then a limited view room is exactly what you need. Once again, I thought that this hotel was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't WOW me...”
Reviews.Author: mom2asb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the 4 star hotel... I was disappointed. I researched for a while on where to stay at Daytona Beach. We live about 2 1/2 hours away, and wanted to stay at a "nice" hotel, with 2 queen beds, with a ocean view. I read the reviews, looked at the pictures and decided to book at $200 a night. I have never stayed at such a pricey hotel, but husband said..."book it!" We arrived and checked in with ease. Our luggage was taken up on a cart by a wonderful young man. We came in, the room looked like the picture, I thought I was pretty happy. I looked out the window, we were on the 12th floor, we could view the ocean... but we were right on A1A, noisy. The sliding glass door was a nightmare. I wouldn't slide, got stuck out there a couple of times, and had to have my husband open the door. The microwave didn't work, until I pushed up on the door. The bathroom was very small, no counter space at all to put your makeup and such. The bed's were very comfortable, the pillows were great!! There was a parking shortage for some reason, it was hard to find a place if you left for dinner. The pool was beautiful, and the view from the lobby was very nice. I have to say that the employees were very friendly. I guess we could have gone down and complained, but we are not seasoned travelers, and I really hate to complain. All in all our vacation was nice, but would not stay there again for that price. I guess I just expected a lot for $200 a night. Hope this helps someone. I know that I look to trip advisor and it helps in making a decision.

Reviews.Title: “The Lobby of the Plaza gives off the wrong impression”
Reviews.Author: floridajo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because they portray themselves to be a 4-star hotel. The well-appointed lobby certainly makes it seem that way. The rooms told a completely different story. Our first room was on the third floor and just like another reviewer said, the oceanfront view was laughable. The room was as dark as a cave and it was due to the one, very small windowed door that you had to stand on your tiptoes to see anything. The rooms are set up like Embassy suites with a small living room and an adjoining bedroom. The bedroom had no windows whatsoever, making it very dark. I found this to be strange in an oceanfront hotel. The window on the sliding door was covered in grimy fingerprints and the small balcony outside had about 4 inches of standing water with cigarette butts floating in it. The room wreaked of mildew. We immediately asked for a new room and they accommodated us with a 7th floor room. The view out of the little door was much better but the room was still dirty. The baseboards were filthy, the toilet had not been cleaned and there was a hole in the bathroom door that looked like a fist had gone through it. I immediately opened my laptop and went to my trusty Trip Advisor. Another reviewer had checked out and gone to the Shores. We called the Shores and thankfully, they had openings. The differences in the hotels were like night and day. The Shores service was incredible, the rooms were a dream and it made our stay in Daytona perfect. We were there for a family reunion and a large part of our family stayed at Perry's Edge. This too, was quite a nice hotel, very clean with an expansive yard and many pools. Both hotels were above and beyond The Plaza. To top it off, when we left, the elevator broke down for a few minutes while we were headed to our car in the parking garage. Another thing about the Plaza, there is no valet parking. While in the parking garage, a fight started between 2 women and a man. Even the guests seemed a bit on the rough side. If you are looking for a family-friendly, clean, accommodating hotel, do not stay at the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from The Plaza!!”
Reviews.Author: jennmaybe
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? It began last month when I checked my credit card bill and discovered they never charged me for one night back in Feb., like my confirmation said they would. So, when we arrived, we had to pay for 2 nights, when we had only planned to pay for one night. The front desk said they don't do that anymore and I told them my confirmation said they do, so they need to change it!! Then, the bellman was determined to help us with our luggage. I don't like other people touching my personal belongings like that just because of germs. After someone has touched 100 other pieces of luggage that day, I certainly don't want them touching mine. Then, one bellman didn't even want us using his luggage cart-but we used it anyway. I told him I would go back to the front desk because I was already advised we didn't have to use the bellman. Parking is absolutely terrible! The prior reviews I read about the parking were right on the money! You pay $8 a day for parking, but have to park a mile away! Terrible! Just terrible!!! When we finally got to our room, the air conditioner sounded like a freight train every time it kicked on. It was so bad, that we had to turn it off at night, just so we could sleep. Despite the claim that they are newly renovated, I have to disagree. Our bathroom looked like it hadn't been painted in 20 years-not to mention the holes in the ceiling right over the shower. It was also a very, very, small bathroom. No counter space at all. We had to leave everything in our bag in a chair, because there wasn't even room on the bathroom floor. Then, we discovered you couldn't have coolers on the pool deck. Absolutely ridiculous! My daughter has a medical condition that requires her to have lots of water everyday, but even more in the summer time because of the heat. So, my husband had to constantly go back up to our room everytime to get her bottled water. I was furious! We ended up just going in from the pool. The front desk had no sympathy at all and I told them I would never stay there again. The reply was "ok." I know they don't care because they will always have people to stay there. I still wanted to share my experience so when folks go, at least they will have a head's up on what they may expect.

Reviews.Title: “skip this hoitel”
Reviews.Author: demartino
Reviews.Content: sadly this is not a 4 star expected hotel we booked through hotwire last minute and should of read travel advisor always do usually.... the hotel is very old it had a glorified lobby uplift but thats it.... rooms only ok not the luxury break we were expecting do yourselves a favour skip this hotel.......... janice orlando xxx

Reviews.Title: “Thank God.. The Plaza Saved Us!”
Reviews.Author: evanportwood
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a WONDERFUL weekend in Daytona Beach, FL and it would be a different story if it hadn't been for the Plaza Resort and Spa. We originally booked our stay at the El Caribe. I found favorable reviews, but it wasn't true. We aren't that picky, but it was not what we were looking for my wife's 26th birthday. The Plaza was more than we were looking for and very competively priced. We were able to get into a room that night with no problem and enjoyed the extremely clean facilities and beach. The hotel is a short walk to the pier and also located on a section of beach that vehicles cannot drive on. It was a beautiful weekend and wonderful stay! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Silverfish ugh!”
Reviews.Author: lolo1827
Reviews.Content: Arriving to the hotel we thought it was going to be a pretty nice stay. We arrived on a Thursday, everything was okay, the room was decent. The bathrooms were not clean and I later found out that my husband killed 4 silverfish in the shower! By Friday all he** broke loose. Appearantly they hold a lot of conventions there. This particular weekend it was a metal detector convention with hundreds of metal detector people blocking the view of the ocean. Then the partiers arrived. We were lucky enough to have a room right next to a huge group of young drunk kids. We asked to have our room switched and they were unable to do that because the hotel was so full from all the metal detectors! Needless to say, we were not happy with this resort and moved to another one. And they still charged us the day we left, so we had to pay for two different hotels on the same day. We left and went to The Shores. That place was a dream!

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise!”
Reviews.Author: Farmercal
Reviews.Content: Our decision to stay here was based on an event at the resort. We were given a room at the front of the resort on the 10th floor. We might as well have been sleeping on the street with all the noise echoing from the main drag. The first night we had to try to sleep to the sound of vehicles parading up and down the strip until 3 in the morning. The single paned windows (which were dirty) did little to block the sound. The only thing that masked the sound of the street was the noisy air conditioner which sounded like a plane taking off (which was pleasant when compared to the loud exhausts blaring down the street). The second night, we were used to the street noise but awoke at midnight to people (obviously drunk) out in the hall taking to the top of their lungs and slamming doors. This went on until 3 in the morning in spite to numerous calls to the front desk. The first time I called (after trying to sleep through this for an hour), the attendant replied "again?!" which indicated that more guests had already called and complained. Due to the cracks in the bottom, sides and top of the doors all sounds in the halls echoes into your room. The beds were nice, bathroom suitable, large screen TV with so-so cable reception. I had no problem with the room just the noise. But then again, I stayed there to sleep and that was not possible due the noise problem. I won't make that same mistake again! You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: cmjinidaho
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this property and you can't beat the location on Daytona beach. The hotel and surrounding property was clean. The pool was beautiful overlooking the beach. However, with that being said, this hotel does lack good customer service. I had read another review before we booked about the bad service at this hotel and chalked it up to one person's bad experience. It's true. The front desk does their job, but they certainly don't go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The first night we were there we discovered the sheets were dirty and called down to the front desk to have the bed changed. We waited a half hour for housecleaning to arrive with new sheets and WE had to change the sheets ourselves! And we had a minor problem with the maid on our floor upon leaving the hotel. We took our bags to the car and left some other stuff in the room to retrieve a few minutes later. In those few minutes the maid helped herself to the alcohol we had left in the fridge. She didn't take anything else or clean anything, she just took some beer. My husband had to track her down while cleaning another room and ask for it back. She didn't deny it and gave it back to him, but how bizarre. She knew we hadn't left yet since half our stuff was still in the room. And we were greeted with the same unfriendly attitude upon checking out at the front desk. Thankfully we didn't have to deal with the hotel service much during the week. They don't have a monopoly on the beautiful beach area so next time we will most likely try a different place. For the money you expect better service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: blayton
Reviews.Content: NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL! It is filthy, poorly decorated, and full of trashy tourists. The staff was rude and unprofessional. The hotel was falling apart and smelled of vomit. It was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey for the room”
Reviews.Author: luv2knit
Reviews.Content: All in all, my two night stay was okay, but I thought for the size room I had (king), the rooms were a little pricey and too small. The bed pretty much took up in the entire room and there was little room to move around. Also, the bathroom was way too small for what I would have expected in a "resort." I've had nicer/bigger bathrooms in a Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: From Swanzey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for bike week and as with all the hotels in Daytona they really price gouge for the week...but you have to expect it I guess. Room was beautiful...room 1409...we had two balconies, one oceanfront and the other looking south and we could watch the traffic on Atlantic. Room was clean and beautiful...but on the small side. Not sure why but both the beachfront hotels we stayed at in Florida this year had very small bathrooms...with no counter space. Great service staff and a great breakfast every morning. Bike parking for bike week was in undergroud parking garage and there was even an area set up for washing motorcycles. No hassles getting in and out of the garage like we've had at other Daytona hotels.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: hhefzy
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, nice balcony view. rooms were a bit small but the hotel was charming. staff were really nice; first room smelled like smoke so we asked to switch rooms; they moved us with no questions asked! Has a convenient opening to the beach. I'd stay here again for sure! We got a really good rate on priceline - $85/night.

Reviews.Title: “The Plaza Resort and Spa was very nice”
Reviews.Author: GotMilk2
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Plaza and had a very nice and relaxing stay. The staff was extremely friendly. We had an ocean front view with a king size bed. The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. The pool is heated which was a good thing, since the weather was cool when we were there. I also took advantage of the spa and really enjoyed it. Everyone was so nice and provided excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetladyban
Reviews.Content: Was there on a business trip. The only problem I had was parking, but the attendants on duty assisted me with adequate parking for a person with a disability. Service was great as well as the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room Service hope your not hungry”
Reviews.Author: HAWG4YOU
Reviews.Content: Room service took 1.5 hrs for breakfast to be delivered .They charged an additional $4.00 to every meal, along with 18% tip and $2.00 to bring the food to the room. The worse part is that they charged $20.00 for a large pot of coffee!!! I could of had a bottle of wine for that price. Parking for a motorcycle was $8.00 per day . The shower pressure was so weak, I had to take off the shower head to wash the shampoo out of my hair . The pool, bed and tv were nice and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DBish
Reviews.Content: Place was clean, close to everything, and had charm. Parking was good. Loved the pool and the bar. The overstuffed beds and pillows were nice. The Plasma TV in the room was awesome. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort for just peanuts-again”
Reviews.Author: PerryM2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending Labor Day weekend at the Plaza. This is our second time to the Plaza Resort and it was, again, fantastic. The staff here were fantastic. The hotel is fantastic, the restaurant is fantastic (had the $30 seafood buffet - ate 5 pounds of snow crab legs). In short everything is just fantastic. Parking was fantastic, the front desk folks were fantastic, the pool staff was fantastic and the cleaning staff was fantastic. I don't know if there is a Plaza Resort in a parallel universe because some of the reviews here are for a totally different Plaza than the one we have visited twice now. Our experience can be summed up in just one word - fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Mississauga-Chick
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20 year old son, 14 year old daughter and I drove to Miami Beach and then on to Daytona. We spent the first few days in Miami, but stayed here Aug 21 – 25 inclusive. After reading all the reviews we were a bit nervous about this part of our trip, but I think some people may have confused this with the other Plaza hotel in Daytona. Our stay was excellent and although we had one or two issues they were handled professionally and satisfactorily. Below is my review and while a little long (OK a lot long!), I’ve tried to address all the pertinent areas I could think of. If you’re like me I want to know as much as I can so I can make the determination about the appropriateness of the hotel myself. I hope this and the pictures help. Overall: I found the resort to be relaxed, comfortable and well run. It’s not a five start resort, but it doesn’t claim to be. I’d put it at more of a four star, and it’s comparable to some of the mid-level hotels on Miami Beach. The food in the pool side bar is reasonable when you compare it to the prices on the beach and the boardwalk nearby. Overall, I would stay there again and would recommend it to family and friends. Reservations: Despite finding a great rate on-line, I booked through the phone as I hate giving my credit card number out on-line. When she quoted a different rate than what I found on-line I questioned it. She asked me for the site, validated the rate and matched it while we talked. This is great as usually I’m either forced to book it on-line to get that rate, or I’m asked to book, submit the copy of the lower quote and wait for confirmation of the new rate. Only down side was the 7 days cancellation notice on the lower rate. Check-in: Check-in was quick, easy and we were advised of the location of the parking and amenities upfront. There is a large and comfortable seating area by the check-in where the others in your party (like impatient teens!) can wait while the details are being sorted out. Room: The rooms were neat, clean and well stocked. Each room had 2 comfortable queen size beds (with 4 pillows for each), a plasma flat screen TV facing the beds, a microwave, a mini fridge, adequate kitchen area (with all the cutlery and dishes --- even a mini bottle of dish soap and a full size dish drainer!) a table with 2 chairs, a dresser with 6 drawers (on which the TV stood), a decent size closet and the bathroom. I say rooms as we had one issue around noise and we ended up changing rooms after the first night (more on that later!). The maid service was great and we always had enough linens and toiletries for the four of us in the room without having to make an extra request. The only downside was the noise factor in the first room. Originally we were in a corner, on a lower-level and facing directly on to the main road. This was a problem as the traffic racing up the road at night is noisy (the hotel is right at an intersection) and the corners amplify the sounds. As the windows are single pane, even with the A/C on we could still hear it. So my only suggestion here is to book either ocean view or partial ocean view rooms and make sure you’re higher up. However, the noise from the traffic was not the main reason we moved, but more on that below. Attentiveness: It seems the couple beside us was having some marital issues as they spent the whole night fighting and calling each other names. This was handled well by the hotel. Hotel staff came up, calmed things down and told the couple to quiet down or they would contact the police and have them removed. The staff also checked back to ensure it stayed quiet. My husband and I didn’t comment on it that night as we didn’t want to make a bad scene worse. However, in the morning, we went to the front desk about this and asked to be moved. The desk staff apologized for the disruption and not only moved us, but upgraded our room to a partial ocean view with balcony at no extra charge in an effort to make it up to us! Pool: The pool was clean, the temperature was good, the various depths are clearly posted and it didn’t smell overly chemical like some pools can. There are lounge chairs all around the pool and around the pool area. We never had to fight (or rise extra early) for them. There are also patio sets around the pool and deck area so you can sit under an umbrella at a table and still be near the action. Kids activities are based off of one of these patio sets, so parents can see them while they relax around the pool. Other amenities: There is a gym, laundry and spa all on the same floor as the entrance to the pool/beach area. This was great as it allowed me to get a much needed load of washing done while I worked out, and dry it while I sat by the pool sipping my morning beverage and reading the morning newspaper (countdown timer clearly indicated minutes remaining for each so I could plan accordingly). It’s $2 to wash and the same to dry. Individual soap and Bounce are available in the dispenser in the room, but they are $1 each, so bring your own if you’re planning to do laundry. As well there is a basketball court near the pool area. You do have to get the ball from the front desk, but there is no cost to use it. The main floor has a “mini” store with limited deli style foods. These are over priced, but if you’re looking for convenience cost isn’t always a main considerations. If cost is a concern the Walgreen’s around the corner has groceries as well and at a much cheaper rate, you just need to take the walk. Parking: There is covered and uncovered parking. We used both without issue. While there is an extra charge it’s clearly outlined. It’s self park which is great as you don’t have to wait for (and tip!) a valet! Staff: The desk staff was very polite and helpful. I was never left to wait while they talked among themselves. If I approached with a request while they were talking they stopped, resolved my issue and then returned to their conversation. They were more attentive than some 5-star resorts I’ve stayed at …. Ritz-Carlton included! The pool guy is a love-em or hate-em kind of guy. I liked the twice daily reminders to turn over and endured the lotion sales pitch as it was short. However, he was funny and still treated you well even if you didn’t buy anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: RIguy_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I overall had a very enjoyable experience at the Plaza Resort and Spa. We read all of the reviews before we left and expected an above average experience and we were not disappointed. We had an oceanfront, king room on the 12th floor. The balcony was a little narrow but the view was spectacular. The room itself was very nice and spacious. The mini fridge came in handy as did the microwave. The 42 inch TV was nice but did need to be repaired because it would randomly come on and go off without anyone touching the remote. It is noteworthy that we made the front desk aware of the problem and it was corrected immediately. Some of the reviews we read complained about the size of the bathroom and we agree if there is one drawback to the hotel it is the size of the bathrooms. The bathroom was very small in relationship to the overall size of the room, but was relatively new and very clean, which is no surprise since we returned to the room one afternoon while it was being cleaned and the woman who was cleaning the bathroom was on her hands and knees washing the floor! We found the staff to be very helpful and attentive. It should be noted that except for Friday and Saturday night the hotel was not very crowded. Parking was sufficient and subject to an extra charge which was made clear to us at time of registration. Our only true complaint about the resort was that the morning we were checking out we received our bill under our door. The bill contained a charge for use of the in room safe (approximately $2.00 per day). We did not use the safe and in reading some of the reviews noted that others who have stayed at the hotel were charged for it as well even though they did not use it. We brought it to the attention of the woman working at the front desk and it was immediately corrected. While we were waiting for our ride we overheard at two other guests complain to the front desk about the charge being on their bill even though they did not use the safe. Once again the staff was accommodating, but it is curious why the problem seems to keep occurring. In any event, to summarize things, the facilities and staff are wonderful and I know I will return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: christy3890
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed here last weekend for a long weekend vacation. We are from Sarasota/Longboat Key on the Gulf Coast so we know what resort hotels and luxury hotels are. We had a great time at this hotel. The inside is very beautiful with a nice waiting area and a nice lounge. People have to remember this isn't a newly built hotel so the elevators will be a little slower and the rooms aren't going to be perfect. We thought our room was very nice with the big tv and the bed was VERY comfortable. The counter space is lacking in the bathroom but I wouldn't trade that for the wonderful ocean view we had. We spent a lot of time on our balcony just talking and people watching and looking at the great view. We are in our middle 30s and we enjoyed walking to OceanView for the restaurants and bars and entertainment. I'm not sure what others are talking about in regards to parking issues -- most hotels do charge parking but you forgo the valet fees and tips -- and we found a spot right by the entrance each time we left and returned and that's even with me overhearing the staff say the hotel was sold out that weekend. We had zero issues checking in and out and the staff was very pleasant and helpful. There were always pool chairs available and the pool stayed clean. We liked it so much we are even considering buying one of the units to have when we go over to that coast to vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Qdog5
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why people complain about paying for parking, that is standard at many hotels. This resort was exactly what we expected. We got the room with the ocean veiw. The room was very spacious and clean. Beach access was perfect. Only draw back was food service. Slow , not very good and not many options. But there are planty of other places within walking distance. The rest of the staff was very friendly and accomadating. We will definitely return and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: floridagirl81
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Plaza for a 3 day stint during a 14 day vacation on the Gulf Coast of Florida and were pleasantly suprised but what this hotel as well as other hotels in the same area are doing to help revitalize Daytona Beach. I don't know where the negative reviews are coming from, the only thing I can think of is that they are confusing it with somewhere else. The Plaza is wonderful!! Everyone is friendly, kind and the customer service was better than I have ever received. It was my son's 1st birthday and their catering manager received a call from my Dad back in Michigan asking if it was possible to have a cake and balloons delivered to our room. She went out of her way to find a cake and balloons as well as a card (all offsite I might add) and brought it to our room on a beautiful tray with plates and forks. The pool and views are wonderful, the rooms are very upscale and roomy. The only downside I can even think of were the drink prices at the poolside bar, $7.50 for a tiny drink with a shot of alcohol and the virgin drinks were only a $1.00 less. Definitely not worth the money. Other than that though this vacation was truly made spectacular because of the Plaza Resort and Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible....”
Reviews.Author: prxobabe
Reviews.Content: Terrible, I think this had to be the worst place I ever stayed!!!!Dirty AND musty. This hotel fools you from the outside and from it's details on the net, but when you get there its a whole other story....The pool I have to say is the nicest part of the whole place!

Reviews.Title: “Great part of Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie75
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two night in an oceanfront studio and loved it. The room had 2 queen beds that were very comfortable and a not so comfortable pull out sofa. The kitchenette was great and the refrigerator was much larger than expected. The hotel staff was attentive and very prompt whenever we asked for linens, towels, and room service. The only thing that I would complain about is how slow the elevators are. They are definetely not equipped to handle the amount of patrons in the hotel. Use the stairs if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crysha
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was quite a surprise. The hotel is undergoing some construction and remodeling, but it was not bothersome to the guests. Staff at check-in was polite, efficient, and helpful. I had a room with a partial view of the ocean with a small balcony. The room was roomy and comfortable. The cleaning staff competent, but in need of a bit of help in spottiing dirt and debris. The food has much to be desired. Stay away from the on-site restaurant. The bufett is overpriced and crappy. The little on-site store is a life saver. It has food for breakfast, lunch, and snacks that are reasonably priced. The pool and spa services are great. The hotel is right on the beach and within walking distance of several shops and restaurants situated on "tourist row." Great little hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Lrfuels
Reviews.Content: Very clean and well kept. I feel this was a great value. Beds were as confortable as any that I have ever experienced while travling excepting the Ritz Carlton. Location could not have been better for Daytona Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, EXCELLENT staff”
Reviews.Author: magical127
Reviews.Content: I stayed March 25-27 at the Plaza. I just don't get some of the negative reviews here. Either they are confused about the hotel they stayed in (there is a similar-sounding hotel next door) or the rooms must differ wildly, because this is a beautiful, true 4-star, bordering 5-star hotel. The only negative part had nothing to do with the hotel itself- Orbitz never sent my information to the hotel, so when I got there, they had no idea who I was. After an hour (literally) of both the front desk staff and myself trying to explain to Orbitz what happened and how to fix it (none of the 219 people at Orbitz whom I spoke with had a clue, unfortunately), they finally faxed something to the hotel which still wasn't what they needed, but was good enough to prove I'd actually booked a room and that it was paid for. They checked me in and presumably hashed out the details with Orbitz later. I am very lucky that there was availability- otherwise I may have been out of luck. After talking to one of the bellhops I was told that I was the third person within 24 hours that he'd spoken with that had told him Orbitz had done this to them! What's going on, Orbitz?? The front desk staff was incredibly kind (kudos to Debi and Alexis) and helped me throughout the ordeal. They tried to upgrade my room as a consolation (even though none of this was their fault- they said it was the least they could do) but they didn't have an ocean front available, so I stayed in an ocean view, which is what I was supposed to have. The room was HUGE, complete with microwave, fridge big enough to fit a pizza box in, coffeemaker, all the normal other amenities, huge plasma screen TV, etc. etc.. The spa was lovely though I've had better massage services elsewhere (try the vitamin C facial though, it rocked). The pool was well-maintained and it was a very short walk to the beach (the 'rental' lounge chairs on the beach were a tad tacky though- $20 for 2 chairs and an umbrella for the day? But that isn't run by the hotel.) When it came time to check out at noon, I asked for my bag to be kept until closer to my flight in the evening- I was told I was welcome to stay in my room until it was time to go (there is normally a charge for this but it was one of the same women who helped me through the check-in nightmare and remembered me). Thanks Debi! Tip: If you book on Orbitz, call the hotel 48 hours ahead of time and make sure they know you're coming, otherwise you may have a problem! I would absolutely come here again and recommend this hotel to anyone. Do yourself a favor and book an oceanview or oceanfront room, though, otherwise you may get a lovely view of a parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “What a scam!”
Reviews.Author: maliv1
Reviews.Content: Stay away from The Plaza! The renovation is a joke. What ever happened to service. If these guys were not so busy flipping hotels then maybe they could take manage their business better. Go back to bussing tables.

Reviews.Title: “So very very bad”
Reviews.Author: 55andover
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the same time we bought our tickets for the 24 hours at Daytona Race. I should have done some more research. We were put in a room directly across from the Spa. Outside the Spa is a fountain. The walls were so thin the sound of running water from the fountain kept waking me up thinking there was a water problem. The only time that the running water was not a problem was when the hvac system in the room ran. It was so loud we could not hear the TV unless turned up to the loudest possible volume. We called for room service at 4:59 PM and was told they did not take orders until 5:00 PM. We called the front desk and asked for a room service menu. They assured us one would be sent down. Never arrived. Finally ordered dinner which took 45 minutes to be delivered without our drinks. The drinks arrived forty five minutes after the meal. The bathroom was the size of a telephone booth. No space for cosmetics. But, they did use the shelves for artful displays of towels and their spa products. We did try the Cafe off the lobby. The service was mediocre. The food was ok. All the patrons (all of three couples) were having a quiet dinner when a female employee began walking through making several loud comments shouting into the kitchen and then back to the hostess stand. The sliding glass doors to the patio outside had a broken lock so the security system supplied was a stick. On the positive side, the room itself was large with a very nice TV and had a nice kitchenette. Our room was cleaned by a very nice gentlemen who seemed to work around the clock. When we checked out early, the front desk was not pleasant saying that no one had ever complained about the thin walls or the running water from the spa fountain. How many people have to complain to make it a "real" problem?

Reviews.Title: “Plaza Resort”
Reviews.Author: CBE&LME
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Daytona hoping to find a finer and cleaner establishment than last time. The Plaza Resort & Spa exceeded our expectaions. The staff was efficient and professional. The maid service was exceptional and prompt. The oceanfront room was very accomodating & roomy with a comfortable pillow top bed and many soft pillows. It is centrally located with great beach access. We will stay here again while in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Nobody could complain about the experience I had”
Reviews.Author: lewisVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Plaza over Thanksgiving weekend, Friday to Tuesday. It was recommended by a friend who knew the town, but I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews here. Well there was absolutely nothing wrong with my stay. The room was exactly as shown when I booked it. Ocean front, private balcony. It was clean, the whole hotel showed no signs of dirt or repair. The room itself was oversized from a typical hotel. It had a nice two-seater couch, coffee table, very comfortable king size bed, mini fridge and microwave. Oh, and a great plasma screen TV. I had a great stay, the hotel was pretty empty and exactly the type of quite getaway I was looking for. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain”
Reviews.Author: Teresuzza
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Tuesday to Friday. Overall, our stay was quite pleasant. The front desk staff was very pleasant. Our room was oceanfront and on the 12th floor. It was very clean. I must admit that the hotel hallways are a little musty smelling and the carpet is worn in several areas. The 42" plasma in the room was quite nice and internet connection was very easy and convenient. The doors are raggedy as another traveller has already mentioned. The pool area was always clean and while we were there, there weren't a lot of people so it felt like we had the place to ourselves. Pool towels were not good at all. You needed two to cover the chair and they were thin and small. The hallways need some sprucing up and the bathrooms are small. The rooms are nice and spacious - the row of rooms on our end of the hallway were probably the biggest. Parking was convenient - right out front - for a small daily fee. Overall, this is probably a 3 star at best. It is pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: K9Family
Reviews.Content: Sometimes people just have bad experiences when they travel. All I read about before booking here was how rude the staff was, and that people always had things messed up. My husband and I had a much different experience here. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very nice to us. Parking was a non-issue. Maybe because we didn't book around an event or holiday. Also, I can see where employees would get a little annoyed at guests. We watched a young family eating their lunch in the lobby, in wet bathing suits, which is supposedly not allowed, and then they left all of their trash and uneaten food to go back to the pool. Our room was on the 5th floor, oceanfront, and it was wonderful. It was nice and big with our bedroom in a seperate area with a huge bathroom, along with a jacuzzi tub and walk in shower. We actually had 2 bathrooms in our room, and a small kitchen with dining area. The bed was SOOOOO comfortable. Even though our room was next to the elevator, we never heard it. We liked being on the part of the beach that was a no drive zone. There are a few things that weren't so great, but the good outwayed the bad. The balcony was small and we were in the inside corner of the building which didn't allow much privacy if you wanted to sit outside and enjoy the evening or a morning cup of coffee. The restaurants were a little pricey but the food was good. The housekeeping services were hit and miss, sometimes our room wasn't even attended to until late afternoon, with some items not replaced (fresh towels). The area in which this hotel is, along with other resorts, needs to be cleaned up. I felt safer walking the beach than the street out front at night. The spa staff was very nice, although my nail appointment that should have only taken about 45 minutes took twice as long and it wasn't that good. But hey, I tried it. Someone said to try the Veranda Lounge, and we did. We found the "balcony" and enjoyed the ocean breeze and the sunset with an evening cocktail. With all that said, we will come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I expected”
Reviews.Author: reesenikka
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, the lobby was pretty and the staff in the cafe/store were great. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Otherwise it wasn't worth the money. The door to the room was ragedy, it needed to be renovated. Some doors were nicely done but ours wasn't. The balcony was extremly small. In the evening there wasn't any parking in the garage and we had to pay for parking. They told us to park in the employee lot under the hotel. Someone tried to break into my boyfriends' car (luckily he has a high powered alarm so it scared them away). The people at the front desk had a little attitude at check in. The room was really small. The walls were thin so we heard our neighbors and every passing car outside (and we were on the 11th floor and we could still hear everything!) It definitely wasn't worth the money. I would suggest the Hilton if you want better quality.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: jcampo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel only a couple of weeks before our trip by word of mouth and looking up info on the internet. This hotel is very convenient to all of the coming and goings near the famous Boardwalk. Walk on road or beach 10 minutes or less. Parking is convenient to building access $7 per day. We arrived at 1p.m. on a Friday and were immediately checked in and given keys at this time. The bellman even followed our car out to the parking garage, unloaded our things and brought them to our rooms. The rooms are very roomy and clean with a balcony that has chairs to sit out an enjoy the ocean. The pool deck is nicely landscaped with lots of room. There is a pool bar with a lunch menu to order from. I only wish that they stayed open a bit later I was looking for a pina colada by the pool at 7pm but they were closed. I then settled for a diet Coke and some ice cream from the market in the lobby (don't miss it diagonally across from the front desk). The spa is very accomidating (sp) but our 50 minute couples massages were from check in to check out only 45minutes. They do let you return any time during the day to use the steam room and jacuzzi. The hotel has old Florida charm very beautifully decorated and all of the staff was very friendly. My family and I will definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: ezell
Reviews.Content: My family's stay at the Plaza Resort and Spa was not satisfactory at all. Yes the room was nice with 2 queen beds and a flat screen tv, but the balcony was horrible. The roof over part of the pool deck was littered with trash and even someone's boxer shorts. There were no chairs to sit out and enjoyed view though we asked for them several times, the front desk said they would send some up as soon as possible, but never did. We also killed 2 large beatles in our room. The staff was rude and no help at all. The impression I got was that they were trying to sell the hotel as condos, they gave you a booklet in your room but no hotel directory. They had 3 very small elevators, always either full or not working. We took the stairs most of the time. I would never reccomend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service, Nice Facility”
Reviews.Author: JALJS
Reviews.Content: While the Plaza is a lovely facility at a great location, the service that my family experienced continued to get worse with each day. The rooms, the lobby, the Veranda lounge, the pool deck and the snack shop inside the lobby were all very nice and convenient. However, with the exception of only 2 individuals, the service that I received was absolutely the worst I have ever experienced. One evening, we went to the hotel restaurant, The Magnolia Cafe, for dinner at approximately 6:45pm. We placed our meal orders and after waiting for 45 min, our waiter arrived at our table to say that there was a problem and that the cook had not received our dinner order. After waiting another 45 minutes for our meal to be prepared, (with no offer to bring a plate of fries or appetizer for starving and impatient children) the waiter suggested that we take our order "to go". Funny that he recommended this at closing time. Since I didn't feel like the waiter apologized for the "mix-up" and that he had not attempted to make things better, I promptly called the restaurant manager and left her a message with the details of my experience the same evening. However, upon check out 2 days later, I indicated that I wanted to speak with the manager prior to paying my bill. The manager wasn't available until noon (check out is at 11am) and thus, her boss approached me at the front desk with his voice raised and asked me why on Earth was I "just now saying that I had received bad service, 2 days after that fact!" He yelled so loudly that all of the other patrons in the lobby stopped to stare. He continued to badger me and never once asked me for any of the details of the experience. He just continued to verbally attack me with his voiced raised and tried to make me feel like I was in the wrong. There is absolutely no excuse for how I was treated. I kept my cool and indicated that I preferred to resolve the issue with his restaurant manager when she arrived at noon. She was the only redeeming part of my experience. (The Veranda Loung bartender was very nice too) She apologized, and made every attempt to make things better. However, I don't think there is anything she could have done to erase how horribly I was treated by her boss. I will never stay here again. I have visited Daytona Beach 3 times in the past 5 years and I agree with other posts. This year the city felt less safe with an increase in homeless and it was a noticable difference from my past visits. Not sure why this has occurred, but as a single mother traveling with her children, I did not feel safe outside at night in the area around the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Hit!”
Reviews.Author: NCBluesy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our stay at the Plaza Resort and Spa (June 2006), and we loved it! We had an oceanfront studio with a King-sized bed on a corner room. We awoke each morning to awesome views, with one balcony facing the ocean and one balcony facing down the beach (with a view of the famous Daytona Beach Bandshell). The bed, with its pillowtop mattress, was the most comfortable either of us had ever slept in, and we wanted to bring it back home. My husband loved the huge television, and I enjoyed the mini-kitchen. It was just the right size for us, with a good-sized fridge, a microwave, sink, coffee-maker, and lots of cabinet storage. We had a comfortable sofa and chair in the sitting area. The bathroom was small, as mentioned by other reviewers, but it was big enough. The pool area was gorgeous and immaculate, the water temperature was warm, and the staff members there were friendly. We appreciated that staff did not allow guests to “reserve” beach chairs by placing towels on the chairs early in the morning. We’ve run into this problem often at beach resorts. We had breakfast one morning in the interior restaurant. It was a bit slow, but good. The restaurant staff went the extra mile for us in creating a meal that was suitable for our Atkins diet, but not explicitly listed on the menu. The store was great! We were thrilled to find they sold medicines, snacks, paperbacks, beer, wine – just about anything a traveler might need. I went down once asking to purchase extra coffee and Splenda for the in-room coffee pot, and the young lady just GAVE me a handful of supplies. The hotel is in an excellent location, just across the street from a Walgreens and an I-HOP, with several other restaurants within a block or two. Within two blocks is the new OceanWalk Resort, along with all the restaurants and movie theaters that go along with that area (like Bubba Gump’s Shrimp). We walked down the beach to that area and it was incredibly busy, so I was grateful for our quieter, more peaceful spot at the Plaza. As with any travel, we did have a couple of minor complaints. Upon arrival we were booked into the wrong type of room. Rather than an oceanfront suite, we were sent to a standard double with no view. But the front desk quickly righted the situation when I provided documentation of our long-standing reservation. I misunderstood the free Wireless Internet, thinking it was available in all the rooms rather than just in the lobby. There was a dataport in the room for high speed Internet, but there was a surcharge for this service. We appreciated the underground parking, but didn’t see the need for a $7 per day surcharge for this. I’d rather pay the $7 a day extra on the room and be told the parking was free! I never did find the hotel’s jacuzzi – I suppose it was in the Day Spa area, but that looked closed at night. There was an elevator with a mind of its own, that one day refused to let us off on certain floors. But that was good for a laugh and was nothing serious. Overall, we were thrilled with our stay and would definitely return to the Plaza Resort and Spa. Because we have family in the area, we travel to Daytona regularly so we are familiar with area hotels and resorts. We know from experience that some of them look much better on the Web than they do in person. Our stay at the Plaza Resort and Spa was as nice, if not nicer, than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed - Some Issues Though”
Reviews.Author: LTBW
Reviews.Content: This is an above average hotel in what has become a depressed area of Daytona Beach. The Plaza is located on the non-driving area of the beach about two blocks north of the boardwalk. It's an easy walk to the band shell and Oceawalk shops/restaurants whether you walk the beach or along Atlantic Ave. We booked the Plaza after we were unable to get a room at the Hilton which is right down the block and stayed Thursday through Monday. The hotel is on par with higher end national hotel chains. Lobby is spacious and clean. Room sizes are above average and have recently been remodled. The king bed was exceptional. 42" plasma TV is a nice touch. Our suite included a full size fridge and full kitchen. All of the fixtures and appliances were top notch. Staff was courteous and responsive at all levels. This property can be had for a bargain for high-end accomodations right on the beach. Our rate for a suite averaged less than $150/night. Don't book over the phone though. After booking our first room over the phone, my wife found a better rate (20% less) on the hotel's web site. When we called to try to get this rate for the already-made reservation, we were told that the lower rate was only valid for internet reservations which meant we had to cancel one reservation and make a new one. Some things to be aware of: Drinks in the hotel bar and pool-side are expensive (even bu hotel bar standards). Use the buy-one-get-one coupon in the TravelHost magazine found in the room. One hidden gem at this hotel is the Veranda Lounge. It's hard to find (located off the lobby behind the lobby bar and down the hall), but offers the opportunity to sit in an Adirondack chair on the terrace and watch the waves roll in. Things we didn't like and can be improved upon: 1) The pool deck area was atrocious by the end of the day - littered with cups, cans, cig butts, paper french fry boats etc. It was frustrating to see a staff memeber dedicated to guarding the towel bin al day, but no one to walk the pool deck and pick up trash! 2) If you book a balcony room, bring an umbrella.....unless you're on the top floor. Water from the air conditioning units on the balconies above constantly leak and run down to the balconies below. Luckily, our corner suite had two balconies, becasue one of them was completely useless due to the constant running water raining down. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel. Be aware though that this is not your father's Daytona Beach. Atlantic Avenue is very depressed right now with dozens of vacant businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Surprise”
Reviews.Author: krystynlo
Reviews.Content: I found out last-minute that I needed to go to Daytona Bike Week this year for work. If you're at all familiar with bike rallies, you know that rooms sell out weeks in advance, and a lot of hotels will only sell you rooms with a minimum stay (of four or five nights). I was looking for one room for one night just one week before one of the biggest bike events in the country. So maybe it's because my expecations were low that I enjoyed my (very brief) stay here so much. I found it clean and comfortable, and within walking distance of everything I needed. The one snag was check-out; the clerk for some reason took FOREVER checking me out and charged me parking (even after the cab driver came in to tell me he was waiting for me outside, and took my bag). And the weekend breakfast buffet wasn't anything to write home about. But overall, I had no complaints as it turned out.

Reviews.Title: “Crummy Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not once during my stay did I get the feeling that anyone on staff cared about me as a guest. The disappointment began when I checked in and was told that although I booked and paid for two ocean front rooms, they didn't have any available and could only give me two ocean view rooms. No one apologized nor was I offered anything for my inconvenience until I asked for compensation. If the Plaza is going to market themselves as a premier property, they should train their staff to treat their customers like other premier hotel properties. No staff member at the front desk or in the restaurant smiled, made eye contact or acted like they cared one way or the other that we were there. I will say that the furnishings in the room were nice and the bed was very comfortable. However, the bathroom is very small and not functional in that there was very little room to set anything. I will not stay there again nor would I recommend the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “This is the ONLY place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at the Ivanhoe (Ivan-Don't). The place was the pits and we spent our first day in Daytona driving up and down the shoreline to find a better place. We found the Plaza Resort and Spa and reserved a room for a week. The place has just undergone major renovations. It was gorgeous, several bars, nice room service selection, and I went to the Spa for tanning, haircut, massage, and a manicure. It was affordable and relaxing. I'm 27 and I think the average age of the Daytona Beach visitor was like 15...so I wouldn't go back, but if you need a place to stay the Plaza is the ONLY way to go.

Reviews.Title: “A totally different experience”
Reviews.Author: workingdad
Reviews.Content: This is not the same Plaza Resort & Spa as a year ago. The rooms have been completely redone with comfy bedding, new furnishings, and the flat screen TV in my room was huge! Everything about this hotel has changed. The Plaza may be one of the best-kept secrets on the Atlantic. After a day at the beach, the spa on the first floor was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited THE SPA for a BRIDAL PARTY and it was THE MOST HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE i've ever encountered.The best advice i could give,if you happen to reseve a service and for some reason you have to change that service get A NAME CONFIRMATION AND MANAGER TO RECONFIRM. We took our bride to be here for a SURPRISE,and because she was unaware that shes going she had a manicure and pedicure done the day before. These people made us pay all of her services even though they never did them. They never offered to give her a gift certificate to do them later or nothing.They also charged us for a 50 min massage and actually only gave her a 30 min. Then on top of all this they were in our faces badgering us telling us they believed thier employees_basically calling us liars adn all this in front of customers. We didn't want to make a huge deal in front of customers so we sucked it up and payed about 435$ for services we never got....THINK ON THAT

Reviews.Title: “Distressed and embarassed at the Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to the spa in this hotel for a day of pampering before my friend's wedding day. We were a bit late, but called to warn them of that. From the moment we walked in the door it was nothing but problems. We had called weeks earlier to cancel services and one person who could not come. The office had no record of this, and consequently said that we would be charged for this anyway. My friend who had made all the arrangements was in tears the entire time because she is the one whose credit card they had and would be charged for everything. The staff cornered my friend while she was getting a pedicure to get her to pay the bogus fees, in front of many other spa customers, totally embarassing us all. Ladies and gentlemen, if you are going to this place, just know, that the customer is WRONG here. They did not believe that we called and canceled, it was their word against ours and they believed the employees. We were charged for 300$ of services that we did not receive!!! When I called the manager the next day he was very nice and said he would take care of it, but after 5 days of waiting he said that he looked into it and that we are wrong and will not be reimbursed. Do not go to this hotel or spa. Terrible customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Updated Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Plaza Resort & Spa for a recent visit, on a Sunday and Monday night. My room was by far the nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in. I understand that they recently have updated all of the rooms, and this was definately 5-star quality. Plush carpets, thick sheets, and fantastic beds made everything really comfortable. Every room now has it's on 42-inch PLASMA televison! I don't even think the Ritz-Carlton has that... Nice kitchenette with fridge, sink, microwave, coffee maker, and stove. Front Desk service was fantastic, had a profesional young man dressed in a suit check me in... Very warm and friendly. Would definately return... For those whom have given poor ratings, this is like a brand-new hotel now... You should check it out, you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “no regrets”
Reviews.Author: bstman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plaza while on family vacation. We had made no reservations because we were staying with relatives and at the last minute decided to spend the remaining part of our vacation on the beach. This was our first trip to Daytona so we knew nothing about the hotels or resorts. The room we had (on the 14th floor) was nice. The beds were comfortable and the room was good size with excellent view of the water. Our room was very clean and updated. We did have some trouble with the sliding glass door-hard to open and close. The housekeeping service was good. Check-in and out was quick and everyone was friendly. The pool area was very nice. The elevators are another story. Waited very long for elevators and they were hot. We had a nice stay here, not five star by any means, but it was nice and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “The very Definition of Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you don't pay for a room(on business) you're not as critical. I didn't, and so I'm not critical, nor am I overjoyed at stay. Positives: friendly staff, cute bartender, nice lobby and elevators, really clean bathroom, GREAT Spa, beachfront view, balconies, fridges for free, quiet place!and a mini-deli with some handy treats. Negatives: unfinished projects( Like part of lobby floor torn up), pool bar not open enough, pool area a bit in need of some first class touches (better chairs, attendants), gloomy overall feel to the hotel, restaurant had plates of food on display that discouraged rather than encouraged, shortcuts taken in room cleaning (sheets weren't changed everynight, rusty balcony door slides). I would recommend the Daytona Hilton! If you have to stay at the Plaza, it isn't as bad as the reviewers on line say it is. The "Resort" part is misleading. It's a decent place to stay. AVERAGE all around

Reviews.Title: “Did not like the plaza rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jewel4926
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before going to the plaza for one night. I decided to give it a try since it was supposedly renovated.. hah, hah, hah. I would not stay there again and would not recommend it. The carpet was dirty. The tub was horribly dirty and we could not use it. The hotel needs serious remodeling. I was misled and so disappointed. I could not wait to get out of there. Now, the good part. The lobby, pool and view is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went here for a rest and relaxation trip after a long school year. I have never been to such a disgusting hotel. Oh yeah the lobby and outside looks like a million dollar hotel but once you step into the hallways, the smell is horrible. I thought maybe its just because of the ocean. When we got into our room there was a dead bug on the floor, dirty carpet, couldnt go out on the patio, unflushed toilet, unmade bed, and the door to the room didnt lock. Went downstairs to change and lady at desk just handed me a key and kept talking on the phone. Moved us to a suite we though ok this is better. While the room was a lot bigger it still looked dirty with filthy carpets, old rusted microwave. Still not wanting to complain we said okay until our second night. My friend kept saying it looked like rat feces on the bed but we were convinced she was exaggerating and that it was lent, until the rat scurried across the room. I was appalled. Went down to front desk he said no manager was on duty and all he could do was move us to another room. So at 3 in the morning we're packing up and moving to another room with no help from the hotel. The next mornin I go talk to the front desk manager and she tells me she'll give me one nights stay off but thats the most we'll get because usually they only give half of one nights stay off. I was completely ticked to hear her talking as if she were really doing me a favor. But they werent about to get over on me so I contacted the general manager and we got our entire stay free. He did a good job but i wouldnt recommend anyone stay her EVER.

Reviews.Title: “don't have your wedding there!”
Reviews.Author: zivota
Reviews.Content: If you want to have your reception there, don't expect personable service. The banquet room tables were not set up the way we wanted...even the food was wrong! It was a little embarressing to see cheap looking green beans at our buffet line! All of our expensive roses imported from Brazil and our unity candle were stolen from the staff after our wedding...not just that, most of our guests' credit card numbers were stolen as well, after making their reservations! They claim to have a spa and a salon so my bridal party can get ready....but the coordinator did not tell me that I have to book it months in advance...I tried to book it 2 months before the wedding and they said the one and only hairdresser they have will be on vacation...they didn't try at all to accomodate me by maybe getting another hairdresser...talk about customer service for the money we spent. Overall we tried to make the best of it. Hopefully they have new management since then.

Reviews.Title: “We will never return.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since most of the hotels are closed due to the hurricanes we were stuck here.... The room was VERY dirty!! And in much need of repair! For a hotel that was supposed to be recently updated, our room must have not been included. The hotel smelled of mold! Some is to be expected due to the major water damage from the hurricanes. Daytona Beach is in much need of a 5 star hotel, maybe the Hilton will win this one since they bought the Adams Mark....

Reviews.Title: “Avoid The Plaza Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: MichiganTravelerz23
Reviews.Content: My sister and I visited this area recently. Our 1st nights lodging was at the above mentioned hotel. In its day, I think this was a nice hotel, but it isn't any longer. The hotel is being converted to condos shortly, so repairs, cleaning and return business is of no importance to management. The area is questionable too--boarded up businesses and questionable character hanging around. This was not an inexpensive hotel and payment was required when the reservation was made. Now I know why. The people were nice enough, but there are so many nice hotels around, avoid this one! I think that the newer hotels are on the southern end of the beach. I would try that area instead.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wedding EVER! (Don't believe the lies)”
Reviews.Author: bristolxyz
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding there about a month ago, and it was the best. Everyone bent over backwards to make sure it went off great! The weather didn't work out, but hey.. Make sure to go and look at the SPA downstairs, it's great. We went twice while we were there for 4 days. The food at Magnolia's was good (breakfast buffet was the best).

Reviews.Title: “They ruined my wedding!! (Mold & rats live at the Plaza)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hurricane Frances ruined my wedding on 09/04/04, but when I came back to reschedule another wedding date they told me Nov. 20th was open. Now that I have told all my guests flying in from all over the country to make the arrangements for that date they have decided now that not all the banquet space that I orginally planned is not available. Accommodations We saw a suite and there was MOLD GROWNING ON THE WALLS. I dropped off some goody bags with candy that were to be given to my guests.-RATS got into the bags.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a dump!!! Four star hotel, no way. The hotel room carpet had cigarette burn holes, the dresser drawers were broken (my husband had to fix them), the carpet was severly stained (looked like old blood stains), and the balcony was taped off and unusable because the concrete was missing. All this and we were charged $120 for a one night stay. The bathroom was so small that only one person could be in there at a time. The wallpaper was peeling off of the walls. Also, they say they have a jacuzzi- it is open mon-sat and closes at 6 p.m. Ever heard of that???? The web sites like Travelocity, etc need to actually stay at these hotels before rating them so highly.

Reviews.Title: “the best time ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: it was the best time ive ever had the spa was great the pool was great and the housekeeping was great and it is on the beach its quiet fun and relaxing
